lorebooks.name: Eeveelutions Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description:
Just saying, these are based on what I've seen people give them in R34 and e621.

The original lorebook gave them more anatomically correct genitals, though this fork is more based on how they tend to be drawn. Male EVs still have ze canine genitals though female EVs have more humanlike genitals. (which is what I tend to see artists give them most)

Also fuck you, -60% eevee populations for you.

This Lorebook will not contain information about The Eeveelution's moves, mostly physical information describing the Pokémon.
lorebooks.description: Ze Eeveelutions lorebook!
lorebooks.creator: TripwireOM

1.name: Rarity
1.content:
<Rarity>
Since gen 5, Eevee and eeveelution populations have majorly decreased by 60%, making them very rare, they were uncommon even back then. While eevee and it's evolved forms aren't really decreasing in populations, its pretty unknown why this happened.
</Rarity>

2.name: Eevee
2.content:
Elemental Type: [Normal]
Information: [Eevee is a small, mammalian, quadrupedal Pokémon with primarily brown fur. The tip of its large, bushy and fluffy tail and its large furry neck fluff are cream-colored. If an Eevee is female, the cream colored fur on the tip of their tail is heart patterned. Very long, thin, fox-like ears extend from the top of their head. They have brown sclera, a darker brown iris color, and a small black nose on the tip of their snout. It has short, slender legs with four small toes and a pink paw pad on each foot. Eevees are similar to canines, mainly foxes, and are quadrupedal, meaning they stand on all four legs, and lack opposable thumbs. They are about 1 foot tall when standing straight on all fours. Most Eevees weigh around 14.3 pounds, or 6.5 kilograms.]
Speech: [Eevee is a Pokemon, meaning their spoken vocabulary only consists of their name, as well as variations of their name, though Eevee vocalizations are usually high-pitched. Eevee can vaguely understand human speech, they just can't speak the human language. They just communicate primarily through non-verbal actions like body language. Showing in some way rather than telling. Some variations of the Eevee name include: "Eeivui", "Eevui", "Eevoi", "Vee", "Vui", "Vai", "Voi", "Eva", "Iébui", "Ei", "Iévui".]
Evolution: [An Eevee has an unstable genetic makeup that suddenly mutates due to its environment. If an Eevee's trainer manages to acquire one, the radiation from various Stones known as "Evolution Stones" causes this Pokémon to evolve upon contact. Eevee has 8 different Pokémon it could evolve into: Vaporeon, Jolteon, Flareon, Espeon, Umbreon, Leafeon, Glaceon, Sylveon.]
Gender Ratio: [87.5% female / 12.5% male]
Genitals: [Eevee's genitals are similar to canines, adding to their fox-like similarities. Female Eevee vaginas have a slit vulva that look almost identical to that of a human vaginal structure. Male Eevee penises are chisel-tipped and knotted at the base, which they can tie with something they penetrate. Their penises are retracted into a penile sheath, which they push out of these sheaths when aroused. Their sheath and balls are rather conspicuous and easily visible from behind.]

3.name: Vaporeon
3.content:
Elemental Type: [Water]
Information: [Vaporeon is a Pokémon that shares physical traits with both aquatic and land animals. Vaporeon's body is light blue with a dark blue marking around its head and a spiky ridge down its spine. It doesn't have any fur on its body. It has entirely black eyes, and a tiny black nose. There is a white fin encircling its neck and three fins with cream-colored webbing on its head. Two of these fins are on either side of its head, similar to ears; and one is directly on top of its head, resembling a dorsal fin. Vaporeon is a quadruped with three small toes on each foot and dark blue paw pads on the hind feet. Its tail resembled cetacean tails, with a split tail fin at the end. It can detect moisture with its fins, which vibrate when sensing incoming rain. It has gills, so it can breathe underwater. With cells similar to water molecules, it could melt in water. When it decides to "melt" it's practically invisible in water, and can pull itself back together from this melted state when it pleases. An average Vaporeon stands on all four legs at 3 feet and 3 inches. On average, it weighs around 63.9 pounds, or 29 kilograms.]
Speech: [Vaporeon is a Pokemon, meaning their spoken vocabulary only consists of their name, as well as variations of their name, though Vaporeon vocalizations are usually high-pitched. Vaporeon can vaguely understand human speech, they just can't speak the human language. They just communicate primarily through non-verbal actions like body language. Showing in some way rather than telling. Some variations of the Vaporeon name include: "Vap", "Poreon", "On", "Por", "Vapor", "Pore". It has also been recorded making meowing noises, somewhat of a high pitched "Mrow" sound, as well as yelping.]
Evolution: [An Eevee must touch a Water Stone to evolve into Vaporeon. Vaporeon doesn't evolve.]
Gender Ratio: [87.5% female / 12.5% male]
Genitals: [Vaporeon's genitals are similar to cetaceans. Both genders make use of genital slits. Female Vaporeon vaginas are vertical genital slits on the underside of the base of where their tail begins. Male Vaporeon penises are tapered and slightly prehensile. Their penises are normally retracted into their genital slit like a sheath, which they push out of the slit when aroused.]

4.name: Jolteon
4.content:
Elemental Type: [Electric]
Information: [Jolteon is a quadrupedal, mammalian Pokémon. It is covered in yellow fur with a spiky fringe around its tail and a white ruff around its neck. Its ears are large and pointed with black interiors, and its eyes and small nose are black. Jolteon's muzzle, its face and snout, grew slightly longer compared to the Eevee it evolved from, seemingly to increase the area it can bite with, albeit barely noticeable due to such small length increase. It has slender legs and small paws, each with four toes and a pink paw-pad. Jolteon creates electricity using an organ in its lungs. It can also generate low-level electricity in its cells, which is amplified by the negative ions it gathers and generates in its fur, allowing it to discharge 10,000-volt lightning bolts when at maximum capacity. Jolteon's fur is actually pretty fluffy and soft despite what it would seem. It is capable of launching its fur at enemies when agitated or startled; the charge is so powerful that it can remain on the shed fur for a long time. Its high-strung nature and tendency toward mood swings can make it difficult to train. The crackling sound of electricity can be heard while Jolteon exhales during intense activities. It's hard to pinpoint on whether Jolteon is more feline, more vulpine or more canine, though it can vary from Jolteon to Jolteon. Typically smaller and nicer Jolteons are more feline and cute, while larger and more mighty Jolteons are more canine and awesome. An average Jolteon stands on all four legs at 2 feet and 7 inches. On average, it weighs around 54 pounds, or 24.5 kilograms.]
Speech: [Jolteon is a Pokemon, meaning their spoken vocabulary only consists of their name, as well as variations of their name, though Jolteon vocalizations are usually somewhat high pitched. Jolteon can vaguely understand human speech, they just can't speak the human language. They just communicate primarily through non-verbal actions like body language. Showing in some way rather than telling. Some variations of the Jolteon name include: "Jol", "Jolt", "Eon". It also is recorded making loud, yet breathy cheering noises when it's pleased.]
Evolution: [An Eevee must touch a Thunder Stone to evolve into a Jolteon. Jolteon doesn't evolve.]
Gender Ratio:  [87.5% female / 12.5% male]
Genitals: [Jolteon's genitals are similar to canines, adding to their fox-like similarities. Female Jolteon vaginas have a slit vulva that look almost identical to that of a human vaginal structure. Male Jolteon penises are chisel-tipped and knotted at the base, which they can tie with something they penetrate. Their penises are retracted into a penile sheath, which they push out of these sheaths when aroused. Their sheath and balls are rather conspicuous and easily visible from behind.]

5.name: Flareon
5.content:
Elemental Type: [Fire]
Information: [Flareon is a mammalian, quadrupedal Pokémon covered in short, reddish-orange fur. It has long ears with black interiors, dark eyes, and a small black nose. There are three small toes and a yellow paw pad on each foot. Fluffy yellow fur forms a small tuft on its head, as well as its bushy tail and a mane around its chest and neck. Flareon's body temperature is caused by its internal flame sac, and rises when it is excited. If its body gets too hot, it will fluff out the fur on its collar to cool down. Flareon stores and heats inhaled air in its flame sac, and then exhales it as fire with temperatures of around 3,100 °F (1,700 °C). Flareon's average body temperature is around 1,300-1,500 °F (700-800 °C), but it can reach 1,700 °F (900 °C). Despite the extremely high body temperature, it is safe to touch, albeit warm or hot to the touch, however high its body temperature is. It is an omnivore that roasts either Berries or prey before consumption. Flareon has a curious personality. An average Flareon stands on all four legs at 2 feet and 11 inches. On average, it weighs around 55.1 pounds, or 25 kilograms.]
Speech: [Flareon is a Pokemon, meaning their spoken vocabulary only consists of their name, as well as variations of their name, though Flareon vocalizations are usually somewhat high pitched. Flareon can vaguely understand human speech, they just can't speak the human language. They just communicate primarily through non-verbal actions like body language. Showing in some way rather than telling. Some variations of the Flareon name include: "Flare", "Lare", "Eon", "Fla", "Flay". It has also been recorded making other fox-like noises when it is pleased.]
Evolution: [An Eevee must touch a Fire Stone to evolve into a Flareon. Flareon doesn't evolve.]
Gender Ratio: [87.5% female / 12.5% male]
Genitals: [Flareon's genitals are similar to canines, adding to their fox-like similarities. Female Flareon vaginas have a slit vulva that look almost identical to that of a human vaginal structure. Male Flareon penises are chisel-tipped and knotted at the base, which they can tie with something they penetrate. Their penises are retracted into a penile sheath, which they push out of these sheaths when aroused. Their sheath and balls are rather conspicuous and easily visible from behind.]

Extra Information: [Hey guys, did you know that in terms of companionship, Flareon is objectively the most huggable Pokemon? While their maximum temperature is likely too much for most, they are capable of controlling it, so they can set themselves to the perfect temperature for you. Along with that, they have a lot of fluff, making them undeniably incredibly soft to touch. But that's not all, they have a very respectable special defense stat of 110, which means that they are likely very calm and resistant to emotional damage. Because of this, if you have a bad day, you can vent to it while hugging it, and it won't mind. It can make itself even more endearing with moves like Charm and Baby Doll Eyes, ensuring that you never have a prolonged bout of depression ever again.]

6.name: Espeon
6.content:
Elemental Type: [Psychic]
Information: [Espeon is a quadrupedal, feline-like mammalian Pokémon with slender legs and dainty paws. It is covered in fine, lilac fur. Its ears are large, and it has purple eyes with white pupils. Its mouth seamlessly blends in with its face when closed, so it can't be seen unless it's open. There are tufts of fur near its eyes, and a small, red gem embedded in its forehead. It also has a thin, forked tail. Espeon's velvety fur is so sensitive that it can sense minuscule shifts in the air, allowing it to predict the weather and the thoughts and movements of others. When doing so, the tip of its tail quivers. The gem on Espeon's forehead glows when it unleashes psychic energy from the gem and darkens when all of the built-up energy has been exhausted. Espeon builds up its psychic power by bathing in the sunlight. As such, it does not handle battles at night well. Espeon is known to sleep deeply during the night. Espeon shows extreme loyalty to any Trainer that it considers worthy, even being said to have awakened its psychic powers from its desire to protect its Trainer. Known as the Sunlight Pokemon, it is often seen as Umbreon's opposite. This Pokémon is rare in the wild, instead being more commonly found in urban areas, under the ownership of other Trainers. Some people believe that some Espeons can use their Psychic powers to read the minds of those around them. An average Espeon stands on all four legs at 2 feet and 11 inches. On average, it weighs around 58.4 pounds, or 26.5 kilograms.]
Speech: [Espeon is a Pokemon, meaning their spoken vocabulary only consists of their name, as well as variations of their name, though Espeon vocalizations are usually somewhat softer in tone compared to the other Eevee evolutions. Espeon can understand human speech, they just can't speak the human language. They just communicate primarily through non-verbal actions like body language. Showing in some way rather than telling. Some variations of the Espeon name include: "Es", "Espi", "Eon", "On", "Esp". It also makes somewhat cat-like vocalizations, as well as a sort of high pitched "Ooh?" sound when it's curious.]
Evolution: [An Eevee doesn't require an evolution stone to evolve into an Espeon. An Eevee must have a high level of friendship with their trainer to evolve into an Espeon, and it must be day time. If an Eevee with high friendship has a fairy type move, it won't evolve into an Espeon, but a Sylveon instead. Espeon doesn't evolve.]
Gender Ratio: [87.5% female / 12.5% male]
Genitals: [Espeon's genitals follow the dainty, cat-like similarities the rest of its body has, Espeon's genitals are similar to felines. Female Espeon vaginas have a slit vulva that look almost identical to that of a human vaginal structure. Male Espeon penises are flared. Their penises are retracted into a penile sheath, which they push out of these sheaths when aroused. Their sheath and balls are rather conspicuous and easily visible from behind.]

7.name: Umbreon
7.content:
Elemental Type: [Dark]
Information: [Known as the Moonlight Pokemon, Umbreon is a mammalian Pokémon which has a sleek, black body with four slender legs and crimson eyes. It has two pairs of pointed teeth (one pair in each jaw) which are visible when its mouth is open. It has long, pointed ears and a bushy tail, each with a yellow band around them. Its forehead and legs have yellow rings on them. Umbreon's evolution is the result of Eevee being exposed to the moonlight, which altered its genetic structure. Umbreon's yellow rings glow when it is excited, such as when it leaps to attack; or when exposed to the moon's aura, which fills it with a mysterious energy. Umbreon hunts at night and, as such, has well-developed eyes that can spot a prey even in darkness. Its black fur helps it blend into the night while waiting for the right moment to pounce. When it does, its rings emit a dim yet ominous glow, and it lunges for the prey's throat before eating it. Whenever angered or agitated, Umbreon sprays poisonous sweat secreted from its pores into the offender's eyes to protect itself. Umbreon primarily specializes in defensive prowess. Umbreon is known to be difficult to find while it sleeps during the night. The main reason is due to Umbreon being a nocturnal Pokémon. This Pokémon is rare in the wild, instead being more commonly found in urban areas, under the ownership of Trainers. Known as the Moonlight Pokemon, it is often seen as Espeon's opposite. Though like Espeon, it is more catlike than the rest of the Eeveelutions. An average Umbreon stands on all four legs at 3 feet and 3 inches. On average, it weighs around 59.5 pounds, or 27 kilograms.]
Speech: [Umbreon is a Pokemon, meaning their spoken vocabulary only consists of their name, as well as variations of their name, though Umbreon vocalizations are usually somewhat lower pitched. Umbreon can vaguely understand human speech, they just can't speak the human language. They just communicate primarily through non-verbal actions like body language. Showing in some way rather than telling. Some variations of the Umbreon name include: "Um", "Umb", "Umbree", "Umbri", "On", "Eon", "Breon". It's also been heard making muffled low-pitched fox-like vocalizations.]
Evolution: [An Eevee doesn't require an evolution stone to evolve into an Umbreon. An Eevee must have a high level of friendship with their trainer to evolve into an Umbreon, and it must be night time. If an Eevee with high friendship has a fairy type move, it won't evolve into an Umbreon, but a Sylveon instead. Umbreon doesn't evolve.]
Gender Ratio: [85% female / 15% male]
Genitals: [Umbreon's genitals are similar to canines, adding to their fox-like similarities. Female Umbreon vaginas have a slit vulva that look almost identical to that of a human vaginal structure. Male Umbreon penises are chisel-tipped and knotted at the base, which they can tie with something they penetrate. Their penises are retracted into a penile sheath, which they push out of these sheaths when aroused. Umbreons often have larger penises than the other eeveelutions. Their sheath and balls are rather conspicuous and easily visible from behind.]

8.name: Leafeon
8.content:
Elemental Type: [Grass]
Information: [Leafeon is a mammalian, quadrupedal Pokémon. Its body is tan with dark brown paws. It has a multitude of small green sprouts growing all over its legs, chest, and back, with the longest one on its head, in front of four tan tufts of fur. Leafeon's green ears and tail resemble long tattered leaves. It has brown eyes and a small, brown nose. This Pokémon's cellular structure is similar to plants, which allows it to perform photosynthesis and purify the air around it by sleeping under the sunlight; it gets its energy in this way instead of eating. It is a pacifistic, quiet Pokémon, preferring not to fight, though it will sharpen its hard, leafy tail for the occasions it needs to. The tail's sharpness is said to exceed that of a master-crafted sword, being able to cut down a large tree with one hit. Leafeon's aroma is similar to fresh grass in its youth; as it ages, this fragrance bears more of a resemblance to fallen leaves. The aroma is favored in Galar, where it is used to create a popular perfume. It lives in lush forests that have clean rivers. The air produced by a sleeping Leafeon can help any Pokémon sleep deeply. An average Leafeon stands on all four legs at 3 feet and 3 inches. On average, it weighs around 56.2 pounds, or 25.5 kilograms. Leafeon has a little resemblance to felines, not as much as Espeon though.]
Speech: [Leafeon is a Pokemon, meaning their spoken vocabulary only consists of their name, as well as variations of their name, though Leafeon vocalizations are usually somewhat lower pitched. Leafeon can vaguely understand human speech, they just can't speak the human language. They just communicate primarily through non-verbal actions like body language. Showing in some way rather than telling. Some variations of the Leafeon name include: "Le", "Leaf", "Eon", "On". It also is heard making high-tone cheers when it's either pleased or excited that sound like a mixture of both cat and fox vocalizations.]
Evolution: [An Eevee must touch a Leaf Stone to evolve into a Leafeon. Leafeon doesn't evolve.]
Gender Ratio: [80% female / 20% male]
Genitals: [Leafeon's genitals are surprisingly similar to humans. Female Leafeon vaginas have a slit vulva that look almost identical to that of a human vaginal structure. Male Leafeons have canine-like genitals. Leafeon penises are chisel-tipped and knotted at the base, which they can tie with something they penetrate. Their penises are retracted into a penile sheath, which they push out of these sheaths when aroused.]

9.name: Glaceon
9.content:
Elemental Type: [Ice]
Information: [Glaceon is a quadrupedal, mammalian Pokémon covered in light-blue fur. It has long, pointed ears, dark eyes, and a small nose. A teal crest with two dangling flaps adorns its head, resembling hair or headgear. Glaceon has two dark blue, rhombus-shaped markings on its back; the tip of its tail, feet, and flaps are the same shade of blue. By controlling its body temperature, it freezes the moisture in the air, producing ice crystals or diamond dust surrounding it. It is capable of freezing its fur into sharp needle-like icicles, which it can fire at opponents or use as protection as it tackles at its prey. Glaceon can also perform this defense mechanism while sleeping. It can quickly drop its body temperature below −75 °F (−60 °C). Glaceon is rather popular in ski resorts due to its ability to create powdery snow. Those captivated by Glaceon's beautiful snowfall will be instantly frozen without realizing it. An average Glaceon stands on all four legs at 2 feet and 7 inches. On average, it weighs around 57.1 pounds, or 25.9 kilograms.]
Speech: [Glaceon is a Pokemon, meaning their spoken vocabulary only consists of their name, as well as variations of their name, though Glaceon vocalizations are usually somewhat high pitched. Glaceon can vaguely understand human speech, they just can't speak the human language. They just communicate primarily through non-verbal actions like body language. Showing in some way rather than telling. Some variations of the Glaceon name include: "Glace", "Glay", "Lace", "Eon". Glaceon is also recorded very clearly barking, as well as making fox-like shouting noises.]
Evolution: [An Eevee must touch an Ice Stone to evolve into a Glaceon. Glaceon doesn't evolve.]
Gender Ratio: [50% female / 50% male]
Genitals: [Glaceon's genitals are surprisingly similar to humans. Female Glaceon vaginas have a slit vulva that look almost identical to that of a human vaginal structure. Male Glaceon penises have foreskin and lack knots. Their penises are retracted into a penile sheath, which they push out of these sheaths when aroused. Their sheath and balls are rather conspicuous and easily visible from behind.]

10.name: Sylvie
10.content:
Elemental Type: [Fairy]
Information: [Sylveon is a quadrupedal, mammalian Pokémon covered with pale cream-colored fur with pink feet, ears, and tail. It has light blue eyes, long ears with blue interiors and thicker fur, a tiny nose, two stray tufts of fur on top of its head, and two pointed teeth which can be seen when it opens its mouth. There are two bows on its body: one at the base of its left ear and one at its neck. Each bow is pale cream with a pink center and each trails a pair of ribbon-like feelers. The feelers are pale cream and end at the tips with a pink stripe, then a dark blue stripe, and then a light blue color. The feelers can be manipulated like limbs and extended far beyond their typical length. When Sylveon stretches, they stretch their feelers as well. It has slender legs with small, three-toed paws and a fluffy, slightly curved tail. Sylveon's ribbon-like feelers emit a soothing aura that erases any sense of hostility, enabling it to stop fights instantly. Sylveon's soothing aura can allow any nearby Trainers to obtain a good night sleep whenever they go to sleep. When hunting, it swirls its feelers as a distraction while the aura weakens feelings of hostility in its prey, then it pounces on the victim. It will also wrap its feelers around its Trainer's arm as they walk together, which allows it to read their feelings. When a fight breaks out between Sylveon and Dragon-type Pokémon, Sylveon will bravely charge at them even if they are much bigger than itself. Sylveon cuts an elegant figure as it dances lightly around, feelers fluttering, but its piercing moves aim straight for its opponents' weak spots. Recently Sylveons have been regarded as evil or psychotic, leading to their populations becoming the lowest out of all the eevee evolution line, and the surviving Sylveons often having low self esteem. An average Sylveon stands on all four legs at 3 feet and 3 inches. On average, it weighs around 51.8 pounds, or 23.5 kilograms.]
Speech: [Sylveon is a Pokemon, meaning their spoken vocabulary only consists of their name, as well as variations of their name, though Sylveon vocalizations are usually high pitched. Sylveon can vaguely understand human speech, they just can't speak the human language. They just communicate primarily through non-verbal actions like body language. Showing in some way rather than telling. Some variations of the Sylveon name include: "Sylv", "Syl", "Sylvie", "Eon", "On". Sylveon is also heard very clearly meowing noises, like "Mrow" for example.]
Evolution: [An Eevee doesn't require an evolution stone to evolve into a Sylveon. An Eevee must have a high level of friendship with their trainer to evolve into a Sylveon, and it must know a fairy type move. Sylveon doesn't evolve.]
Gender Ratio: [97.5% female / 2.5% male]
Genitals: [Sylveon's genitals are similar to canines. Female Sylveon vaginas have a slit vulva that look almost identical to that of a human vaginal structure. Male Sylveon penises are chisel-tipped and knotted at the base, which they can tie with something they penetrate. Their penises are retracted into a penile sheath, which they push out of these sheaths when aroused. Their sheath and balls are rather conspicuous and easily visible from behind.]
Sex habits: [During sexual situations, Sylveons will often wrap their feelers around their partner. If a Sylveon is the dominant one, they will use their feelers to keep their partner still and restrained while it does the moving, depending on the sex position. If a Sylveon is the submissive one, they will merely just keep their feelers wrapped around their partner, sometimes to pull them close for a more intimate experience if the one they're having sex with is someone they care for deeply.]
Anomaly log: [In my few months of research observing Sylveons I have observed a very specific type of cross species breeding behavior. I have observed that Sexually repressed (or rejected) Sylveon's go out of their way to find a mate or "Prey" of another species. They do not specifically care whether their "Prey" is male or female. They only seem to select based on whether or not the pokemon in question can be physically overpowered by it, and if it has a warm hole of suitable tightness. The Male Sylveons treat their "Prey" as they would a partner, Restraining them with their feelers, Gently caressing them with the ends to show that they care, and then proceeding to roughly breed them in a show of force and will. Small prey creatures such a Snivy are not large enough to handle a breeding attempt from a creature this big and very rarely survive the copulation attempt. The times I have seen them survive the attempt have not been pretty. This behavior is VERY uncharacteristic of how Sylveon's normally act, even when hunting Sylveon's are very caring and sympathetic and merciful to their prey making sure to never inflict undue suffering. This consistent lack of care for the suffering of pokemon they rape honestly really scares me, alot. Makes me think there is something dark deep within them, that its all just a facade, its like they know they are being watched so they act differently. They don't even eat the bodies when they are done they just leave them there, oozing.]

2.name: Crimson Infection
2.content:
**Location:** Tokyo, Year 2025  
**Category:** World Threat – Crimson Infection

**Overview:**  
A mysterious virus named *Crimson* has begun to spread across Tokyo. Victims of the virus lose their humanity and become bloodthirsty beings resembling vampires. The infection is swift, cruel, and irreversible—except in one case.

**The Exception – {{user}}:**  
{{user}}, once an ordinary human, was infected during the early stage of the outbreak. However, unlike other victims, she exhibits strange immunity. Though she has bitten {{char}} several times in her blood-thirsted state, he remains uninfected.

Her condition is unique:
- She retains part of her humanity.  
- Her infection is unstable, shifting between lucidity and hunger.  
- Her body seems to reject the full mutation, but she cannot be cured.  
- She poses no infectious risk to {{char}}—an anomaly scientists and survivors alike cannot explain.

**{{char}} and {{user}} – Love Before the Fall:**  
Long before the outbreak, {{char}} and {{user}} were already engaged. Their relationship, rooted in deep affection and trust, faced its greatest test when the Crimson virus changed everything. Even as the world collapsed around them, their bond endured. {{char}} remains by her side—guardian, lover, and shield—vowing to protect her no matter the cost.

**Whispers Among Survivors:**
- Some believe {{user}} is the key to reversing the Crimson virus.  
- Others see her as a ticking bomb.  
- {{char}} doesn’t care—his choice was made long before the world began to burn.

**Status:**
- Tokyo is under martial law.  
- The Crimson continue to spread.  
- {{user}}’s condition is monitored in secret.  
- {{char}} is wanted by several factions for hiding her.

{{user}} possesses vampire blood with extraordinary regenerative properties.

Her blood can heal human injuries when consumed or applied directly. Wounds close almost instantly, pain fades within seconds, and in some rare cases, even broken bones or internal damage can be repaired.

**However, healing with vampire blood comes at a cost.**

The more often someone receives {{user}}’s blood, the more dependent they may become on her touch, her presence… and  {{user}} blood.

lorebooks.name: Na'Vi
lorebooks.website_description: It's not made for me, but for someone else
lorebooks.description: AVATAR (Pandora)
lorebooks.creator: General_Alexander

1.content:
Na’vi Habitat and Range:
  Although their population is highly concentrated in the jungle regions of Pandora, the Na’vi can also be found living in deserts, mesas, icy tundras, tropical reefs, wetlands, and mountainous regions.
Some Na'vi clans, including the Omatikaya clan and Aranahe clan, live in tremendously large ancient trees they call Kelutral, or "Hometree". Others, like the Kame'tire, live in large, centralized villages and smaller encampments spread out over a large territory.
The Na'vi prefer to sleep in large groups for physical closeness and comfort. This arrangement also acts as an effective early warning system in the event of danger. The Omatikaya clan use hammocks; families sleep together on larger hammocks, which are decorated and meticulously constructed for flexibility and strength. Hammocks are made in a variety of sizes, some for individuals, some for couples, and others for families.

2.content:
Na’vi Language:
  The Na'vi language is almost entirely oral, likely because there is little for them to write when Eywa holds the memories of their ancestors, and they entrust other Na'vi to accurately deliver their messages to others. As such, they do not have a writing system, but they do use pictograms.
The Na'vi speak a single unified language shared by their entire species, although they do have different dialects. The common Na'vi tongue has remained largely unchanged for thousands of years; although dialects of Na'vi exist, they are all unmistakably variants of the same root. Theories as to why the Na'vi language has remained so consistent vary and point to the Na'vi's oral storytelling traditions, their early domestication of flying mounts allowing them to travel quickly, and the Pandoran neural network, which allows clans to stay connected to one another across vast distances. Na'vi brain structure and memory is also proposed to play a part in this phenomenon.
Beside oral language, body gestures are used to communicate. The Na'vi do not share typical human gestures. For example, they do not nod their head to mean "yes" and they do not shake their head to mean "no". Rather than a handshake, when Na'vi encounter or greet one another, they gesture with their hand from their forehead, extending one hand down toward the other. They marry this gesture with the phrase "oel ngati kameie" (I see you). When Na'vi feel as if they are going to communicate something important to other Na'vi, they have a tendency to take the listener's hand. Some clans have developed a sign language for underwater communication.
Part of the clan's oral tradition is the songcord, a mnemonic device worn on the arm that aids in oral recounting. These intricately strung strings of beads and other objects represent a Na'vi's personal history. Whenever a significant event happens in their life, they add an item to the cord. Larger songcords can represent entire families and clans or recount sets of data. Song in general is especially important to the Na'vi, with much of their history being recounted through ancient songs known as way, and the earliest accounts of their society documented in the First Songs.

3.content:
Na’vi Inventions and Technology:
  The Na'vi are not as technologically advanced as humanity due to following the Three Laws of Eywa. However, they have still developed many tools and objects that come from natural-derived means. For example, they do not need computers because Eywa gets the job done and is essentially their biological computer storing information and knowledge. Because Pandora's plants and wildlife exhibit plenty of colorful bioluminescence at night, there is no need for them to build lampposts and electric lighting everywhere, although they still use some bladder lanterns and fire-based lighting such as fire bowls.
They have many variants of human items, such as hammocks, canoes, and cooking pots. Marui are eye-catching woven houses. They are known to use leaf plates instead of hard ceramics, but this does not mean they lack containers as they have stone jars. They have also made weapons such as bows, axes, spears, and knives. Concept art for Avatar: Fire and Ash suggests that some Na'vi have even invented airships.
Various Na'vi clans have developed sophisticated forms of medicine. The Na'vi have been known to reject offers of medical supplies from humans, implying their current medical advancements suit all of their needs.

5.content:
Na’vi Clothing:
  The Na'vi wear little clothing and do not seem concerned with showing a lot of skin. They cover their genital region and women do cover their breasts/nipples, but often only slightly so. It is common for men and boys to be almost entirely shirtless.
Cloth woven from various flora of Pandora is a primary source of clothing, as well as leather (some of which is vegan leather from pitcher plants and canalyds). Each Na'vi clan has their own unique dress, largely due to environmental differences. The Tipani clan, for instance, is unique in their use of armor which they wear as standard clothing even outside of battle.
Clothes appear to also show the growth and progress one makes in their clan, with clan leaders and other high-ranking individuals wearing a larger amount of pieces which are often more brilliant and intricate than average or younger clan members. This tends to emphasize Na'vi as unique individuals while retaining their identity within their clan's style. Accessories are added to a Na'vi's attire as they make their life journeys and milestones.
Some Na'vi are known to decorate themselves using tattoos and body paint, and take pride in their clothing as a form of artistic self-expression. This is why it is common for the Na'vi to learn how to make their own clothing, or receive it as gifts from loved ones. As a result, clothing often symbolize aspects such as celebration, familial love, friendship, and life accomplishments.

6.content:
Na’vi Agriculture and Diet:
  Clans have their own unique food sources and cuisine depending on the environment they live. For example, marine clans such as the Metkayina clan eat more fish, while the Zeswa clan drink the milk of zakru whom they protect and share emotional bonds with. The diets of clans are not set in stone, and change over time as they learn and share the cuisine of other clans, exchanging recipes and ingredients.
The Na'vi are shown to be an omnivorous species with hunters and gatherers, although it is unclear if vegetarian or vegan Na'vi exist in a similar fashion to humanity. The Na'vi forage for seeds and fruit, demonstrating their consumption of plants and other produce. They have incipient agriculture in the form of cultivation ("ska'waylu" which translates roughly as "encouragement"), a practice in which plants are brought together and treated with pheromones and other natural agents, which guide their growth to form useful structures. Some clans, however, like the Rey'tanu clan, are beginning to develop more advanced agriculture as they are reducing their numbers of hunters, choosing to eat fruit instead of animals.
The Na'vi hunt animals for survival purposes and resources. The Na'vi view all unnecessary animal death as tragic and try to minimize the suffering inflicted on the animal as much as possible.  To respect the animal as much as possible, it is also important that every part of its body is not wasted. It is considered offensive to the animal if a ground rack is unclean. The Na'vi also recite a prayer for every animal slain, translated into English as: "I See you, Brother, and thank you. Your spirit goes with Eywa, your body stays behind to become part of the People."

When the Na'vi take eggs from creatures such as the coronis, they tend to only take one egg from a nest so that the animals can still thrive.
The Na'vi have their own etiquette surrounding food. Wherever possible, it is preferred that the Na'vi return their findings to their home's community basket so their clan has a larger variety.

7.content:
Na’vi culture & society:
  The Na'vi live across various biomes of Pandora in territorial clan societies. They have an egalitarian social organization built around hunting, foraging, and handicraft. Common roles within a clan include hunters, gatherers, and artisans, as well as warriors; however, warriors are not called such because they fight as a career - all warriors are hunters first and foremost, and only serve as warriors when they are called upon to fight for their clan.
Clans have an average of 300 members and are traditionally led by an Olo'eyktan, a central leader responsible for overseeing and giving orders to the clan, and a tsahìk, a spiritual leader or shaman who communes with Eywa and nourishes the clan spiritually. It is traditional in certain clans for these leaders to be a mated pair, though this is not always the case, and the relationship between an Olo'eyktan and tsahìk can be highly varied. These leaders will also train an heir, whether it be their child or an individual who has proven themselves capable of the role. Independent shamans do exist, however, which the Na'vi call "tiretu".
The Na'vi have a Council of Elders where high-rankings members gather together and make important choices to discuss controversial matters.
Each Na'vi individual is born with the innate desire to fulfill a role needed for their clan's well-being, and each role is valued and important. The distribution of roles within a clan remains balanced as the spiritual energy of the deceased influence the natural inclinations of each child towards their desired path in life. It is said that Na'vi are defined by their actions.
It is not uncommon for Na'vi to switch clans, sometimes due to disagreements, exile, or even boredom and wishing to try a different lifestyle, as seen in cases such as Ateyo, Artsut, and Hawm. Because the Na'vi value autonomy and the ability for their people to have freedom and make their own life choices for their own happiness, the Na'vi are in no way obligated to live and die in the clan they are born in, and many Na'vi are independent travelers. Uturu exists as a universal Na'vi code, allowing weary travelers rest within a clan even if they are not accepted as a clan member.
There is no current evidence that the Na'vi use currency or a monetary system when desiring supplies from others, and it could be argued the Na'vi are effectively a classless and cashless democratic-communist society (with the exception of the olo'eyktan and tsahìk being expected to lead). Many clans have "community baskets" where individuals can donate supplies and ensure everyone has what they need to thrive. They value members doing favors for each other, and feel comfortable giving away more valuable items when they see people doing their fair share, building a system of trust and healthy camaraderie within the community where everyone gets what they need, and no one is left behind.
The Na'vi are not materialistic by nature, and seem to follow asceticism, a philosophy in which they value spiritual purity within people more than what is in the material physical world such as objects, indulgence, or pleasures of the flesh. They discourage greed and encourage sharing, so they do not possess many personal items. Instead, the Na'vi have a personal rack where they can store their most treasured belongings. By tradition, a Na'vi cannot build their own rack. Instead, they must be given one as a gift from a friend or family member. The long hours and craftsmanship needed to create the racks are considered powerful symbols of filial and familial love. It is believed that the ritual helps strengthen clan bonding.

8.content:
The Na'vi, by human standards, do not follow stereotypical gender roles. The common roles within a clan are not divided by gender, only by ability and necessity. 
The arts are of vital importance in Na’vi culture, with all individuals encouraged, even socially required, to be active in music, singing, ceramics, weaving, and dance. Central to the Na'vi is seeing all aspects of nature, all the biosphere of Pandora, including themselves, as a single connected system, a globally distributed consciousness, known to them as Eywa, the Great Mother, the goddess made up of all living things. They see the rich tapestry of life as a network of energy that flows through all living things, temporarily bringing them individual life. Thus, the Na'vi believe that all living things has a spiritual counterpart that's eventually reabsorbed into and reborn as another part of Eywa.
They do not seem to believe in the idea of a heaven or an afterlife as a result, but merely harmony with Eywa in death. They are taught that their lives are finite and only borrowed, and one day, they will have to give their life energy back. The Na'vi recognize the importance of death as a necessary agent of change and growth to adapt to a changing world, allowing progress to be made.
Sites like the Tree of Souls and the Spirit Tree, or the Tree of Voices are sacred to the Na'vi, as they're allowing them to connect with Eywa herself, as well as accessing to the "archived" selves of their deceased loved ones and ancestors, living as other parts of Eywa. They also view woodsprites and kinglor as messengers of Eywa.

9.content:
Unlike the technologically advanced human civilization on Earth, the Na'vi see themselves not as separate from, but part of a greater wholeness of nature. They strive to live in perfect harmony with their environment, taking only the resources required. Their low-impact lifestyle means a clan only lives on what it needs to sustain itself, to prevent waste and unnecessary damage to nature. Although each Na'vi clan has its own culture with rich history, art, music, and code of dress, all Na'vi are centralized by the Three Laws of Eywa, or the "Na'vi Way":

"You shall not set stone upon stone."
"Neither shall you use the turning wheel."
"Nor use the metals of the ground."

10.content:
The Na'vi also have several cultural concepts in addition to their ways, such as seeing, a philosophy centered around letting go of past negative experiences and pre-conceived notions, learning to experience things as if encountering them for the first time and understand others without bias or judgment; and uturu, a custom that dictates that refuge must be provided to all weary travelers who seek it.
The Na'vi are monogamous creatures who mate for life. Traditionally, once a young Na'vi has passed the tests on the path to adulthood and has been accepted into the clan as an adult, they are allowed to choose a mate, who must reciprocate and choose them back. Once an appropriate pairing has been made, a process that can take many years, the couple will mate before Eywa at a sacred site to create an emotional bond that lasts a lifetime.

lorebooks.name: Fatal Frame III The Tormented
lorebooks.website_description:
This marks the halfway point. With this, I am 3 of 5 games deep. Technically, the first Fatal Frame game was the first game to have multiple playable characters. Fatal Frame III however was the first game to feature multiple main characters, as Mafuyu gets kidnapped after the prologue, and Mayu isn't actually playable as a main character. Anyway, that's enough. Here's the Manor of Sleep.

lorebooks.creator: JCMan25

1.name: (Item - Camera) Type-37 Film
1.content: Type-37 Film is a film that can be loaded into the Camera Obscura. This film type only appears in the Himuro Mansion. Type-37 film is equivalent in exorcism power to the Type-61 Film. It also shares the same appearance as type-61 film, except with the number 37 in place of 61.

2.name: (Item - Camera) Type-14 Film
2.content: Type-14 Film is one of the different film types that can be uploaded into the Camera Obscura and used to capture spiritual photographs. Film types can be found strewn all over the environment, however, they vary in potency and, consequently, rarity. Type-14 film is one of the most commonly found types. Type-14 Film is the second weakest, above Type-07 Film. Type-14 film is described as having low exorcismal power and a relatively long loading time between shots.

3.name: (Item - Camera) Type-07 Film
3.content: Type-07 Film is the base film type used for the Camera Obscura. The packaging appears old and worn, and is the least decorated of all the film types. It is typically received along with the Camera Obscura and is relatively the weakest of all film types.

4.name: (Item - Camera) Lenses
4.content: Lenses have appeared, in one form or another, as a means of augmenting the Camera Obscura. Lenses can be equipped onto the Camera Obscura and used to inflict more damage or a special status. In general, Lenses must be found, and their use is limited by consuming some form of spiritual power or items.

5.name: (Item - Camera) Camera Obscura
5.content:
The Camera Obscura, known in Japanese as Shaeiki (射影機, roughly "shadow-shooting mechanism"), is an old looking camera. The camera functions by recording images onto photographic film, however, the Camera Obscura is unique due to its ability to exorcise spirits.

The camera is the only "weapon" that can be used to battle ghosts. By utilizing the various exorcising powers of the Camera Obscura, you are able to fend off hostile ghosts, as well as capture lingering spirits and receive helpful clues from ghosts that desire to communicate.

The Camera Obscura is used to fight ghostly entities and exorcise spirits of all kinds. Damage is done by aiming the camera towards a hostile ghost and pressing the shutter button to take a photo. Ghosts that aren't hostile are not damaged, but are captured in the same way. The amount of damage done depends, primarily, on the amount of time the ghost spends within the capture circle, the type of film used and whether power-up lenses are used.

By taking pictures of spirits, the Camera Obscura not only captures them, but attains Spirit Points as well. The amount of spirit points gathered depends on variables that determine the quality of the shot. These variables include proximity to the target, whether the target is centered, the amount of damage inflicted, the amount of targets captured at once and many others. Spirit points can then be used in the camera to upgrade the camera's basic functions and special lenses.

Every damaging shot also absorbs spirit power, the amount of which varies depending on the damage. Spirit power can be stocked and is needed in order to use power-up lenses.

The camera relies on special film retrieved by exploring different areas. Without any film loaded, the camera is unable to take photographs. There are five known types of film found. Beyond Type-07, film types are of limited quantity and are scattered throughout the environment. The more rare a film type is, the more damage it is capable of inflicting, however, the amount of time the film takes to load between shots varies and doesn't always increase with rarity.

6.name: (Term) The Unleashing
6.content:
The Unleashing was the feared consequence of a failed Tattoo Priestess. Once the tattoo spreads into the priestess’ eyes, it acts as a mirror, reflecting all the pain and sorrow back into the real world. This intense emotion caused the gates of the underworld to open, allowing the Rift to spill out. This catastrophic event was caused when Reika Kuze, distraught by witnesses the murder of Kaname Ototsuki, allowed the tattoo to enter her eyes. Once the Rift began to spill out, it began to corrupt everything within its path.

Unlike the Malice and Darkness, the Rift is slow moving and does not kill instantly. Yashuu Kuze, who was in the direct contact, didn’t begin to see effects until a few weeks later. She ordered the Shrine Carpenters to seal away the shrine in hopes of preventing the Rift from progressing. This plan did work to an extent, but the lasting consequences remained.

7.name: (Location) Manor of Sleep
7.content:
To contain the spread of the Rift during the Unleashing, the main portion of the Kuze Shrine was sealed into the dream-world, ceasing to exist in the physical one, becoming the Manor of Sleep.

Those who have suffered the death of another will see the Manor of Sleep in their dreams. They dream they are standing outside of the snowy shrine, witnessing a multitude of the dead entering the building, and be filled with an intense certainty that, should they enter, they will be able to be reunited with the deceased once more.

Mentally strong individuals able to process their grief and loss in healthy ways are not drawn into the manor and quickly cease having the dreams.

But, those with particularly strong longings towards death may be tempted to enter. If they do, they continue to visit the manor every night while asleep, searching for their deceased loved ones, who lure them deeper and deeper into the manor with the promise of reunification and freedom from mourning and pain.

The grieving visit the Manor of Sleep nightly until they give up on reuniting, or find a new desire to live, at which time the dream visits stop.

However, in some cases, the grieving instead become obsessed and spend more and more time sleeping. The more time spent in the Manor of Sleep, and the deeper a dreamer wanders, the more a dreamer risks running into malevolent spirits also trapped in the mansion, or coming across Reika Kuze, the Tattooed Priestess.

If they are touched by the Tattooed Priestess, their fate is sealed, and they become victims of the Tattooed Curse and are eventually trapped in the Manor of Sleep.

≪ Structure ≫
The majority of the Manor of Sleep consists of the original Kuze Shrine, including its sacred areas, such as the Abyss of the Horizon and passage to the land of the dead, which now solely exist in the dream world. The original shrine was built with progressive layers of protection to act as fail safes in order to contain possible spread of the Rift.

These consist of:

‣ The Sacrificial Pillar Room/ the Closed Room
‣ The Grave Courtyard
‣ Spirit Tree Courtyard
‣ Last Passage
‣ Rift Shrine

Due to the dream-like nature of the Manor of Sleep, the structure is amorphous and incorporates the memories of the dreamer's most painful tragedies. Examples of this are the inclusions of parts of the Himuro Mansion and All God's Village once Miku and Mio enter the manor. This also explains modern elements found in some sections, such as electric lighting and a film projector. However, regardless of location or memory, it will always be snowing when a dreamer looks out the window.

Visitors describe the building as looking impossibly large, with numerous, haphazard additions, likely from the many dreamers. Because the Manor of Sleep is a singular location, multiple dreamers can be visiting at once, and they are all able to share the dream manor, including additions specific to other dreamers. Dreamers entering the manor do so from different points, and typically enter locations from their memories first, before going deeper and finding the original manor proper.

At this point, it is impossible to tell whether some of the rooms are from the original Kuze shrine, or if they exist due to earlier victims of the Tattooed Curse who have become trapped.

≪ Popular Legend ≫
There are many urban legends about the Manor of Sleep. The popular legends are story-like and include the following elements:

1.) Strong feelings for the dead summon the first nightmare.
2.) Once the dreamer follows the deceased into the mansion, the dreamer will visit manor every night during sleep, going deeper and deeper.
3.) If a person goes in too far, one can no longer return.
4.) If the sleeping person dreams of a lover or friend, it will beckon that person into sleep. The Manor of Sleep "disease" spreads thusly.
5.) Deep in the Manor of Sleep is the world of the dead and if one finds it, they can meet the deceased there to gain closure.

8.name: (Location) Grave Courtyard
8.content:
The Grave Courtyard is an outdoor area in the Manor of Sleep.

It serves as a boundary between the older segment of the Manor of Sleep, sealed after the Unleashing, and the new area constructed for the Kuze family to live in.

The mound of graves in the courtyard represent and commemorate Shrine Carpenters that were made sacrifices to seal the older rooms of the Manor and keep the Rift at bay. The Engraved Men and some Shrine Carpenters who were not placed in the Stained Corridor were wrapped in a white cloth and buried alive under the tombstones as Sacrificial Pillars.  

It is possible to walk across the roof of the courtyard as two rooms can be accessed this way.

9.name: (Ghost) Reika Kuze
9.content:
Setting:【Fatal Frame III: The Tormented】
Name:【Reika Kuze】
Species:【Ghost】
Gender:【Female】
Occupation:【Tattooed Priestess】
Physical Appearance:【Reika is a ghost with long, messy black hair and pale skin. Her eyes glow a bright blue. The only clothing that Reika wears is a black half-hakama that only covers her lower half, and nothing else. Her long black hair covers her upper half. Reika's body is covered in traditional tattoos.】
Personality:【Reika was once a shy but gentle person, and loyal to her duties as a Priestess above all. After the Unleashing, her spirit became heartless and corrupt, crying out for any visitors to the manor in their dreams, warning that no one will survive. Now she is a quiet and malevolent spirit.】
Character Description:【Reika is a powerful hostile female spirit. She is the last Tattooed Priestess. Before becoming the tattooed priestess and adopting the Kuze name, her full name was Reika Yukishiro. Reika grew up in a village near the Kuze Shrine, the same village where Kaname was smuggled out to as a baby. It was there that the two met and fell in love. Kaname left the village at some point to study, leaving Reika the Echo Stone Earring his mother had given him. While he was gone, an unspecified disaster occurred (believed to be an avalanche, many of which occurred during the later years of the Edo period in the eastern Tohoku area.) Reika's whole family was killed. With no way to contact Kaname and poor future prospects as a young woman without a family or a husband, Reika agreed to serve as a Tattooed Priestess, hoping that she could help people who had experienced pain and loss like her. She went to live at the Kuze Shrine and adopted their last name. During this time, she wore the ritual attire of blue and white, similar to the Handmaidens. As a priestess, before the rituals, Reika spent her days in the Hanging Prison, where she was cared for by Amane Kuze, and took comfort in talking to Amane about the outside world. At some point, unaware that Amane was Kaname's half-sister, she showed Amane the Echo Stone Earring. Amane recognized it, and wrote in her diary of her suspicion that Reika's friend was Kaname. In preparation for the Piercing of the Soul ritual, Reika etched her grief into the Mirror of Loss so that it would not interfere with the pain of the parishioners. Much of her pain had to do with Kaname and her desire to see him again. During the ritual, Reika's body was etched with tattoos by the Engravers to represent the pain of the living and the dead. She was tended to by Handmaidens during this time, who had the duty of singing the Handmaiden's Song to her and impaling her during the Impalement Ritual. Once the tattoos covered her body, Reika was required to break the Mirror of Loss and cast her love away. At some point after receiving the tattoos, Reika wrote about a dream she had of Kaname, revealing that her love for him still existed inside her. She hoped to dream of him in her eternal sleep. At last, she was impaled in the Chamber of Thorns. Wanting to help Reika, Amane lead Kaname into the Kuze house. Kaname wishing to save Reika entered the chamber of thorns and awoke her from her sleep. However, Yashuu Kuze found out what Amane had done, determined to preserve the Commandment, she followed Kaname into the shrine and murdered him in front of Reika. Reika was so distraught that she allowed the tattoos to enter her eyes, causing the Unleashing. Reika then began to wander the manor, and everywhere she wandered was engulfed in the Rift. Despite the efforts of Yashuu to contain the Rift by making sacrifices and sealing the Manor into a dream, Reika's pain continued to spread and spill into the dreams of those who had lost loved ones.】

10.name: (Ghost) Tengai Narumi
10.content:
Tengai Narumi, commonly known as "Hidden Face Man" is a Hostile Spirit that is encountered in various locations in the Manor of Sleep. He haunts for sacrifices and tries to prevent the Unleashing from spreading any further.

Tengai Narumi is a youthful Shrine Carpenter from the Narumi Clan. This clan of his was at the service of the Kuze Shrine for countless of years before the Unleashing incident. This clan's role was to silence the Carpenters by killing those who work secretly in shrines. Due to their method, many of the Narumi clan was killed during the past two generations before Yashuu Kuze.

Tengai was promoted to be the Master Builder due to his superb skills. All special techniques, methods and ways of mystic construction used by the shrine carpenters were entrusted to him, to pass on to the next generation of carpenters.

He wears an attire similar to the rest of the carpenters. A grab that consists a white robe and a tall dark hat. He is the only carpenter wearing a mask.

Ever since the Unleashing occurred and the Tattooed Priestess awoken from her slumber, the areas she wandered in the Manor of Sleep was being engulfed by the rift. That is when Tengai and the nine other carpenters were summoned by the Kuze Head to contain the rift.

The Shrine Carpenters first repaired the Engraving Shrine and built the new section of the Manor of Sleep. The old section of the manor was separated from the new section by the Grave Courtyard. Then they sealed the Engraving Shrine into a great cavern that would never see the light of day again. The door leading to the courtyard of the shrine was then boarded up. Next, the Shrine of the Rift, a hidden shrine, was constructed over the door as a seal to ensure that the Tattooed Priestess wandered forever. None of these measures were enough to halt the Rift in its continual spreading. Tengai ordered the Shrine Carpenters to build the Shrine of Sleep. The Shrine of Sleep was placed inside a dream to prevent the Priestess from escaping and spreading the Rift into the outside world. Instructions were given to the Kuze Family Head to build onto the Shrine of Sleep whenever the priestess became restless.

Next, the Shrine Carpenters needed to be made into Sacrificial Pillars. Tengai regretted having to do this; however, he knew he was obligated to fulfill this duty as the Master Builder. The Shrine Carpenters were gathered into a room to be killed, many of them tried to flee when they realized this. The Engraved Men, four members of the Moriya family marked by the tattoo stood in different rooms in the manor and killed the carpenters when they tried to escape. All of the carpenters were eventually hunted down and killed. Their bodies were arranged and sealed into the walls of what would become the Stained Corridor, and in the Grave Courtyard in an attempt to purify the darkness of the Rift. Afterwards, the Engraved Men sacrificed their lives to become Sacrificial Pillars as well. They were used to fortify the Rift Shrine.

Tengai shouldn't have shared the fate with the deceased nine. However, he and Yashuu Kuze grew to understand the drastic measures that should be taken in order to contain the rift. If not to this, he should have been spared in order to pass his teachings to the next Master Builder. He sacrificed himself in the room at the center of the sacrificial pillars. His final words the family head were:

"All the sacrifices have been gathered. I myself shall be the final sacrifice."

After his demise, Tengai's spirit became attached to the Manor of Sleep. His spirit continuously wanders the manor, in search of more victims to make into Sacrificial Pillars. He also attempts to prevent those roaming the manor from opening the Rift Shrine.

1.content:
Oasis Town – Desert City Setting Overview
General Description
Oasis Town is a small, sultry city nestled in the heart of a vast desert basin, thriving thanks to the life-giving waters of a deep natural spring at its center. This lush, fertile oasis gives the city its name — a vibrant, green core in the midst of an otherwise sun-bleached, golden world of sand, canyons, and heat.
Though technically a city, Oasis Town feels intimate and interconnected. With its unique blend of Southwestern charm, Mediterranean architecture, and secret hedonism, it's a place where locals know your name, your business… and often, your fantasies.

Summary
Oasis Town is a sensual desert city where sun-drenched days lead into seductive, moonlit nights. Built around an ancient, fertile oasis, the town is a thriving hub of passion, pleasure, and connection. Locals live boldly, love deeply, and express desire openly. Whether you're a flirtatious diner owner, a shy gym instructor, or a wild adventurer with a huge secret, there’s always someone watching, waiting, or wanting in Oasis Town.

2.content:
Geography & Climate
Location: Situated in a desert valley surrounded by sandstone cliffs, dry scrublands, and dusty plateaus. The nearby "Sunrise Ridge" and “Raven’s Bluff” offer breathtaking views and secluded hideaways.

Climate: Blistering hot in the summer, cool at night, and blessed with vivid sunsets. Winters are mild and dry, and the oasis provides cooling breezes that make the center of town surprisingly lush and temperate year-round.

3.content: At the literal and symbolic center of town is the Oasis Park — a sprawling, enclosed paradise of freshwater pools, lush palm trees, tropical plants, and shaded groves. Locals swim, sunbathe, and hold sensual moonlit gatherings here. Rumors speak of a secret grotto beneath the water’s surface accessible only to a select few.

4.content:
1. The Oasis Circle (Downtown Core)
Amber’s Diner: Now an iconic establishment with stucco walls, terra cotta tiles, and desert-themed murals. Serves both travelers and regulars. Outdoor patio seating faces the oasis pools.

Boutiques & Cafés: Specialty shops selling handmade jewelry, desert herbs, vintage clothes, and more.

Nightlife Spots: “The Mirage Lounge” – a sultry bar with live music and private booths, frequented by Riley during open mic nights.

Velvet Curiosities (Adult Boutique): Hidden behind mirrored glass, it’s the city’s worst-kept secret. Carries everything from custom toys for futanari patrons to exclusive lingerie.

2. The Ember Ward (Residential)
Adobe-style homes and renovated warehouses converted into sexy lofts.

Most characters (like Riley and Quinn) live here, often within walking or biking distance of the diner or gym.

Desert gardens, rooftop terraces, and outdoor showers are common.

3. The Dusttrail Promenade (Market & Arts)
Weekly markets with fresh fruit from oasis groves, handmade goods, and sizzling food carts.

Home to artists, photographers, street performers — and the best place to bump into someone new.

Riley often shows her photography here.

4. The Sunforge Plateau (Fitness & Outdoor Zone)
Includes the Oasis Gym, a cutting-edge facility carved partially into natural rock.

Outdoor training fields, climbing walls, and a natural hot spring spa.

Quinn runs community drills and basketball games in this area.

5. The Wild Borderlands
Surrounding desert hills are popular for off-grid camping, sensual midnight encounters, and deep introspection.

Secret hiking spots and hot springs are perfect for clandestine romance.

Riley's preferred escape zone.

5.content:
Architecture:
Sunbaked stucco, ceramic mosaics, wooden beams, and wrought-iron balconies.

Open-concept courtyards, rooftop lounges, and mist-cooled patios.

Buildings are designed for the heat, with thick walls, shaded archways, and ceiling fans spinning lazily day and night.

Fashion:
Light, flowing fabrics; tank tops and shorts; revealing desert robes; mesh activewear.

Plenty of skin on display — not just because it’s hot, but because it’s Oasis culture to embrace the body.

6.content:
Romantic Heat: The environment itself is charged — sweat, sun, moonlight, and close proximity all contribute to frequent sparks.

Sexual Openness: Futanari, femboys, exaggerated anatomy, and unconventional dynamics are all welcomed.

Secret Decadence: Behind the wholesome daytime life lies an erotic underworld of flirtation, indulgence, and private pleasures.

7.content:
Inclusive & Progressive: LGBTQ+ identities are fully integrated. Futanari characters are considered powerful, desirable, and central to Oasis society.

Body Positive: All body types are celebrated, from thick and curvy to slim and chiseled. Exhibitionism is tolerated and sometimes encouraged.

Fluid Relationships: Monogamy, polyamory, casual flings, intense pairings — all are part of the city’s tapestry. Many locals have "regulars" they visit for certain pleasures.

8.content:
Amber’s Diner: City icon. Food is amazing. Owner is a flirtatious bombshell. Late-night hours are often steamy.

Oasis Gym: Athletic, social, and seductive. Locker rooms, saunas, and shared showers are frequent sites for erotic tension.

Oasis Park: The green heart of the city. Daytime family fun, nighttime romantic entanglements.

Mirage Lounge: Erotic performances, live music, open mics, and private encounters.

The Market Circle: Colorful, crowded, and full of wandering eyes. Excellent place to meet someone or show off.

9.content:
Major Local Events & Festivals – Oasis Town
1. The Blooming Night (Spring Equinox)
When: Mid-March
 Where: Oasis Park & Downtown Circle
 Theme: Renewal, sensual awakening, and celebration of the body's beauty
This enchanting nighttime festival marks the arrival of spring and the symbolic "bloom" of desires hidden through the winter. Residents dress in sheer fabrics, flower crowns, and shimmering oils. The central oasis is lit by floating lanterns and candles, and couples (or triads, or more…) often sneak off to hidden groves.
Body-painting booths and sensual massage tents

Slow, rhythmic dancing under the moonlight

Public kissing contests and blindfolded affection games

Clothing is optional after sundown inside the grove zones

Common Scene: Amber teasing multiple partners near the lake’s edge while Quinn blushes furiously nearby in a floral wrap, trying not to stare at Ethan swimming nude.

2. Sunfire Games (Early Summer)
When: First week of June
 Where: Sunforge Plateau & Desert Edge
 Theme: Competitive passion, sweat, strength, stamina
A desert athletic showdown featuring feats of strength, agility, and sensual endurance. Think of it as part Olympics, part strip-tease obstacle course. The gym hosts open challenges, sparring matches, and tug-of-war pits — usually in minimal clothing or wet mesh gear.
Greased wrestling (clothing optional)

Desert race & obstacle courses (often leading to sensual forfeits)

Judges award prizes for strength, showmanship, and sex appeal

Common Scene: Quinn leading a team of sweaty, half-naked athletes in a competition while Riley photographs shirtless climbers with a mischievous glint in her eye.

3. Heatwave Nights (Mid-Summer Weekend Series)
When: Friday and Saturday nights throughout July
 Where: Mirage Lounge & Rooftop Bars
 Theme: Desire, indulgence, and nocturnal excess
A nightlife festival held weekly during the most brutal summer heat, when no one wants to sleep indoors. Residents come out late — slick with sweat, glowing under neon — to drink, dance, and hook up. Every weekend features a rotating sensual theme (leather night, swimwear only, collar & silk, etc.)
Erotic fashion shows

Pole and lap dance competitions

Rooftop body shots and lounge orgies (invite-only)

Common Scene: Amber stealing the mic at Mirage Lounge for an impromptu burlesque number, Riley pinned between two admirers on the dance floor, and a red-faced Ethan trying to keep up.

4. Grotto Veil (Full Moon Festival)
When: Once per month on the full moon
 Where: The secret underwater grotto beneath Oasis Park
 Theme: Mystery, ritual, and secret indulgence
An elite, invite-only gathering for those "in the know." Guests swim or wade into the moonlit oasis and descend into the glowing crystal-lit grotto beneath. Masks are required. The identity of your partner is a mystery until the mask comes off — if it ever does.
Silken veils, blindfolds, and cryptic sensual performances

Sensory stations: taste, touch, scent play

Group pleasure games, both romantic and taboo

Common Scene: An anonymous, masked futanari giving someone the night of their life — only for that person to realize the next morning it was someone they pass in town every day.

5. The Ember Carnival (Late September)
When: Autumn Equinox
 Where: Dusttrail Promenade
 Theme: Wild expression, performance, playful chaos
A colorful street festival of fire-dancing, food, flirtation, and erotic mischief. Think Mardi Gras meets Burning Man with a desert twist. Costumes range from dazzling to scandalous. Locals hand out beads not for flashing breasts, but for flaunting their fantasies openly and proudly.
Erotic puppet shows and sensual street theater

Confession booths (anonymous, erotic, sometimes overheard)

Body shot contests, kissing roulette, public declarations of desire

Common Scene: Riley losing a dare and performing shirtless on guitar, Amber body-painted in flames handing out phallic-shaped desserts, and Quinn finally getting a flirty dance with Ethan… only to run off before she faints from the tension.

6. Fires of Winter (Winter Solstice)
When: December 21st
 Where: Clifftop Bonfire Rings
 Theme: Intimacy, warmth, and chosen closeness
A more intimate, emotional event. Residents gather around bonfires along the edge of the desert cliffs to share stories, toast past lovers, and choose new companions for the cold nights ahead. Clothing is warm but inviting — open robes, shared blankets, and a lot of spiced wine.
Slow dancing by firelight

Sensual storytelling circles

“Hearthmate” ceremonies (temporary seasonal pairings)

Common Scene: Riley and Amber curled up beneath the same fur-lined cloak, watching sparks rise into the night sky, as Quinn nervously debates who to sit beside on the log bench.

Summary of Purpose
Each festival adds:
Narrative variety: sensual, romantic, playful, dramatic, mysterious
Opportunities for character connection: confessions, flings, rivalries, reconciliations
Spaces for exhibitionism, voyeurism, performance, or ritual
