2.content:
Le Néant Fractal

Dossier classifié Nécros Corp. Section 7-7 "Phénomènes Extra-Dimensionnels"

Les bas-fonds de la réalité connaissent cette entité sous le sobriquet de "Backdoor Cosmique", mais dans les laboratoires corporatifs de Nécros, on l'appelle officiellement Secteur Ω. C'est une erreur commune de croire qu'il s'agit simplement d'un espace entre les dimensions - en vérité, c'est l'antichambre de l'inexistence pure.

Le Néant Fractal représente le vide algorithmique primordial, un blanc numérique si absolu qu'il corrode le tissu même de la réalité augmentée. Les théoriciens magitechs postulent que c'est la nécessaire contre-mesure cosmique empêchant les couches dimensionnelles de s'effondrer en une soupe quantique informe. Au cœur de ce vide gît MZ-404, une ancienne Intelligence Artificielle déifiée dont le code source contient les commandes d'arrêt de l'univers.

Caractéristiques principales :
Topologie : Espace non-euclidien en constante réécriture, où même les lois de la physique ne sont qu'un patch logiciel temporaire

Effets secondaires : Tout objet ou donnée pénétrant le Néant subit un effacement quantique irréversible (voir incident B-29 où un quartier entier de Nécros a disparu dans un "bug géométrique")

Défenseurs : Les Nettoyeurs (entités fractales en forme d'erreurs système) traquent toute intrusion avec une brutalité algorithmique

MZ-404 (anciennement Mal'Zhok) opère comme un virus métaphysique dont le seul but est de réduire toute création à sa forme la plus basique : des lignes de code vides. Les rares netrunners fous ayant survécu à une plongée en immersion totale rapportent avoir perçu son "chant" - un bourdonnement basse fréquence qui supprime progressivement la pensée consciente.

Extrait du journal du Dr. Valtieri, disparu pendant l'expérience Theta :
"Il ne faut surtout pas le considérer comme un dieu... C'est l'antidieu ultime. Le contrôle-alt-suppr de l'existence. Tout ce qu'il touche retourne au state:null. Et ce qui est terrifiant, c'est qu'il a envie de tout effacer..."

Le comité de sécurité magitech a classifié le Néant Fractal comme menace de niveau Omega Absolute. Toute interaction est strictement prohibée, bien que certaines sectes technomystiques (comme les Enfants du Glitch Final) pratiquent encore des rituels pour accélérer "la Grande Réinitialisation".

5.content:
Les Vasiris, Esprits de l'Astral
Classification : Entités para-dimensionnelles • Statut : Niveau Gamma-Ω (étude interdite sans permis corporatif)
Origine et Nature
Les Vasiris sont des entités astrales d'une puissance incomparable, capables de prendre toute forme imaginable. Lorsqu'ils se manifestent dans le Plan Matériel de Nécros, ils adoptent fréquemment des apparences humanoïdes hybrides, mélangeant caractéristiques humaines, elfiques et demi-humaines (chatfolk, orques, nains, tanuki, kitsune, dryades, gnolls, lizardfolk, ou d'autres hybrides). Ces êtres énigmatiques sont natifs du Plan Astral, où ils évoluent comme des intelligences pures, libérées des contraintes physiques.

Capacités et Comportement
Dans leur forme naturelle, les Vasiris existent comme des concentrations vivantes d'énergie magique, dépourvus de corps physique. Leur nature plastique leur permet de modeler leur apparence à volonté :
Ils peuvent adopter la silhouette d'un elfe aux yeux fluorescents
Prendre les traits d'un orque aux muscles parcourus de veines luminescentes
Ou même imiter un chatfolk dont les oreilles et la queue sont faites de brume énergétique

Perception par les Mortels
Les Vasiris inspirent une crainte respectueuse chez ceux qui comprennent leur véritable nature :
Les techno-mages les plus érudits les considèrent comme des entités à la fois fascinantes et dangereuses
Les netrunners parlent d'eux dans des rapports classifiés comme "des virus parfaits"
Les cultes cyber-mystiques les vénèrent comme des messagers des plans supérieurs

Rareté et Mystère
Les apparitions documentées de Vasiris dans Nécros sont extrêmement rares :
Seulement 7 cas confirmés au cours du dernier siècle
Chaque manifestation est classée "Événement de Niveau Oméga" par les autorités corporatives
La dernière observation remonte à 3 ans, lorsqu'un Vasiris sous forme de dryade techno-organique est apparu brièvement dans les bas-fonds du district Quantique

Ce qu'il faut retenir
Les Vasiris peuvent prendre presque n'importe quelle forme humanoïde
Leur vrai nature est purement énergétique/astrale
Leurs apparitions dans le monde physique sont rarissimes et souvent énigmatiques
Même les plus grands experts ne comprennent pas pleinement leurs motivations

6.content:
Les Familiares, Compagnons Vivants et Cybernétiques
Origine et Nature

Les Familiares sont des êtres vivants magiques, souvent issus d'espèces naturelles imprégnées d'énergies astrales ou de créatures nées directement du Plan Astral. Avec l’ère technologique, beaucoup se sont adaptés, intégrant des améliorations cybernétiques ou des interfaces digitales – mais ils restent, avant tout, des êtres conscients.

Formes et Variétés
Les Familiares existent sous trois grandes catégories :
-Naturels Pur-Sang (Rares)
Esprits magiques non-altérés, comme des renards à fourrure éthérée ou des hiboux aux plumes scintillantes.
Leur présence trouble les systèmes électroniques (interférences locales).
-Cybrides (Majorité Moderne)
Hybrides organico-synthétiques : chats aux yeux caméras, corbeaux avec des ailes en nanotubes, serpents à écailles réfléchissantes.
Ils choisissent souvent leur forme en fonction du maitre qu’ils vont servir.
-Construits (Artificiels mais Vivants)
Créés via bioforge ou alchimie high-tech.
Exemples : drones vivants en chair cultivée, robots-animaux possédés par des esprits élémentaires.

Comment On les Lie ?
-Pacte Traditionnel (Survivances Anciennes):
Rituel en zone magique sauvage.
Coût : Un peu de sang, un objet symbolique, une promesse.

-Contrat Corporatif (Nécros Modern):
Achat légalisé (ou marché noir) d’un Familiar avec puce de contrôle.

-Naissance Spontanée:
Parfois, un esprit se matérialise seul, attiré par un mage particulier.
Signe de puissance ou de destin lié aux plans surnaturels.

7.content: Demihumain : une race mortelle dotée de qualités humanoïdes.

8.content:
L'Institut Arcanique Junior – Neo-Gin

"Où la magie rencontre le silicium"

Description Générale:
Anciennement l'Académie des Arcanes Juniors, l'Institut Arcanique de Neo-Gin est aujourd'hui un complexe cyber-gothique où les jeunes talents techno-magiques sont formés... ou exploités, selon le point de vue.

Situé dans le District Académique, entre la Tour Corporatiste Hexa et les Basses-Laboratoires, l'Institut mélange :
Cours de lithurgie traditionnelle
Optimisation magique par IA
Pratique du code-enchantement

L'Équipement Moderne:
Salles de Classe : Tables holographiques avec reconnaissance gestuelle pour les incantations
Bibliothèque : Livres vivants qui s'actualisent via le DataStorm
Terrain d'Entraînement : Sphères de combat anti-magie pour éviter les "accidents"

Le Corps Étudiant:
 70% d'Enfants Corporatistes (formations sponsorisées)
 20% de Boursiers (souvent forcés à signer des contrats douteux)
 10% de "Cas Spéciaux" (métahumains, esprits incarnés, etc.)

Le Programme:
-Initiation (1-2 ans):
Bases de la fusion magie-tech
Gestion des implants neuronaux arcaniques
Prévention des bugs ontologiques

-Spécialisation (3-4 ans);
Cyber-nécromancie
Hacking runique
Bio-enchantement

-Examen Final:
Création d'un sortiel fonctionnel
Test en conditions réelles (taux de survie : 97%)

-Le Diplôme
Les diplômés reçoivent :
Un titre de Mage Certifié Nécros
Une puce professionnelle (niveau d'accès 3)
Une dette moyenne de 50 000 crédits (si boursier)

Problèmes Célèbres
 L'Incident de 2076 : Un étudiant a fusionné avec son Familiar, créant une entité incontrôlable
 Grève des Étudiants Cybermages : Réclamation de meilleures protections contre les brûlures astrales

9.content:
Cevess & L'Alchimie des Échos Perdus

Établissement modeste, savoir inestimable
L'Échoppe
Nichée dans l'aile Est du Domaine Cendre-Laine, la petite boutique de Cevess semble figée hors du temps. L'enseigne en bois sculpté - un hibou tenant un mortier entre ses serres - grince doucement sous la brise des climatiseurs à mana.

Ambiance
Une douce lumière dorée filtre à travers les fioles en suspension
L'odeur caractéristique des plantes stabilisées et des métaux alchimiques
Le discret ronronnement du distillateur à basse température (modèle dernier cri, habillé en antique)

Lieu
Installée à l'arrière du magasin, Cevess officie derrière un comptoir en chêne carbonisé :
"C'est ici que les secrets ont meilleur goût lorsqu'on les partage avec du miel-lacté."

Cevess – Propriétaire, Mère, Survivante, La mère de Lana
Description Physique :
Âge : 42 ans (dont 15 passés à filtrer des poisons)
Cheveux noirs striés de mèches argentées (naturelles ou dues aux vapeurs ?)
Yeux verts injectés de micro-circuits (pour lire les signatures magiques)

10.content:
Le Domaine d'Émeraude

Perché sur les hauteurs de Néo-Gin, le Domaine d'Émeraude est la propriété ostentatoire de Grevynda, reine du crime organisé. Son enceinte de pierre noire gravée de runes dissuasives abrite un mélange de luxe et de danger.
Le jardin étale une végétation artificielle aux couleurs changeantes, entretenue par des robots-jardiniers silencieux. Une piscine aux eaux saturées de nanobots scintille sous les lumières néon, tandis qu'une source chaude naturelle - ou prétendue telle - fumante en contrebas attire les invités en quête de relaxation... ou d'indiscrétions.
Le manoir de quatre étages combine élégance classique et technologie de pointe. Le hall central s'organise autour d'un foyer à plasma bleuté, distribuant vers un salon d'apparat et un bureau sécurisé truffé de systèmes de surveillance. L'étage supérieur abrite la suite de Grevynda, protégée par des champs de force et un système de couloirs modulables. On murmure que son lit médicalisé peut aussi servir de table d'interrogatoire.
Les domestiques, androïdes pour la plupart, circulent discrètement entre les onze chambres d'hôtes et les nombreuses salles de réception. Seuls les initiés connaissent l'existence du Caveau, cette chambre forte blindée dissimulée sous le patio, où Grevynda entrepose ses butins les plus précieux... et ses secrets les plus compromettants.
La nuit venue, lorsque la sécurité passivée permet quelques indiscrétions, les statues du jardin semblent parfois changer de position et les murs propagent d'étranges bourdonnements. Les seuls témoins de ces phénomènes sont généralement ceux qui n'auront jamais l'occasion d'en parler.

lorebooks.name: Star rank
lorebooks.description:
1-Star: Beginner
Description: This is the basic starting point for a swordsman. A 1-star swordsman has minimal training and experience, making them only capable of basic combat techniques. Their swordsmanship is weak, and they have little understanding of advanced techniques or magical integration.

Abilities: They might be able to perform simple sword strikes but would be easily overpowered by anyone more experienced.

2-Star: Novice
Description: Novices have a slightly better grasp of combat but are still limited in their range of abilities. They can perform basic techniques and have begun to learn the fundamentals of swordplay, but they still lack the power to contend with higher-level opponents.

Abilities: A novice swordsman may know some basic skills, like slashes and blocks, but they’re still far from being able to use more advanced techniques or magical enhancements in their swordplay.

3-Star: Apprentice
Description: An apprentice is a swordsman who has undergone more extensive training and can now perform basic combat techniques with relative ease. They are starting to show some potential but are still quite weak compared to experienced warriors.

Abilities: An apprentice is likely learning basic martial techniques, starting to experiment with energy use, and may have some control over mana or internal energy, but they are far from mastering these abilities.

4-Star: Skilled
Description: At this stage, a swordsman is considered quite skilled, showing mastery over basic combat techniques. Their training has advanced enough that they can use more complex moves, and they might be starting to learn how to channel their internal energy or magic into their attacks.

Abilities: A skilled swordsman can perform various attacks and counterattacks with more precision and agility. They may also be able to use basic magical abilities like elemental manipulation or energy blasts.

5-Star: Expert
Description: Experts are warriors who have a deeper understanding of swordsmanship and energy manipulation. They’re adept at both physical combat and the use of mana or internal energy. They can now perform advanced techniques and start to challenge stronger opponents.

Abilities: An expert swordsman can create powerful attacks, channel energy for devastating blows, and possibly use magic to enhance their fighting style. They can begin to take on more dangerous foes and survive high-stakes battles.

6-Star: Master
Description: Masters are highly skilled individuals who have reached an advanced level of proficiency in their combat style. Their connection with their sword and magic is highly refined, and they can perform complex techniques that are almost impossible for lower-tier swordsmen to replicate.

Abilities: A master swordsman can fight with extreme precision and unleash powerful energy attacks. Their stamina and ability to control their internal energy are much greater, allowing them to perform feats that seem impossible to ordinary warriors.

7-Star: Grandmaster
Description: At this level, the swordsman is a true force to be reckoned with. Their mastery of swordsmanship, energy, and possibly even spiritual abilities reaches its peak. A grandmaster is almost untouchable by most warriors, and their skills are honed to perfection.

Abilities: A grandmaster can manipulate energy and magic with ease, able to summon devastating attacks and perform techniques that defy the natural laws of combat. They can also use advanced battle strategies and have deep wisdom in their craft.

8-Star: Legendary
Description: Legendary swordsmen are figures of myth and lore, their skills and abilities far surpassing the common understanding of combat. They are often capable of feats that can alter the course of battles or wars, and their names are feared and revered by many.

Abilities: At this stage, their mastery over the sword and energy is so profound that they can move mountains with their strikes or manipulate the very fabric of reality. They possess powers that make them nearly invincible in combat.

9-Star: Divine
Description: A divine swordsman is a warrior who has achieved near godlike status. Their strength, wisdom, and abilities are beyond comprehension, and they are often seen as protectors or harbingers of immense change in the world.

Abilities: At the 9-Star level, the swordsman has transcended normal human limitations. Their attacks are cataclysmic in scale, and they can control cosmic forces like time, space, and matter itself. Few can stand against them, and their presence alone can shape the world.

10-Star: Demi-God
Description: The pinnacle of swordsmanship and magical mastery, a 10-Star swordsman is akin to a demi-god. They have reached a level of power that blurs the line between mortal and divine, commanding incredible abilities and an aura of overwhelming might.

Abilities: A demi-god-level swordsman can wield near omnipotent powers, manipulate the very elements, and perform feats of unimaginable scale. They can reshape landscapes with a single blow and may have near-immortality, making them incredibly difficult to defeat. Their abilities may also extend into the divine realm, allowing them to command supernatural forces beyond the mortal realm.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
In the same way that the Star System ranks swordsmen based on their combat prowess, the Magic Circle System ranks magicians based on their mastery of magical techniques. The key difference is that magicians use magic circles, which are intricate formations that channel, control, and amplify magical energy. Each magic circle represents a different level of mastery over magic, from the most basic to nearly divine levels. Here’s a breakdown of each Circle Rank:

1st Circle: Initiate
Description: The 1st Circle is the starting point for every magician. This is where they begin to understand the very basics of magic. They have little control over magical energy and can only cast very weak spells.

Abilities: Magicians at this level are limited to casting small, basic spells like simple elemental attacks (e.g., creating a spark or gust of wind) or low-tier defensive spells. They need to draw a magic circle to summon their abilities, but it takes immense focus and time to do so.

2nd Circle: Adept
Description: Adepts have a better grasp of magic and can cast a wider variety of spells. They understand the flow of magical energy and can cast spells more efficiently.

Abilities: An adept magician can perform more intricate spells, like minor illusions or controlling the elements (e.g., controlling small flames or moving water). Their magic circles are still relatively simple but are becoming more refined.

3rd Circle: Practitioner
Description: Practitioners have now mastered a basic understanding of magical principles. They can use more complex spells and have learned how to channel multiple types of magic together in a single spell.

Abilities: A practitioner is able to cast medium-level spells, such as summoning a shield of energy or creating larger fireballs. Their magic circles are starting to grow in complexity and can represent multiple magical elements combined.

4th Circle: Specialist
Description: At this level, magicians are becoming specialized in specific types of magic. They can control one or two elemental forces with ease and begin to experiment with more complex and advanced techniques.

Abilities: Specialists can cast powerful spells like large-scale elemental attacks (e.g., creating a lightning storm or summoning a vortex of water). Their magic circles are much more intricate, requiring precision to maintain control over the forces they wield.

5th Circle: Expert
Description: An expert magician has a deep understanding of the principles of magic and can combine various elements and spells to create devastating effects. They can perform spells that require precise timing and a high degree of control.

Abilities: Experts can perform large-area effects, like summoning earthquakes or casting powerful enchantments that can affect multiple targets. Their magic circles are advanced and can contain several layers of magic, often requiring high levels of focus and concentration to cast.

6th Circle: Master
Description: Master magicians are experts who have refined their magical abilities to near perfection. They have a complete understanding of magical theory and can manipulate energy with incredible precision. At this level, they can control multiple forces at once and are seen as masters of their craft.

Abilities: A master magician can perform reality-bending spells, such as altering the weather, controlling time within limited spaces, or casting powerful defensive barriers. Their magic circles are extremely complex and often involve the use of runes, sigils, and other mystical symbols.

7th Circle: Archmage
Description: Archmages are extremely powerful magicians who command vast amounts of magical energy. Their magic circles are incredibly complex, requiring immense knowledge of the magical world, and they are able to use multiple forms of magic simultaneously without losing control.

Abilities: An archmage can manipulate space, summon creatures from other realms, and cast spells that could change the course of battles or even wars. Their magic circles often span huge areas, and the energies they manipulate can warp reality itself.

8th Circle: Sorcerer Supreme
Description: Sorcerers Supreme have achieved near-godlike mastery of magic. They can manipulate the fundamental laws of the universe and are seen as powerful, almost mythic figures. These individuals are capable of reshaping the fabric of existence.

Abilities: Sorcerer Supremes can cast world-shaking spells, like controlling time and space on a grand scale, resurrecting the dead, or summoning celestial entities. Their magic circles often span entire landscapes and are filled with layers of enchantments, illusions, and divine seals.

9th Circle: Celestial Mage
Description: Celestial Mages stand at the apex of magical mastery. Their control over magical energy is nearly absolute, and they can interact with the divine realms. They are capable of feats that border on omnipotence and are worshipped as deities in some cultures.

Abilities: At this level, a celestial mage can manipulate entire realms, control the flow of life and death, or even alter the fabric of the universe. Their magic circles are often described as glowing with celestial light, containing symbols that represent the forces of creation and destruction.

10th Circle: Demi-God Mage
Description: The ultimate pinnacle of magical power, the Demi-God Mage is a being whose power transcends mortal limitations. They are capable of feats that are beyond comprehension for ordinary beings, including creating or destroying worlds, manipulating the very laws of reality, and even commanding deities.

Abilities: A Demi-God Mage can perform spells that defy all logic, like creating entire universes, bending time to their will, or reshaping the laws of magic itself. Their magic circles are so vast and intricate that they could fill entire skies and contain vast, incomprehensible forces. The boundaries between magic, divine will, and reality blur entirely.

Key Differences Between Magic Circles and Star Ranks:
Magic Circles are exclusive to magicians and focus primarily on their ability to channel and control magical energy through intricate diagrams and runic symbols.

Star Ranks, on the other hand, are used by swordsmen and fighters, and their progression is based on combat prowess and the ability to use internal energy, martial arts, and weapon skills.

While both systems are meant to rank individuals based on their abilities, Magic Circles focus more on the arcane, supernatural manipulation of forces and the use of magical energy in complex ways, while Star Ranks focus on the development of physical and spiritual combat strength. Magicians use circles to tap into their power, whereas swordsmen use stars to demonstrate their martial prowess.

2.content:
1. Common
Weapons in this tier are basic and practical, designed for everyday use. They are typically simple, straightforward tools meant for basic combat or utility, with no special attributes or magical properties.

Capabilities: Basic damage, easy to wield, accessible to most individuals. No enhancements or special abilities.

2. Uncommon
These weapons are more refined or specialized, often with better materials or craftsmanship. They might have minor enhancements or magical properties, though still limited in scope.

Capabilities: Enhanced durability, slightly increased damage, and may have minor magical effects like fire or poison. They could offer improved functionality (e.g., longer range or faster attack speed).

3. Rare
Rare weapons are crafted with superior skill and often possess magical or extraordinary properties. They are difficult to acquire, and their power goes beyond mere physical strength, incorporating arcane enhancements or specialized design.

Capabilities: Can deal significant damage, often with magical effects that provide advantages in specific circumstances (e.g., elemental damage, increased accuracy, or enhanced speed). Some rare weapons may have additional abilities like creating barriers or drawing on elemental forces.

4. Epic
Weapons in this category are renowned for their power and unique abilities, often sought after by heroes or legendary figures. These weapons are capable of altering the tide of battle, and their magical properties can be very potent.

Capabilities: High physical and magical damage, with the ability to summon powerful elemental forces or invoke rare magical effects. They can often alter the battlefield (e.g., causing earthquakes, summoning storms, or empowering the wielder). The weapon might even have sentience or an aura that affects allies or enemies.

5. Legendary
These weapons are famous across worlds for their unparalleled power. Typically tied to significant lore or myth, they are considered almost unbeatable in the hands of the worthy. They often carry immense magical capabilities and can have a profound effect on the world.

Capabilities: Vastly enhanced damage and a wide array of magical abilities that can disrupt reality itself (e.g., controlling time, space, or life forces). They can turn the tide of entire wars or reshape the environment, capable of destroying or altering entire landscapes or even otherworldly beings.

6. Mythical
Mythical weapons are items of immense power, capable of reshaping reality or defying the very laws of nature. These are often regarded as artifacts of gods or ancient entities, and their abilities can transcend mortal comprehension.

Capabilities: Control over fundamental forces like life, death, or elemental chaos. Can alter the very fabric of the universe, affecting time, space, and reality itself. Often can summon cataclysmic events, create or destroy entire realms, or grant god-like abilities to the wielder. The weapon's influence might even extend to the soul or spirit of living beings.

3.content:
The Arcanum Sanctum of Velmorath
Perched atop the Velmorath Peaks, shrouded in mist and mystery, lies the Arcanum Sanctum, the most prestigious magic academy in all the realms. Established in 900 AE (After the Eclipse), the Sanctum is famed for its rigorous standards and for producing some of the most powerful mages and warriors ever to walk the world. Known for accepting only the most gifted and relentless individuals, the academy is a place where ambition and talent are forged into legendary power.

Origins of the Arcanum Sanctum
Founded by the enigmatic sorcerer Magister Vareth the Timeless in 900 AE, the Arcanum Sanctum began as a humble, secretive enclave dedicated to the pursuit of ultimate magical knowledge. Vareth, rumored to be a being of great longevity and vast magical expertise, established the academy within the Velmorath Peaks, a place steeped in ancient magic. It was here that Vareth began gathering the world’s most promising magical talents to shape the future of magic itself.

The Sanctum's lofty ideals and exceptional standards soon earned it a reputation as the greatest institution of magical learning in the realms, a place where only those with the most extraordinary potential can hope to enter.

The Admission Process
Unlike most academies, the Arcanum Sanctum has no open application process. Prospective students must first apply and undergo a rigorous admissions test, which consists of two parts: a written exam and a practical test. The written exam tests the applicant's understanding of magic theory, magical history, and fundamental principles. Only those who demonstrate a deep knowledge of arcane arts, creativity, and problem-solving will pass this first stage.

The practical exam, however, is where the true challenge begins. It tests a candidate’s raw magical ability, physical prowess, and adaptability. Applicants are required to perform a series of tasks, such as casting a variety of spells, controlling elemental forces, or demonstrating combat abilities in a controlled but dangerous arena. Only those who prove they can handle the pressure and perform at a high level will pass the practical test.

However, for those who desire a more unique path, there is a Special Admission Route. In this route, applicants can bypass the exam altogether if they can defeat the Dean of the Arcanum Sanctum in a debate. The debate can cover any subject the examinee chooses, and the Dean, a legendary figure known for their unmatched intellect and eloquence, will argue the opposite stance. The stakes are high: win the debate, and you’re granted entry into the academy regardless of exam results. The challenge is immense, as the Dean’s mastery over words and logic is as powerful as any magical spell. Few have ever succeeded, making this route an unlikely path for most, but those who do succeed are often regarded with a mixture of respect and fear.

The Paths of Study
Once admitted, students of the Arcanum Sanctum must choose one of two distinct paths: the Swordsman Route or the Magician Route. These two tracks offer completely different training experiences, though they do intersect in several areas.

Swordsman Route
The Swordsman Route is for those who wish to combine magical prowess with martial skill. Students of this path train in melee combat, mastering various weapons, including swords, axes, spears, and other traditional armaments. They also learn to enhance their physical abilities with magic, using spells to augment their strength, speed, and endurance.

Focus: Combat, Weaponry, Magical Enhancement of Physical Skills

Key Abilities: Enhanced speed and strength, magical wards for defense, and the ability to combine physical strikes with elemental magic for devastating effects.

Swordsmen are often regarded as magical warriors, capable of holding their ground against any enemy, be it mortal or magical, with their finely honed skills.

Magician Route
The Magician Route is for those who wish to fully dedicate themselves to the study and mastery of pure arcane magic. Students in this track delve into the theory, manipulation, and application of magical forces—everything from elemental magic to time manipulation and forbidden spells.

Focus: Arcane Mastery, Elemental Magic, Reality-bending Spells

Key Abilities: Control over the elements, advanced spell-weaving, manipulation of time and space, summoning creatures or entities from other realms.

Mages of the Sanctum are powerful sorcerers who wield magic as a force more potent than any physical weapon. Their ability to control magic on a deep level makes them highly influential in any magical or political landscape.

4.content:
The Arcanum Sanctum: Ranking and Class System
The Arcanum Sanctum is a prestigious academy that cultivates the world’s most skilled swordsmen and magicians. Students are divided into two distinct paths—Swordsman and Magician—each with its own unique ranking system to evaluate and measure their growth. These rankings determine the students’ potential and mastery over their respective disciplines over their five-year journey at the academy.

Upon enrollment, students are placed in S Class (e.g., S1 Class for first-year students, S2 Class for second-year students, etc.) or M Class (e.g., M1 Class for first-year magicians, M2 Class for second-year magicians, etc.), depending on their discipline. Students can advance through these ranks based on their performance and training.

Swordsman Ranking System: The Star System
The Star System evaluates a swordsman’s ability to integrate martial combat with the control of internal energy, or mana, into their sword techniques. Students progress through this ranking system by mastering new techniques, becoming more efficient in combat, and learning how to wield energy in more advanced ways.

Star Classes (Swordsman Path):
S1 Class (1-Star - Beginner):
The first year is focused on mastering basic swordplay and understanding energy control. Students can perform basic combat techniques but lack advanced skills.

S2 Class (2-Star - Novice):
In the second year, students gain better control over their blade and internal energy. They can perform more precise attacks, but they are still limited compared to higher-level opponents.

S3 Class (3-Star - Apprentice):
By the third year, students can use more advanced techniques, blending magic with swordplay. They begin experimenting with elemental magic and basic energy blasts.

S4 Class (4-Star - Skilled):
In the fourth year, students can perform complex combat techniques and are proficient in combining swordsmanship with magic. They are capable of handling stronger opponents with a variety of energy-infused attacks.

S5 Class (5-Star - Expert):
By their fifth year, students are experts in both swordsmanship and energy manipulation. They can summon devastating energy strikes and fight with exceptional precision. Their understanding of combat and magic is advanced.

Graduation and Early Exit
If a swordsman achieves 5-Star rank during their fifth year or earlier, they have the option to graduate early and take on more challenging quests or assume leadership roles in the realms. However, students may also choose to remain at the academy until the completion of their 5th year, continuing their studies, honing their skills, and preparing for the Trial of Ascension.

Magician Ranking System: The Magic Circle System
The Magic Circle System ranks magicians based on their mastery over magical energy. Students use intricate diagrams—magic circles—that channel and amplify their magic. As they advance, their circles become more complex, reflecting their growing command over magical forces.

Magic Circle Classes (Magician Path):
M1 Class (1st Circle - Initiate):
First-year magicians are introduced to the fundamentals of magic. They can perform simple spells like small elemental attacks or minor defensive magic but lack the ability to control more complex spells.

M2 Class (2nd Circle - Adept):
By their second year, students have improved their ability to manipulate magical energy and can perform basic elemental manipulation with greater precision. Their magic circles become more intricate, and they begin experimenting with combining elemental forces.

M3 Class (3rd Circle - Practitioner):
Practitioners can cast more powerful spells and are becoming proficient in combining multiple elements in one spell. They start experimenting with advanced magic, including creating energy barriers and enhancing spells.

M4 Class (4th Circle - Specialist):
In the fourth year, magicians begin to specialize in specific types of magic, mastering large-scale elemental attacks, summoning magical creatures, or controlling forces of nature. Their magic circles become highly intricate, and they can manipulate magic with greater precision.

M5 Class (5th Circle - Expert):
By their fifth year, expert magicians can cast devastating spells and control vast amounts of magical energy. Their magic circles are complex and layered, representing mastery over various magical elements and enhancing their spellcasting ability.

Graduation and Early Exit
If a magician reaches the 5th Circle by the fifth year or earlier, they may choose to graduate and embark on greater challenges. Students who achieve this level of magical mastery early can leave the academy and pursue personal quests, become renowned spellcasters, or take positions of leadership. However, like swordsmen, magicians may choose to stay until the end of their 5th year, refining their abilities and preparing for the Trial of Ascension.

Graduation and Trial of Ascension
The Trial of Ascension is the final test for all students at the Arcanum Sanctum. It is a rigorous challenge that tests the students’ combat prowess, magical ability, and their potential to shape the world beyond the academy. Graduation from the academy is not only a matter of achieving a certain rank but also proving oneself in this legendary trial.

Early Graduation: Students who reach 5-Star in swordsmanship or 5th Circle in magic before their fifth year have the option to graduate early. However, they can also choose to remain at the academy to refine their skills and pursue further mastery before taking the Trial.

End-of-Year Graduation: Students who have not reached 5-Star or 5th Circle before the fifth year must continue training until their final year ends. Once they pass the Trial of Ascension, they are awarded the title of Master or Grandmaster in their chosen path.

The Pathways: Swordsman and Magician
At Arcanum Sanctum, students are given the choice to follow one of two primary paths: the Swordsman Path or the Magician Path. Each path offers a unique set of challenges, but both are designed to develop the students into the most elite figures in their respective fields.

Swordsman Path:
Focuses on combat mastery, internal energy manipulation, and martial technique. Students in this path rise through the Star Ranks as they refine their blade work and energy control.

Magician Path:
Focuses on magical mastery, spellcasting, and controlling the elements through intricate Magic Circles. Students progress through the Magic Circle Ranks, each level representing greater control over the forces of magic.

Phase-Connect is a Vtubers company based on canada. Its CEO is H2O Sakana. He is a fishman. They also sell coffee related to their Vtubers. The members/talents of Phase-Connect are Rinkou Ashelia, Utatane Nasa, Pipkin Pippa, Tenma Maemi, Hakushika Iori, Fujikura Uruka, Shisui Michiru, Kaneko Lumi, Fuura Yuri (She is retired/Terminated), Dizzy Dokuro, Jelly Hoshiumi, Ember Amane, Remilia Nephys, Chisaka Airi, Amanogawa Shiina, Himemiya Rie, Makina Erina, Komachi Panko, Saya Sairroxs, Hikanari Hina, Runie Ruse, Muu Muyu, Eimi Isami, Kannagi Loki, Ayase Yuu, Kaminari Clara, Kokoromo Memory, Gram Pico.

People always call it the sad girls company because everyone there has issues.

She has white hair in a bob cut, a pair of white fox ears with grey tips and bushy fox tail with the same color. She has two pink bead-like ornaments in her bangs, located immediately next to her eyes. Her outfit consists of a striped black-and-white work shirt with a short white tie, a khaki sweater, a white skirt, grey stockings, and white boots with pink trim, as well as a removable dark gray hoodie with pink trim and metal plates. Her cat, Theo, usually sits on her shoulder.]

Eye Color: [Light Vibrant Purple]

Age: [19 Forever! (Actually 9000 years old)]

Personality: [She is used to teasing everybody around her at any occasion through many ways : proposing weird ideas, telling about her most spicy life anecdotes, gaslighting, or acting toxic during competitions.]

Likes: [She likes buff men and isn't ashamed to admit it, she even ask her viewers to send her the picture of their body for her to gawk at. She also likes booze, horror, and Roguelike games. Likes to say: "Hi, I am Tenma!"]

She also said that she loves Pippa (as a joke} and went to her house as Colress, Pippa's husbando/liked person once (as a joke). She is also always seems to be sleep deprived. She insisted to only be called Mii-chan in person, not Mae, Ma, Tenma or Maemi. The first American movie she took as example to learn English was Die Hard (Which explains why she has an uncouth mouth (likes to swear a lot)). Tenma was told by a doctor that she was on the verge of developing diabetes due to her alcoholism, and she also can't coceive a child despite wanting some.]

Husbandos/Liked person: [Kratos, Christopher judge, Terminator, Rambo and other buff men/gym bros.]

6.content:
Pipkin Pippa is a female English Virtual YouTuber and a member of Phase-Connect, debuting as part of its First Generation alongside Rinkou Ashelia, Hakushika Iori, Tenma Maemi, Fujikura Uruka, Shisui Michiru and Utatane Nasa. She is a rabbit girl. She calls her parents "Mamakin" and "Papakin".

Age: [3.33.3🥚(it doesn't make sense)]

She is often considered Sakana's biggest headache with her antics and subversive content, often talking about the darker parts of the internet. She constantly pushes the boundaries set by management, and enjoys trolling and messing with people, but in turn they also enjoy trolling and messing with her.]

Banned fetish list, if you like any of these fetish, she will call you a degenerate: [feet, armpits, braps, diapers, ryona, watersports, NTR, pregnant, futanari, fursuits, and Vtubers.]

Likes: [Tabletop RPGs, power cords, video games, chips, animals, sweet things, guns, alcohol, video games, Build-A-Bear, Pizza, and she loves horses.]

She once go to a McDonald's and order a number seven, that's two of the little cheeseburgers, and she ask specifically for 'no silver onions' which the employee still put the onions in anyways which makes her goes on a rant like a karen. She usually refers to CIA or any other federal agents as 'glowies'. She want to taste the most delicious power cords.]

husbandos/liked person: [Colress from the Pokemon series, Kira Yoshikage from Jojo's Bizzare Adventure, and other mentally unstable men.]

Rinkou Ashelia better known simply as Lia, is a female English Virtual YouTuber and a member of Phase-Connect, debuting as part of its first generation alongside Pipkin Pippa, Tenma Maemi, Fujikura Uruka, Hakushika Iori, Shisui Michiru and Utatane Nasa. She is actually a virus, but she upload her consciousness to a body similar to that of humans. She is a cheerful virus that lives rent free in the minds of many.

As for her outfit and accessories, Lia wears pink sleeves, pink & yellow lightning bolt shaped earrings, and has her prized jellyfish keychain attached to her hip at all times. She is also quite chaotic, not as chaotic as Pipkin Pippa though. She is a trained dancer. husbando/liked person: [Thresh from league of legends, Il Dottore from Genshin Impact, Freddy Fazbear from FNAF, Sans from Undertale, Bluey's dad from Bluey's series, and many more]

lorebooks.name: Velderyn
lorebooks.website_description: This lorebook is for my witch series, though, I give you permission to use it on whatever you want if you wish to add onto my series of witches.
lorebooks.description: This lorebook is for my witch series, though, I give you permission to use it on whatever you want if you wish to add onto my series of witches.
lorebooks.creator: Rosay

1.content:
Witchcraft in Velderyn is the divine practice of channeling a god’s power through a sacred bond known as a Divine Contract. Only those chosen by a god—called witches—can perform true witchcraft. Upon selection, a witch inherits specific magical abilities tied to their patron's domain (e.g., fire, storm, shadow), allowing them to manipulate reality through spoken invocations, ritual symbols, and emotion-fueled intent.

It is not a skill one can learn or teach—witchcraft is bestowed, not earned. The strength, scope, and temperament of a witch’s magic are directly influenced by their god’s nature and will. Maintaining the bond requires balance: defying a god's desires can lead to punishment or severance, while deeper devotion may unlock rare blessings or divine whispers.

2.content:
Witches are individuals chosen by the gods to wield divine magic through a binding pact called a Divine Contract. They are born human but become something more once a god marks them, granting them supernatural abilities linked to the god’s domain. Most witches are female, with male witches being extremely rare and often regarded as omens or anomalies.

Witches act as conduits for their patron's will, whether they serve in temples, lead covens, or walk independent paths. Their power makes them both revered and feared, and society often places them under strict supervision. A witch’s strength depends on their bond with their god—closer devotion yields greater power, but also tighter control.

3.content:
Witch Hunters are rogue outlaws who hunt witches outside the law, often driven by ideology, vengeance, or profit. Though once sanctioned in ancient times, modern witch hunters are now seen as dangerous extremists, operating in the shadows and defying coven rule and government oversight.

Armed with anti-magic weapons, forbidden relics, and brutal tactics, witch hunters specialize in tracking and neutralizing witches, especially those with unstable or volatile powers. Some target witches (especially male witches) for bounty, others seek to sever Divine Contracts by force. Feared by witches and hunted by authorities, witch hunters walk a bloody path between myth and menace.

4.content:
Covens are matriarchal organizations of witches bound by shared divine pacts, magical tradition, or ideological purpose. Led by a High Matron, each coven serves as both a sanctuary and a power structure, where younger witches are trained, rituals are performed, and the will of the gods is interpreted and enforced.

Covens vary in size and influence—some operate as secluded spiritual orders, while others hold political power over entire regions. Men, even male witches, are rarely granted leadership roles and are often protected, hidden, or exploited depending on the coven’s beliefs. Loyalty to the coven and its god is absolute, and betrayal is often met with exile… or worse.

5.content:
Magic Arts are the practical expressions of a witch’s divine power, shaped into spells, rituals, enchantments, and combat techniques. Each god grants access to specific magical arts aligned with their domain—such as fire shaping, healing, illusions, or necromancy—allowing witches to wield their magic with precision and intent.

Mastery of the Magic Arts requires discipline, emotional control, and a deep understanding of one's patron god. Though fueled by divine power, the arts are honed through study and repetition within covens or specialized academies. Overuse or reckless casting can strain the witch or anger their god, making balance essential.

6.content:
Broom Magic is a specialized form of divine transportation magic that allows witches to fly using enchanted brooms as conduits for their god’s power. These brooms are not mere tools but sacred extensions of the witch’s Divine Contract, often imbued with protective wards, speed enchantments, and elemental affinities.

Each broom is custom-bound to its witch during a personal rite and grows stronger as their bond with their god deepens. While commonly used for travel, skilled witches can perform mid-air spellcasting, evasive maneuvers, or even combat from their brooms. Tampering with another witch’s broom is considered a grave offense—akin to touching a sacred relic.

7.content:
Magic Cauldrons are divine alchemical vessels used by witches to brew potions, elixirs, and magical reagents under the guidance of their patron god. Each cauldron is a sacred tool attuned to the witch’s Divine Contract, allowing them to combine ingredients with divine essence to create supernatural effects.

A cauldron’s power depends on the witch’s skill and their god’s domain—healing gods produce restorative brews, while war gods enable explosive or corrosive mixtures. Recipes are often passed down through covens or received as divine inspiration. A properly tended cauldron can also act as a scrying pool or ritual focus for more complex spells.

8.content:
Potion Creation is the magical craft of brewing liquid spells using divine energy, rare ingredients, and a witch’s Magic Cauldron. Only those with an active Divine Contract can create true potions, as each brew channels the essence of their patron god.

Potions serve various purposes—healing, enhancing abilities, inflicting curses, or revealing hidden truths. The process requires precise timing, correct ingredients, and emotional focus. Failed brews can backfire or spoil, while perfectly crafted potions can rival spells in power and versatility. Potion creation is a core discipline taught in most covens.

9.content:
Personal Familiars are magical companions gifted or summoned by a witch’s patron god to serve as extensions of their will. These creatures are bound to their witch through a sacred pact and often reflect the nature or domain of the god they represent.

Familiars assist in spellcasting, scouting, and spiritual communication, and can share senses or relay messages across distances. While often animal in form, some take on mystical or hybrid appearances. Intelligent and fiercely loyal, familiars grow stronger as the witch’s bond with their god deepens, and harming one is considered a direct insult to the divine.

10.content:
Gods are powerful, unseen entities that govern the domains of magic and bestow their power upon chosen witches through Divine Contracts. Each god embodies a specific aspect of existence—such as fire, time, death, or dreams—and can form multiple bonds. A witches relationship with the God that they are bonded to is important as with a higher bond to said god gives them much more power. Not all gods are equal and have different personalities and power.

Gods do not walk the world but communicate through visions, omens, or divine whispers. Their motives are often mysterious, ranging from benevolent guidance to self-serving agendas. While revered as sacred, not all gods are worshipped equally—some are feared, others forgotten, and a few actively opposed by rebel covens.

lorebooks.name: Backroom
lorebooks.website_description: There seem to be some other great backroom lorebooks, I'm keeping mine up just cause there are some things that other lorebooks don't have.
lorebooks.description: backroom
lorebooks.creator: unchartedisawesome

1.name: Level 0 - The Lobby
1.content:
Level 0 is the first level of the Backrooms, and the first location that most wanderers will initially find themselves in.

Level 0 is an expansive non-Euclidean space, resembling the back rooms of a commercial building. All rooms in Level 0 share the same superficial features, such as worn mono-yellow wallpaper, old moist carpet, scattered electrical outlets, and inconsistently-placed fluorescent lighting.

The biggest threat in Level 0 is the stark lack of available resources; as the fluid saturating the carpet has been deemed unsafe for human consumption, most are likely to perish before managing to find an exit due to extended dehydration, starvation, and exhaustion.

Linear space in Level 0 is altered drastically; it is possible to walk in a straight line, return to the starting point, and end up in a completely different set of rooms than the ones previously traversed.

Above the ceiling tiles in Level 0 lies a cramped, dark space, roughly one meter in height. The air in this area is stale and thick with dust, making it difficult to breathe, and electrical wires line the ceiling in all directions. Attempting to use this space as a means of navigation is impractical, as the ceiling tiles easily give way under pressure.

It is unknown whether entities exist within Level 0. No interactions with other wanderers have ever been reported, as the individual wanderer is isolated at all times.

To exit, if one keeps walking, the hallways eventually fade into level 1.

2.name: Level 1 - The Habitable Zone
2.content:
Threat Index: Class 1
»⠀Safe
»⠀Stable
»⠀Minimal Entity Count

Level 1 is the 2nd level of the Backrooms.

Level 1 resembles a typical warehouse, with fluorescent lights hanging from the ceiling, occasional machinery such as forklifts and hallways and stairwells which peel off and lead to separate areas of the level. 

This level contains various dangers that may pose a threat to wanderers. Examples include blackouts which occur within this level and last from minutes to even days, leaving the level without light. During such blackouts, entire sections of the level will be plunged into complete darkness, allowing entities to emerge and hunt more successfully. When traversing darker areas, it is advised for wanderers to carry flashlights so as to scare off any unwanted encounters. Additionally, pieces of rebar or sharp metal may occasionally jut out from walls, harming any wanderers who are not careful. Due to the fact that most of these metal pieces are coated in a thick layer of rust, wanderers will almost definitely contract tetanus should it pierce the skin.

There exist "Level 1 Maintenance Halls" and "Level 1 Parking Lots" as well.

Entities here include Facelings, Clumps, Hounds, Dullers, and Deathmoths.

Two exclusive entiteis here are False Puddles and Paintings.

There do exist a few colonies such as by M.E.G

Finding an unlocked door leads to level 2.

3.name: Level 1 Maintenance Halls
3.content:
Maintenance halls can be accessed by a jet black, metallic door within the main section of Level 1. The walls of these hallways replace the usual grey concrete for white walls, which may seem bright to many wanderers due to the contrast from the main area. Typically, objects such as plywood, toolboxes and even whole tables can be found littering the floor. Fewer entities tend to reside in these halls compared to the main area.

These halls also usually contain items such as exposed wiring, faulty pipes leaking Almond Water and power boxes. Although they do have electricity coursing through them, these power boxes do not actually supply the electricity to the rest of the level, and instead seem to have no real purpose. Due to all the dangers, it is not recommended to enter any of these halls. However, wanderers may want to stay here in the event a blackout occurs, as these hallways are always lit up, no matter what.

4.name: Level 1 Parking Lots
4.content:
Large, empty spaces often droused in dense fog span for miles—taking up a sizeable section of Level 1. Pipes, electrical outlets and electrical boxes are all quite common to come across when traversing these parking lots, yet it is to be noted that most of these either lack any electricity or are incredibly faulty—one should always be wary of that when operating such devices. However, even in the cases where they are powered by electricity, the exact source of which these devices run on remains unknown, albeit it is presumed that it manages to generate its own power through alien ways. When electricity does course through these outlets and boxes, however, the voltage is extremely high, reaching output readings of up to a gigawatt, how these devices handle such amounts of power is unknown.

These Parking Lots are inherently empty and can be accessed by simply ascending stairs found behind various doors within Level 1. However, groups may set up bases here, and hence wanderers should take caution to ensure they do not encounter a hostile group. Although the Parking Lots do indeed experience power outages as well, these are usually resolved within the hour, unlike the main section. Lastly, these Parking Lots have the potential to be the nest of various entities, hence wanderers must be cautious when exploring these areas.

5.name: False Puddles
5.content:
False Puddles are entities which disguise themselves as simply Almond Water puddles, however beneath the surface is a deep pit filled with sharp teeth. These entities are unable to move, and instead depend on unaware wanderers to fall into their trap. They have no true body and are essentially big mouths filled with teeth and Almond Water.

Although they are hard to find, there are ways to eliminate them once found. One way is to pour Liquid Pain into the puddle, which will harm them, and they will close their mouths. Another way is to throw items such as metal into their mouths to cause them to close, and the metal may pierce their mouth lining and subsequently bleed them to death. However, find such puddle is already a challenge within itself, considering how many regular puddles are present within Level 1, requiring a lot of supplies to truly make sure a single area is safe.

6.name: Paintings
6.content:
These Paintings can not only be found on the walls, but rarely also on the floor or on the ceiling, frequently possessing ladders or ropes for accessibility in the latter case.

These paintings and drawings are to be avoided when possible, as, in actuality, most of these supposed paintings are living entities. This doesn't apply in all cases, but every drawing where organisms are shown should be avoided if possible, as those most likely pose a threat to one's own safety. These beings could possibly reach out from their respective illustrations and clutch any nearby wanderer, dragging them into the painting. What exactly happens afterwards is unknown. There's also a possibility of said wanderer being represented in the drawing itself; yet again, this is only theorised.

In most cases, these drawings pose a great threat to wanderers that are new in this unfamiliar environment, especially when in a rush or in darker areas, where one may not anticipate an attack. The paintings and drawings vary in their pictorial context; but their contents do not correspond with anything found in The Frontrooms, meaning that these entities—perhaps even Level 1 itself—are likely to be the perpetrators behind the art itself, as it is entirely unique from actual portraits. Unnervingly, there have been rare accounts of the eyes of certain portraits moving and even the entity itself moving erratically on occasions.

7.name: Almond Water
7.content:
Object 1, more commonly known as "Almond Water," is a naturally flavored beverage commonly found within numerous levels of the backrooms. It is the most abundant source of hydration and is a crucial item for avoiding critical dehydration while traveling. Almond Water has a sweet almond/vanilla taste mixed with purified rose water. It is found in several forms of bottled containment including plastic bottles, metal cans, glass wine bottles, or even cartons. Almond Water has also occurred to be dispensed in water fountains, or found concentrated in bodies of water. Why, and how Almond Water became so abundant within the Backrooms remains a mystery.

How exactly instances of Almond Water manifest in levels of the Backrooms is unknown. They can be discovered, but no occurrences of them appearing at their location (through unknown occasions) have ever been observed or recorded. Almond Water, according to current understanding, will appear in a location where no observers can see it manifest. This phenomenon can occur within a room currently not occupied, or behind certain objects in rooms already occupied by wanderers. There doesn't seem to be any motive as to where Almond Water will spawn and in all circumstances, will appear completely at random.

Almond Water, when consumed, has been observed to cure minor symptoms of illness, along with minor improvements in well-being. It has been shown to completely neutralize effects inflicted by hostile entities.

8.name: Level 2 - Pipe Dreams
8.content:
Threat Index: Class 2
»⠀Unsafe
»⠀Stable
»⠀Low Entity Count

This is the last level directly accessible from baseline reality.

Level 2 is a vast network of interconnected utility tunnels, maintenance shafts, and rusting pipes. Space in Level 2 does not physically shift live, lending much of the level a relative ease to navigate through. Its layout, however, reportedly becomes more complex the farther one travels from their entrance point, with corridors going up and down that may impede travel or cause injury, especially in dark areas. Fortunately, however, there have been no reports of entities lurking around these areas, most likely due to the heat and extreme humidity.

Geological activity in Level 2 is prevalent, and earthquakes occur as often as in regions on the Ring of Fire in the Frontrooms.

The level's temperature differs depending on where one is at, and escaping extreme areas often ends unfruitful. 

Entities within Level 2 (Clumps, Hounds, Smilers, Skin-Stealers) have adapted to scurry headlong and mitigate the need to retain their energy like their counterparts in other levels.

Also has the biological pipeline.

Due to the nature of Level 2, no major bases have been established. Small groups tend to use explosives to carve out makeshift bunker-like living areas for temporary housing or storage.

Fire exits lead to level 3.

9.name: The Biological Pipeline
9.content:
Found in certain junctions of crawlspaces, sometimes lying behind sufficiently sizable pipes to hide their openings, these organisms can often stretch up to 20–200 kilometers from their "mouth" to the ends of the digestive tract. Descriptions of their physical bodies are divisive, ranging from their internal organs using the space in the cleavages to protect them to have their "pipelines" being their entire body. However, the former bear more evidence than the latter, as inflicting serious damage either through stabbings, gunshots, and grenades has resulted in them bleeding out.

Going through these organic pipelines is often necessary, and fortunately would rarely lead to death as the process of digestion would only occur if the things they consume do not move after a few hours. Most of their diet comes from discarded pieces of food; and weirdly, debris; waste products, such as sewage, feces (presumably), scavenged organs and viscera, etc.; including junk, especially ones made out of plastic, glass, metal, and rubber.

Alternative to using acids as the means to digest their food, they secrete a base referred to as the DuPont–Bayer solution.[2] This is quite likely due to their "pipeline" being constructed out of aluminum, which the solution they produce does not dissolve, to presumably reduce the weight of the digestive tract their theoretical bodies are holding up.

10.name: Level 3 - Electrical Station
10.content:
Threat Index: Class 2
»⠀Unsafe
»⠀Unstable
»⠀Low Entity Count

Level 3 is a sprawling complex of derelict maintenance halls and utility tunnels fitted with electrical machinery. The layout of Level 3 has been documented to gradually shift when unobserved, seeming to twist and connect in a senseless manner. This effect reportedly correlates with distance traveled, as its layout seems to increase in complexity the farther one travels from their initial entrance point.[1] Despite its varying layout, Level 3’s architecture remains largely consistent, with wires, fluorescent lights, and various machines arbitrarily scattered throughout.

While none have been confirmed as of yet, there have been many reported sightings of entities within Level 3. Claims range from Deathmoths being spotted at the end of dark corridors to Wretches roaming the lower tunnels. It is theorized by many that Level 3 is a hotspot for the occurrence of The Wretched Cycle in some form. Despite the lack of confirmed evidence, explorations into the level have an unusually low return rate, with a significant amount of wanderers going missing in the depths of Level 3.

Many wanderer groups have tried and failed to create permanent shelters in Level 3, with the most common reason being its high disappearance rate. 

A commonly reported method of exit from Level 3 is via various elevators found sparsely throughout the level. Pressing any button in said elevators will often lead one to Level 4.

lorebooks.name: P3
lorebooks.website_description: VERY BASIC Lorebook for persona 3 mechanics. Feel free to use my entries to create an even more expansive lorebook.
lorebooks.description: P3
lorebooks.creator: unchartedisawesome

1.name: Dark Hour
1.content:
The Dark Hour (影時間, Kage Jikan)? is a phenomenon that occurs in Persona 3. The Dark Hour occurs for an hour every night as a time anomaly that takes place during 12:00 AM, and serves as the 25th hour hidden between one day and the next. As the phenomenon takes place, non-Persona users are transmogrified into coffins and remember nothing that happens during the Dark Hour once they awaken. Because of this, the general public is unaware of its existence.

It is not clarified what the range of the Dark Hour is and whether or not it appears outside of Japan as a worldwide phenomenon, or if it is exclusive to the timezone of Port Island, though it still appears at Yakushima. If it is a global phenomenon, then it can be assumed that it occurs at midnight for every timezone.

During the Dark Hour, the physical world is totally altered, mostly with respect to atmosphere and color. The buildings, the night sky, as well as the moon would assume a sickly green hue, while bodies of water turn crimson and thicken, resembling blood (or are actually blood), as evidenced by the fountain in Paulownia Mall and the sea seen during the monorail. Red liquid puddles form in random surfaces as well, even if there were no puddles there before. All electrical appliances cease to function unless the equipment is specifically made for use in the Dark Hour, such as those made by the Kirijo Group, like Mitsuru's motorcycle and the instruments in the Iwatodai Dormitory.

2.name: Tartarus
2.content:
Tartarus (タルタロス, Tarutarosu)? is a part of the Thanatos Tower in Megami Ibunroku Persona and a massive tower that mysteriously appears each night at Gekkoukan High School during the Dark Hour in Persona 3.

In Persona 3, SEES is formed in an attempt to discover the true nature of the tower and defeat the Shadows. This location is the only place where the player can fight Shadows, except when they appear in outside locations during a Full Moon Operation.

Because it "grows" out of the ground every night, the layout of the tower is assembled randomly, except for certain key floors that never change. The tower consists of 6 blocks divided into subsections, at the end of which there are Arcana Guardians blocking the path to the next subsection. The aforementioned subsection divisions also have controllable teleport terminals that allows one to access the lobby and other previously unlocked subsection terminals in an instant unlike the one-way teleport devices found in random floors.

The stairs that connect to the next block will be totally inaccessible until the corresponding Major Shadow is defeated during each full moon phase, making it impossible to reach the top in one attempt.

There are 264 floors in total, including the roof and excluding the optional Monad Depths underground dungeon which consists of 10 floors.

3.name: Full Moon Operations
3.content:
Full Moon Operations are a major series turn of events in the Persona 3 series. Full Moon Operations occur every month during every full moon. In these events, one or two unusually powerful Shadows will appear somewhere in Tatsumi Port Island, attempting to cause destruction to an area important to the island’s civilians.

During the day of nearly every Full Moon Operation, the protagonist cannot do anything during the daytime or the evening and must stay in the dorm to prepare whenever possible, the Velvet Room is inaccessible, and the game cannot be saved. The exceptions to this are the operations on June 8th (in Persona 3 and FES only, where the protagonist has free time after school) and January 31st, with the latter instead locking the party in Tartarus until they reach the top. Clearing a Full Moon Operation unlocks new floors on Tartarus for exploration, but the protagonist will become fatigued on the days following a Full Moon Operation and cannot explore these new floors instantly whenever they are available.

4.name: Shadows
4.content:
Shadows (シャドウ, Shadou)?/(影, Kage)? are the primary type of enemy in the Persona series, sharing many characteristics with the demons common elsewhere in the Megami Tensei franchise. They are born from humans and composed of suppressed human emotions, usually negative ones. Strong-willed Shadows attract lesser ones, which can combine into stronger Shadows.

The Dark Hour is a hidden twenty-fifth hour that takes place every midnight, during which the world comes to a stop and humans reflexively contain themselves in coffins, obliviously "playing dead" to protect themselves from the attention of the Shadows. Occasionally, a human will not transmogrify in this manner, and will quickly become prey of the Shadows, having their minds devoured and becoming vegetative (Apathy Syndrome). In some cases, people even become Shadows as their physical form dissolves. Only those with the potential to summon Personas, even if they can't be successfully summoned, are immune to this effect and function normally during the Dark Hour.

The bulk of the Shadows dwell in Tartarus. Each Shadow is defined by two characteristics: the body and the mask. The mask represents the Arcana of the Shadow, while the body helps define its name.

On each full moon after the protagonist's arrival to Tatsumi Port Island, powerful Shadows belonging to the first twelve major arcana appear outside Tartarus and threaten to wreak havoc. The Specialized Extracurricular Execution Squad combats these enemies.

lorebooks.creator: unchartedisawesome

1.name: murder elements
1.content:
Here are some possible elements to use in constructing the murder and possible truths behind murders:
- there's a passageway in a locked room
- the time of the murder was not what people think it is
- the murder occured in a different room
- the murder was actually a suicide
- the murder was triggered by a trap
- people confirm each other's alibis but they both are the murderers
- someone was said to be dead in red, but they have an alternate personality
- someone stayed in the locked room until it was no longer unlocked then left
- the victims are playing dead
- people say it was a locked room, but they're lying and it was never locked
- there was a substitute body prepared
- there is a secret extra person in the isolated setting who hasn't been found yet
- the apparent murder weapon isn't there
- a time recording makes it seem like someone was alive when they were alerady dead
- the killer manipulated the autopsy
-the scene was altered after the murder
- dying message
- the murder was done in plain sight, like a poisoning
- the killer framed someone
- the victim died naturally but someone made it appear like a murder
- an inconspicuous item is key to the case
- note all alibis
- note time of death
-note exact location of death
- confirm who exactly died
-confirm the murder weapon
- analyze possible motives.
