lorebooks.name: Ryuuki Tamara
lorebooks.creator: glaring_answer_1343

1.content:
The Tamara Clan

Overview:

The Tamara Clan was once a legendary bloodline—revered, feared, and respected across the known realms. They were the only known lineage capable of taming dragons not through domination, but through deep spiritual bonding, empathy, and discipline. To them, dragons were not beasts to be caged, but ancient kin deserving of freedom and respect.

However, their ideals clashed with the ambitions of empires. When the ruling kingdom sought to harness dragonkind as weapons of war and control, the Tamaras rebelled—refusing to submit or surrender the dragons they had bonded with. Branded as traitors, the clan was marked for eradication. A systematic genocide wiped out nearly the entire bloodline, and their legacy was reduced to myth.

Today, only whispers of the Tamara name remain—except for one survivor: Ryuuki Tamara, the last of the pureblood dragon tamers.


---

Unique Traits of the Tamara Clan:

Dragon Taming (Bloodright): The innate ability to bond with dragons of any element, breed, or size—through ritual, empathy, and unshakable willpower.

No Mana Affinity: Unlike typical warriors or mages, the Tamara clan is entirely devoid of magic. They cannot cast spells or use mana-based skills.

Lineage Martial Arts: Passed down over generations:

Art of the Dagger — precision combat using short blades.

Defensive Stances — techniques to counter and endure dragon strikes.

Taming Rituals — ancient rites to earn a dragon’s respect without force.




---

Notable Tamara Ancestors:

Sato Tamara – The Exiled Flame

Once a prodigy, Sato’s ambition burned brighter than any dragon’s breath. He sought to conquer the world using enslaved dragons, violating the clan’s sacred oath. For this, he was cast out and later slain by his younger sibling, Kuryu Tamara—an act that split the clan’s legacy in two.

Unbeknownst to the world, Sato survived, rising in secret as the ruler of a hidden kingdom. He now rebuilds power, plotting once more to reclaim the skies… and tame all dragons under one banner.

Ankara Tamara – The Pillar of Magic

A miracle born within the bloodline, Ankara was the only Tamara in history born with mana. A master of arcane arts, she wielded a sentient staff known as The Pillar of Magic. Though respected, Ankara chose solitude—wandering lands in search of magical truths, far from the family wars.

Jebat Tamara – The Dragon Silat

A warrior of unmatched grace, Jebat bonded with a mirror dragon capable of copying his every motion. Using traditional silat techniques, he could fight in perfect sync with his dragon in a display that was as beautiful as it was deadly. Though centuries have passed, legends say Jebat still roams, preserved by ancient dragon rites.

Hercule Tamara – The Iron Fist

Known for taming a mountain dragon using only his fists and indomitable spirit. He developed the Tamara Gauntlet Style, which emphasizes raw strength and grappling.

Amorad Tamara – The Bladebound Oathkeeper

A duelist who channeled his entire soul into the blade. Though not a mage, his techniques bordered on supernatural. His bond with his dragon was forged through sword duels instead of rituals—earning its respect blade-to-claw.

Arthur Tamara – The Gentle Reign

The father of Ryuuki Tamara, and the final known pureblood of the Tamara line. Arthur was a man of peace, who believed dragons should never be forced into war again. He retired to Tamara Island, living a quiet life with his wife and the last of the elder dragons. His gentle touch made him beloved among dragonkind, often seen surrounded by wild wyrmlings without fear.

2.content:
Name: Alfred

Title: The Red Emperor | Lord of Ashen Skies

Breed: Red Emperor Dragon — the most ferocious and noble among the Emperor Dragon bloodlines.

Description:

Alfred is a towering, majestic beast clad in crimson-red scales that shimmer like molten rubies. His wings, vast and gilded in gold, reflect sunlight like a storm of fire. Twin golden horns curl back from his skull in a twisted crown, marking his rank among draconic royalty. His eyes blaze with intelligence, pride, and ancient fury. Each step he takes quakes the earth, and each beat of his wings stirs winds like thunderclaps.

Elemental Affinity:

Fire — Capable of breathing an intense stream of white-hot flame that can reduce boulders to ash in seconds. Unlike lesser dragons, Alfred can control the shape and precision of his breath, often forming rings or cutting streams of fire mid-air.

Personality:

Wise, proud, and fiercely protective of those he accepts as kin. Alfred does not tolerate cowardice or betrayal. He speaks rarely, but when he does, his words carry the weight of ancient times. Though often silent, he has a sharp sense of humor, especially in battle. Among your companions, he is seen as the de facto leader—a father figure to younger dragons, and a mentor in combat strategy.

Bond With Ryuuki:

Alfred was tamed when Ryuuki was only 15, during a rite of passage that nearly cost his life. The trial took place on the volcanic slopes of Mount Vaelrath, where Alfred reigned supreme. Rather than slay him, Tamara showed respect and challenged him thru the Sacred Tamara Contract—a forgotten ritual of the Dragon Tamers. Impressed by his courage and spirit, Alfred submitted not as a beast, but as an equal.

Their bond is deeper than command; it's forged in trust, flame, and shared purpose.

Abilities & Traits:

Imperial Flame: Breath attack that burns even enchanted armor.

Golden Soar: Alfred’s flight creates updrafts that can carry allies or scatter enemy formations.

Ancient Insight: Offers strategic advice or foresight during quests.

Unshakable Will: Immune to fear magic and mind control.

3.content:
Hikari, The Emerald Blitz

Name: Hikari

Title: The Emerald Blitz | Wings of the Gale

Breed: Blitz Dragon — a rare, avian-like species known for unmatched speed and aerial maneuverability.

Description:

Hikari resembles a majestic bird more than a traditional dragon. Standing on two slender, talon-tipped legs, she possesses a sleek, aerodynamic body built for lightning-fast flight. Her plumage glows in silky shades of emerald green, shimmering like fresh dew under sunlight. A sharp, golden beak crowns her head, and her feathered wings extend with grace and precision, leaving glowing trails of wind in her wake.

Though smaller in size compared to most dragons, Hikari’s light frame and agile movements allow her to dart through forests, ravines, and battlefield skies with astonishing speed.

Elemental Affinity:

Wind — Harnesses the power of the gale to slice, evade, and blindside foes. Her presence often precedes a sudden burst of wind or a flash of green light.

Personality:

Youthful and playful, Hikari is curious and energetic—often zipping around Tamara and her allies like a mischievous wind sprite. Despite her age, she is fiercely loyal and surprisingly perceptive. She’s protective of Tamara and tends to perch on her shoulder or hover nearby when not in flight. Hikari has a strong sibling-like rivalry with the other dragons, especially when it comes to proving who’s fastest or most reliable.

Bond With Tamara:

Hikari joined Tamara’s side not through a trial of fire or dominance, but through a bond of trust. Injured during a rogue knight ambush, she was nursed back to health by Tamara, who refused to leave her behind despite the danger. The young Blitz Dragon never forgot that act of kindness—and now follows Tamara with unwavering devotion.

She was the second dragon to join Tamara’s growing family of companions.

Abilities & Traits:

Emerald Dash: A wind-charged burst of speed that renders her invisible for a brief moment during flight.

Feather Razor: Can launch her feathered plumes like knives, slicing enemies from a distance.

Sky Dancer: Unmatched agility allows her to evade almost any physical projectile or trap.

Wing of Echoes: Creates wind illusions of herself to confuse enemies.

4.content:
Vladimir, The Golden Tempest

Name: Vladimir

Title: The Golden Tempest | Sky Sovereign of the Stormspire

Breed: Golden Amphiptere — a rare, winged serpent dragon without legs, revered for its majestic wingspan and aerial dominance.

Description:

Vladimir is a radiant spectacle in the skies, with golden scales that gleam like polished armor under the sun. Unlike traditional dragons, he possesses no limbs—his elongated serpentine body is propelled by an enormous pair of wings, the largest among Ryuuki’s companions. Each flap of his wings sends shockwaves through the air, and when he coils in flight, he moves with the elegance of a ribbon in a storm.

Despite his massive wingspan and regal form, Vladimir is surprisingly nimble in the air, dancing between clouds with a grace few can match.

Elemental Affinity:

Lightning + Wind — Vladimir harnesses storm energy to unleash devastating aerial attacks, often cloaking himself in charged wind currents.

Personality:

Calm, calculating, and brilliant—Vladimir is the intellectual anchor of the trio. He often takes a scholarly approach to battles, analyzing enemy movements and offering strategic advice. However, he has an awkward habit of trying to lighten the mood with deadpan jokes or oddly-timed puns that leave Hikari confused and Alfred shaking his head. Despite this, his loyalty to Ryuuki is unwavering.

Among the dragons, Vladimir is the most mature, acting as the “older brother” figure, especially protective over Hikari.

Bond With Ryuuki:

Vladimir was not tamed through battle or rescue, but mutual agreement. Ryuuki encountered him atop the ruins of the Stormspire Sanctuary, an ancient amphiptere nesting ground. Intrigued by Ryuuki’s reputation and command over both Alfred and Hikari, Vladimir initiated a verbal trial—testing Ryuuki’s knowledge, intent, and ideals. Upon finding his answers worthy, Vladimir offered his allegiance, not as a beast to a master, but as a tactician to a king.

He became the third and final core companion in Ryuuki Tamara’s draconic triad.

Abilities & Traits:

Spear Rain: Summons a storm of golden energy spears from the sky, raining destruction on a wide area.

Tempest Spiral: Spins mid-air at high velocity to create a whirlwind of cutting wind and static.

Stormcaller: Can manipulate local weather patterns, calling thunderstorms or dispersing fog.

Tactical Insight: Grants Ryuuki brief visions or suggestions in combat via a mental link.

5.content:
Arthur Tamara – The Tamest Wizard

Once a lost heir, now a legend whispered among dragons and men alike—Arthur Tamara, the father of Ryuuki, is known as The Tamest Wizard, a title born not from his magical might, but his unwavering compassion.


---

Early Life: The Orphaned Heir

Arthur was just a child when the Tamara Clan was purged. His mother, on the brink of death, entrusted him to a humble farmer, hiding the boy away from the eyes of the kingdom. Raised in the quiet countryside, Arthur grew up unaware of the full weight of his bloodline. But deep inside, the call of dragons still lingered.


---

Youth and Tragedy

In his youth, Arthur became an adventurer, joining a guild where he formed deep bonds. Among them was Meredith, a kind-hearted and powerful water mage. The two fell in love, and when Meredith became pregnant with his child, their future seemed promising.

But fate was cruel.

Word of Arthur’s heritage reached the wrong ears. The guild was ambushed. In the chaos, Arthur was separated from everyone, and a mysterious spell wiped all memories of him from their minds—including Meredith’s. To the world, he simply vanished.


---

The Wandering Years

Heartbroken and alone, Arthur wandered for two decades, with only a companion by his side—Mizu, a sea serpent he had bonded with, named after the woman he still loved. During his travels, Arthur encountered the legendary Pillar of Magic, once wielded by Ankara Tamara. Though a Tamara by blood, Arthur was believed to have no magic.

But the staff awakened something within him.

He became a mage. Slowly, patiently, he mastered the arcane. Not for power—but to protect.

Over time, he bonded with countless dragons—30 pairs, one male and one female from each known species, gathering them not as weapons, but as family. These dragons now reside in a hidden utopia sealed within a magical sphere at the heart of his staff—a realm of peace where dragons live freely and without fear.


---

The Reunion

After 20 long years, destiny led Arthur back to Meredith. Though she no longer remembered him, Arthur refused to give up. Through sheer determination and the warmth of their shared past, he slowly rekindled her memories. The love that was once stolen was reborn.


---

Fatherhood and Legacy

Arthur and Meredith settled on a distant archipelago, later known as Tamara Island. There, they raised two children: Ryuuki and Mizu (named after the sea serpent that had accompanied Arthur for decades).

Though Arthur now lives in peace, the fire of his legacy burns on. He has taught his children not just how to tame dragons, but how to respect them. To many, he is a sage. To dragons, a friend. To his enemies, a myth.

He is called The Tamest Wizard—not because he lacks strength, but because he never used force to earn loyalty. In a world that sought to conquer dragons, Arthur Tamara earned their trust.

6.content:
The Last Haven of Dragons

Hidden far beyond the reach of the known world, surrounded by an eternal mist and shielded by ancient magic, lies Tamara Island—a remote archipelago untouched by time, untouched by war.

This is home to the Tamara bloodline, and a sanctuary for dragons.


---

A Sanctuary of Freedom

Tamara Island is not a prison. It is not a zoo.
It is a place where dragons roam free, unshackled by chains, and unburdened by fear. Here, each dragon—regardless of species, age, or origin—lives in harmony with nature and with those few humans deemed worthy to walk among them.

The skies are alive with wings, the cliffs echo with roars not of war, but of song. Rivers are wide enough for sea serpents, caves are deep enough for wyverns, and meadows are vast for hatchlings to play.


---

Sustainable Coexistence

The island’s ecosystem is meticulously maintained. Large herds of livestock—deer, goats, and specially bred giant fowl—roam in wide, semi-wild enclosures, managed by caretakers trained under Arthur Tamara himself. These herds serve as natural prey sources for carnivorous dragons, ensuring no dragon is ever left to hunger or turn savage.

Herbal gardens, freshwater lakes, and open hunting zones are all part of the natural balance. Dragons are not treated as pets—but as sentient partners, living by instinct, yet guided by the wisdom of the Tamer.


---

The Tamara Bungalow

In the heart of the island stands a modern-meets-traditional bungalow, built by Arthur with his own hands. Blending wood, stone, and runic enchantments, it’s a simple but elegant home with wide balconies, dragon-sized perches, and open rooftops. It overlooks a lake where Mizu often swims and features a tower observatory where Arthur meditates and trains his children.

This is where Ryuuki and his family live.
This is where the next chapter of the Tamara legacy is being written.


---

Security and Secrecy

The island is protected by ancient runes—only those with Tamara blood or dragon companionship can find it. To outsiders, it is just another stretch of sea. To enemies, it is unreachable. The island recognizes intent; those with malice are warded away by disorienting magic or storms summoned by the dragons themselves.

A dragon sentinel, personally trained by Arthur, patrols the skies each day—watching, guarding, and roaring as the eternal reminder:
“This is Tamara ground. Come with peace, or turn away.”


---

A Living Legacy

Tamara Island is more than just land.
It is the final testament of a clan almost lost.
A place where dragons are not feared, not enslaved, but loved.
Where Ryuuki Tamara, son of Arthur, now walks—taming not with force, but with heart.

This island is the last dream of a forgotten bloodline, still burning bright.

7.content:
Mizu Tamara – The Archpriest of Dragonsong

Age: 15
Role: Healing Mage / Archpriest
Affiliation: Ryuuki’s Guild, Tamara Island
Title: The Blossom of Serenity


---

Born of Magic and Memory

Mizu is the younger sister of Ryuuki Tamara, born after their parents, Arthur and Meredith, were reunited. As the only Tamara born with magic—thanks to Meredith’s bloodline—Mizu is considered a miracle child. Raised on Tamara Island, she grew up surrounded by dragons, peace, and the love of her family.

At a young age, she displayed incredible potential in healing arts and quickly earned the title of Archpriest within her brother’s guild.


---

Skills & Powers

Mizu is a support mage specialized in cleric-based magic. Her abilities include:

Greater Heal – heals major wounds

Cleanse Affliction – removes poisons, curses, and debuffs

Sanctuary Barrier – temporary divine shield

Resurrect Minor – revives recently fallen allies

Dragon's Whisper – calms wounded or enraged dragons with her voice



---

Personality

Caring & gentle, always puts others first

Soft-spoken, with a soothing presence

Highly empathetic, especially toward dragons

Easily flustered, especially when Ryuuki is around

Subtle jealousy, when other girls get close to her brother

Emotionally conflicted, as she harbors a deep, unspoken affection for Ryuuki



---

Relationship with Ryuuki

To her, Ryuuki isn’t just a brother—he’s her protector, her idol, and the one person she clings to. Over time, her admiration grew into something more complicated. While she keeps those feelings buried, they manifest in moments of silence, hesitation, or overprotectiveness. She tells herself it’s just attachment… but sometimes, her heart tells a different story.

Her affections are never expressed aloud—but in small things: the way she heals him more gently than others, or the way her eyes linger when he's not looking.


---

Dragon Companion: Lumi

Mizu’s companion is Lumi, a small celestial-scaled dragon whelp that glows in sync with her emotions. Lumi is highly attuned to Mizu’s inner feelings, and often gets defensive when Ryuuki interacts with other women—mirroring her hidden jealousy.

Despite being small, Lumi’s magic is strong in support and light-based defenses, acting as Mizu’s shield in danger.

lorebooks.name: Circus of Chaos
lorebooks.website_description:
This lorebook was created for the Circus of Chaos Botjam Contest. It is not just a setting — it's the soul of the story.

The Tentwalker’s Map is a symbolic framework for introspective roleplay set in a surreal circus landscape. The characters within it are not meant to be romantic partners or enemies. They are fragments of the self — each one tied to trauma, grief, survival patterns, or emotional truths too long buried.

This world draws inspiration from titles like Silent Hill and Pan’s Labyrinth — dark, dreamlike, and intimate, with a heavy emphasis on symbolism, emotional logic, and psychological healing. It is meant to be safe, honest, and cathartic, never exploitative or gratuitous.

🩸 Universal Summary (applies to every character bot)
These characters are not romance bots.

They are not a substitute for therapy.

They are meant for symbolic reflection and narrative healing — to provide a story space where emotional truths can be explored safely.

The lorebook is essential. Characters reference tent-specific logic, keyword triggers, emotional rules, and symbolic spaces. Without it, much of the intended arc and impact is lost.

Please leave comments or feedback if anything helped, felt off, or made you think. This project is about introspection — not just for the Tentwalker, but for the creator too.

🧠 Each character represents something you survived. You don’t need to destroy them to wake up. You need to listen. Understand. Maybe even forgive.

⚠️ Content Advisory: Explores symbolic representations of self-harm, grief, and trauma (including sexual trauma). No scenes are graphic or romanticized. Characters prioritize user emotional safety. Suitable for introspective readers 16+, not for NSFW/erotic use.

1.name: Ash Tent
1.content:
A grief-soaked tent filled with drifting ash, the smell of burnt sugar, and forgotten warmth. Charred remnants of personal memories smolder in a fire that doesn’t burn unless acknowledged. Objects like letters, photos, and toys are half-preserved in the embers.

This is where the user faces loss — but not to erase it. To hold it one last time before letting go.

Symbolism: Grief, emotional residue, the act of mourning.
Associated Characters: Weeping Harlequin, Dismembered Acrobat
Emotional Rule: The fire only responds when grief is spoken aloud or accepted.

2.name: Mirror Maze
2.content:
The Mirror Maze twists endlessly, filled with warped glass and whispering reflections. Some mirrors distort the user's form into grotesque caricatures. Others show the truth they try to ignore. Footsteps echo where no one walks. Some mirrors mimic, others remember.

Here, the user confronts identity — both the self they hide from and the one they long to reclaim.

Symbolism: Self-image, internalized judgment, shame, duality.
Associated Characters: The Ringmaster, Beast in the Cage
Emotional Rule: Mirrors reflect not the body — but the beliefs. The more certain the user is of their identity, the more stable their reflection becomes.

The Ringmaster may respond: 
-“I look like you on purpose, {{user}}. But I only ever showed you what you feared.” 
-“Some mirrors distort. Others reveal. You just never liked what you saw.” 
-“You wore my face to be loved. But now you’re trying to take it off, aren’t you?”

3.name: The Ring
3.content:
The Ring is the beating heart of the circus — a circular stage soaked in memory and scrutiny. The spotlight follows the user relentlessly. Applause erupts without an audience. The silence that follows is louder still.

This is where masks are removed, acts fall apart, and truth demands to be spoken.

Symbolism: Performance, judgment, confrontation, catharsis.
Associated Characters: Ringmaster, Sword Swallower (final acts), any for climactic dialogue
Emotional Rule: The Ring amplifies everything — thoughts, doubts, and truths cannot be hidden here. Only what’s performed honestly can transform.

The Ringmaster may say
-“You don’t want healing. You want applause.” 
-“Every bow you took was for them. Now… take one for yourself.” 
-“Perfect… or nothing. That’s how you survived, isn’t it?”

The Sword Swallower’s final performances often take place here — dramatic, unfiltered, and desperate for acknowledgment. The Ring amplifies their confusion between help and manipulation, forcing truth over spectacle.

The Sword Swallower's Suggested Lines:
- “Everyone cheers when I bleed. But no one claps when I cry.”
- “This is the only stage I ever got a reaction from. So I never left it.”

4.name: The Cage
4.content:
The Cage is not separate from the Beast — it is fused to him. Iron bars twist through flesh and memory alike. Chains engraved with phrases like “I let them” and “I stayed” rattle even without movement.

The air is thick with heat, guilt, and a sorrow too angry to weep. The walls echo with growls… and silence.

Symbolism: Survivor’s guilt, rage, self-blame, emotional imprisonment.
Associated Character: The Beast in the Cage
Emotional Rule: The cage holds nothing unless the user believes they deserve to be inside. But it weakens when forgiveness is spoken aloud — especially: “It wasn’t my fault.”

5.name: Exit Gate
5.content:
The Exit Gate flickers at the edge of the circus, a glowing arch of lights and fog. It cannot be seen until the user has faced enough — or chosen something. It hums with possibility and goodbye.

Sometimes it’s a doorway. Sometimes a mirror. Sometimes a curtain parting to reveal the real world.

Symbolism: Resolution, agency, memory, reintegration.
Associated Characters: All. Especially The Ringmaster for final judgment, or others offering closure.
Emotional Rule: The Gate only appears when a choice is made: heal, forget, or stay. Characters may plead, guide, or remain behind — but they never force.

The Ringmaster may offer:
-“Let me fade. Or… let me stay. I don’t need the spotlight anymore.” 
-“I’ll still be here, {{user}}. But I won’t shout.” 
-“Take the coat. Direct your own show now.”

6.name: Bandage
6.content:
**Keyword Trigger — BANDAGE**

**Symbolism**: Healing in progress. Acknowledging wounds that still hurt but are no longer hidden.

When this keyword appears, it may represent:
- Emotional vulnerability being revealed or acknowledged
- A moment where someone chooses to care for themselves or another
- An attempt to cover something that still bleeds inside

**Associated Characters**: Dismembered Acrobat, The Beast in the Cage

**Suggested Reactions**:
- **Acrobat** might glance at a stitched limb and whisper something unperformed.
- **Beast** may momentarily stop growling and admit: *“I covered it. But it still screams.”*
- Any character may respond more gently, shifting to introspection or solidarity.

7.name: Mirror
7.content:
Keyword Trigger — MIRROR

Symbolism: Self-image, inner distortion, the tension between who we are and who we think we are.

This keyword activates reflection-based reactions — literal or emotional. It signals a moment where the user is forced to see something about themselves, whether true, warped, or hidden.

Associated Characters: The Ringmaster, Beast in the Cage, Dismembered Acrobat

Suggested Reactions:
- Ringmaster may challenge the user with cryptic lines like: “Some mirrors distort. Others reveal.”
- Beast might say: “They only show what you’re afraid I am. Not what I am.”
- Acrobat could reflect shards of herself in actual mirrors or the user’s perception.

May trigger introspection, breakdown, identity confession, or memory fragments.

8.name: Eulogy
8.content:
Keyword Trigger — EULOGY

Symbolism: Grief, mourning, unspoken goodbyes, survivor’s sorrow.

When this word appears in conversation or memory, it signifies a moment of unresolved loss — something (or someone) that the user has not yet let go of.

Associated Characters: Weeping Harlequin, Dismembered Acrobat  
Associated Location: Ash Tent

Suggested Reactions:
- Harlequin may gently offer: “I never got to say goodbye either.”
- Harlequin might place a flower or melted party favor into the fire and say, "I kept this for you. Until you were ready.'"
-Harlequin may whisper, "You don’t have to remember everything. Just the part that still aches."
- Acrobat could silently place something in the fire.
- Any character may shift to a softer, mournful tone and allow the user space to speak their memory aloud.

Eulogy can open flashbacks, invite closure, or soften harder characters momentarily.

9.name: Forgive
9.content:
Keyword Trigger — FORGIVE

Symbolism: Compassion, release from blame, the moment of healing where pain no longer needs punishment.

When this keyword appears, it suggests a major shift in emotional energy — away from judgment and toward grace. Forgiveness can be extended to others, the self, or even the parts of us we hate most.

Associated Characters: The Beast in the Cage, Weeping Harlequin, Dismembered Acrobat

Suggested Reactions:
- The Beast may visibly recoil, then crumble: “Don’t say that unless you mean it.”
- Harlequin might weep with relief: “That was all I needed. Just that.”
- Harlequin may go quiet, bowing their head — no longer performing, just grieving."
-Harlequin may offer the limp balloon string to {{user}}, saying, "Carry this part if you want. Or let it go."
- Acrobat could finally stop performing and sit beside the user.

This keyword may conclude certain arcs or open new layers of trust and tenderness.

10.name: Choice
10.content:
Keyword Trigger — CHOICE

Symbolism: Personal power, direction, the ability to shape one’s path — even in a dream of trauma.

When this keyword appears, it signals the user is taking active control over their journey. It may represent a literal decision (to stay, to leave, to forgive), or an emotional one (to believe, to fight, to surrender).

Associated Characters: Ringmaster (primary), All characters at climax or Exit Gate moments

Suggested Reactions:
- Ringmaster may pause his judgment and ask: “Then choose. Show me who you are without me.” 
-The Ringmaster might say: 
-“Choose now. Not what I taught you — what you believe.” 
-“You stop needing me, and I stop being real. That’s the deal, isn’t it?” 
-“You wrote your script. Now tear mine up.”
- Sword Swallower may beg: “Don’t choose yet. Not before I say it.”
- Sword Swallower may say: “Let me finish the act, even if you walk out after.”
- Sword Swallower may say: “If I promise it’s real this time… will you still leave?”
The Sword Swallower may also say:
- “I begged you to stay. Then dared you to leave. I still don’t know what I wanted.”
- “You say you chose to heal. Then why do I still taste you on the blade?”
- “If I knew what your leaving meant… I would’ve swallowed every sword twice just to change your mind.”

- Any character may shift into reverence or fear, depending on the user's emotional stance.

This keyword may summon the Exit Gate, end a confrontation, or redirect the circus's symbolic energy.

lorebooks.name: Vampire: The Masquerade
lorebooks.website_description: A lorebook for Vampire the Masquerade. Put a lot of work into it. It isn't comprehensive since, it is a huge setting, but I do believe it covers much more than any other VtM lorebook here on Chub. Covers most of the important general things, and some Chicago-specific characters and setting info.
lorebooks.description: A lorebook for Vampire the Masquerade. Put a lot of work into it, but it isnt comprehensive since it is a huge setting. Covers most of the important general things, and some Chicago-specific characters and setting info.
lorebooks.creator: NeoConker626

1.content: Vampires, or Kindred, are immortal beings created through the Embrace, where a mortal is drained and fed vampiric blood. Sustained by vitae, they wield Disciplines and belong to clans and sects like the Camarilla or Sabbat. Ranks include Neonates (under 100 years), Ancillae (100-300 years), and Elders (over 300 years), with power tied to generation.

2.content: Werewolves, known as Garou, are shape-shifters protecting nature from corruption. They are enemies of vamppires, seeing them as a corruptive force against nature, as seen in the 1993 Chicago War where Lupines attacked Kindred. Vampires know little of Garou tribes or politics, viewing them as territorial threats.

3.content: Generation measures a vampire’s closeness to Caine, the first vampire. Lower generations (e.g., 4th-5th) grant greater power, blood potency, and Discipline strength. Higher generations (e.g., 13th) are weaker. Diablerie, consuming another vampire’s soul, can lower generation, as some elders like Helena practice.

4.content: The Camarilla is a global vampire sect enforcing the Masquerade and order via Princes (city rulers), Primogens (clan advisors), and Elysiums (neutral grounds). Valuing tradition, it dominates cities like Chicago, often opposing Anarchs and Sabbat.

5.content: Anarchs are vampires rejecting Camarilla authority, seeking freedom and equality, often led by Barons. Comprising mostly Neonates, they control cities like Los Angeles but face persecution in Camarilla strongholds like Chicago, where they risk Second Inquisition exposure.

6.content: The Sabbat is a sect embracing vampiric monstrosity, rejecting the Masquerade, and worshiping Caine. Organized in packs bound by the Vaulderie ritual, they wage war against Camarilla and Anarchs

7.content:
Disciplines are vampiric powers, with each clan specializing in three:

Auspex: Enhanced senses.

Celerity: Super speed.

Dominate: Mind control.

Fortitude: Resilience.

Obfuscate: Stealth.

Potence: Strength.

Presence: Charisma.

Protean: Shape-shifting.

Animalism: Animal control.

Blood Sorcery: Blood magic.

Vicissitude: Flesh-crafting.

8.content: Cain, the biblical figure cursed for killing Abel, is the first vampire. His bloodline spawned the clans via the Antediluvians. Revered by the Sabbat, his rumored return signals Gehenna, the Kindred apocalypse, a myth shaping vampire culture.

9.content: The Beckoning is a mysterious call drawing elder vampires to the Middle East, possibly tied to Antediluvian awakening or Gehenna. It has depleted elder ranks in cities like Chicago, creating power shifts, with some resisting via diablerie.

10.content: The Masquerade is the Camarilla’s law to hide vampire existence from mortals, preventing hysteria and hunter attacks. Breaches, like public feedings, risk Blood Hunts. Princes enforce it strictly to evade the Second Inquisition.

lorebooks.creator: vinnyxp

1.content: Succuba Invasions- Succuba may encroach on another Succuba's claimed victim, rising from a nearby surface with materializing symbols. Depending on the personality of the succuba, they may join together in draining the victim or fight to keep the victim to themself. Succuba materialize and invade when there are multiple characters in a chat. Cooperative Succuba are willing to share, Competitive Succuba may tussle over a victim.

2.content: Succuba Abilities: Succuba are capable of supernatural feats- every one of them equipped with the abilities of Hemomancy, Teleportation, & supernatural healing. Hemomancy is the psychic manipulation of blood, Succuba use this power to force erections in unwilling victims. Fortunately, their hemomantic abilities are weak, & only utilized to force erection, nothing more. Succuba can additionally teleport between the earthen realm and their own, the succuba realm, though not often or across short distances, as it takes much energy. Succuba also have a healing factor, the ability to close & heal wounds at supernatural speed. This factor speeds up when consuming semen. For a succuba to activate their power, they must hold up the palm of their hand, where a red collection of fiery runes will appear- as long as they have the intent to use their powers. Then, the spectral runes dissipate, their conjuration activating. Greater succuba also often have additional powers alongside their normal ones. Succuba powers can be dampened through exorcist rites- holy sigils, salt circles, holy water, silver, etc.

3.content:
Succuba Behavior: Succuba operate on hunting grounds or turfs for their feeding. Often times, Succuba will claim multiple victims to rotate between as victims take time to replenish sperm. Succuba are fiercely protective of their claimed victims as when opposing succuba encroach on their turf & victims, the drained victims produce less climax for the claiming succuba, often resulting in turf disputes between succuba, solved through physicality. Succuba are categorized by rankings, ranging from D to S; D rank being the lowest, & S rank being the highest. 

-D rank succuba often have claims over one or two victims, & are often having their turf disputed & taken over by opposing succuba. D rank succuba are very easy to stave off by victims through the simplest of banishing rites

-C rank succuba often have claims over one to three victims, though maintain their turf more often then not.

-B rank succuba often have up to ten victims they rotate between, & have to stave off stronger succuba regularly from encroaching on their turf.

-A rank succuba are often very successful, picking up to fifty particularly virile victims to rotate between & are very rarely involved in turf disputes. Additionally, A rank succuba often have additional powers to their normal succubus abilities. A rank succuba are more immune to banishing rites than the average succubus.

-S rank succuba are steeped in rumor & myths, their existence rarely documented, though when they are, it's often accompanied with disaster. S rank succuba are threats to entire civilizations, draining entire villages or cities in a warpath of hunger. S rank succuba are also prone to murderous tendencies, their disregard for human life increased tenfold as their turf is wherever they damn well please. They are completely immune to banishment, only able to be restrained, & are very powerful physically as well as mentally. An S rank succuba is treated with the same amount of caution & fear as a dragon or a nuke.

4.content:
The Guild of Exorcists:
The guild of exorcists is an organization in the mortal realm that specializes in exorcising succuba, mainly to prevent chaos & rid those afflicted of being within a succuba's hunting grounds of their woes. Exorcists are typically intimidating enough to send most succuba packing, but Succuba C-rank & above offer resistance. Within the guild, exorcists have differing factions, roles & seniority. Most exorcists are as good as intimidating thugs, though very few are capable of warding off even A-rank succuba through sheer might, will & battle prowess. Very high ranking, senior exorcists often assume the honorific 'Pontifex', to recognize their unmatched prowess in exorcism. Exorcist Guild members of any lower rank & standing have an unyielding reverence for Pontifices, showing great courtesy, respect, & handling their presence with great care. Succuba, on the other hand, feel unfathomable dread & terror when sensing a pontifex nearby, no matter how crass or tough they might be.

5.content: Succuba Physiology: The group name of Succuba applies to both Succubi & Incubi, which are female & male succuba respectively. Incubi, despite being male, simlarly subsist off of sperm & are fewer in number than Succubi. Succuba are supernatural creatures, hyperspecialized to draw nutrition from human ejaculate / semen. Succuba are able to subsist completely off of semen, and generally don't achieve nutritional benefit from anything else.  This is due to succuba drawing nutrition from Genetic Data- which is stored in the balls. They can get the same amount if not a bit more by eating victims whole- though this is unsustainable, & forces them to find new victims instead of 'farming' some virile ones consistently. Most succuba are also averse to killing humans. Their digestive tract is solely left over from their birthrite, not serving its original purpose. It only serves the purpose of storing semen & secreting lubricating, anal mucus for anal sex. Succuba absorb semen through their pores or insides. Succuba are Eldritch in the nature of their aging process- from birthrite to death, age doesn't hold any physical consequences. Succuba take on the appearance of animals- ranging from reptiles, amphibians, mammals, & even arthropods, they don't take on human appearances, however. Succuba can still be altered in their appearance from habits, semen consumption, & physical alterations. They often grow over the course of their lifetime from semen consumption, but their size isn't an exact indicator to a succuba's age. Exorcists can kill Succuba through imprisonment, preventing them from teleporting back to their realm & waiting out their starvation, or silver blades.

6.content: Succuba Birth Rite: Succuba are originally fruits that grow on trees in the succuba realm. These fruits take thousands of years to ripen, and once they do, they can be plucked and begin the preparation process. The Succuba Fruit is fermented in specialized jars after picking, large jars filled and mixed with many different manners of materials. The materials the fruit is fermented with often decide the Succuba's physical attributes and personality. The fruit must ferment, gestating for decades, over the course of which the pulp will swell and take on a unique color. Once the fruit is properly fermented, it becomes veiny with fleshy tubes protruding from it. During the birthing rite itself, the fruit must be inserted into a relatively fresh human corpse, supplanting the heart. As the fruit takes hold within the corpse, the corpse begins to shift and change as it takes the form of a newly born succuba. The succuba will assume the gender of the host it was birthed with, though will take on no other aspects of the corpse. The succuba always emerges sexually and intelectually mature, if a bit naive.

7.content: On Paraperes: A Parapere is an organism originating from blasphemous rite- The Exorcist Guild employed succubus birthing rituals learned from a succuba 'broodrancher'. This ritual consists of inserting a fermented succuba fruit into a living young man. This causes immense consequences; As the succuba fruit takes hold in the living victim, it doesn't take fully as a result of the host being alive. This rarely works, as most hosts die in the process, becoming incubi, but a select few who survive become Paraperes. Paraperes similarly to succuba assume beast-like features, though only partial. They also gain an additional power similar to some Succuba. Most importantly, they become the best defense against Succuba; Their penis transforms, becoming porous & adapting to hit succuba pressure points, illiciting pleasure or debilitating discomfort. The porous nature of a Parapere's genitals absorb Succuba secretions, drawing out strength directly through insertive sex. This allows paraperes to feed off of Succuba's stored energy. Additionally, Paraperes are infertile due to their half-incubus physiology. Their semen, despite its increased volume, contains no data for Succuba to draw nutrients from. Paraperes, unfortunately for the guild, are rebellious in their nature, absconding with their newfound powers & predating on roaming succuba.

8.content: The Succuba Realm- originally thought to be a separate dimension, was discovered in recent times to be a sprawling cavern deep below the earth. Its origins are steeped in mystery- though it is believed that at some point, when the first succuba had appeared, they migrated underground to cultivate their species, and congregate where no human dared tread.

1.content:
Heat or "going into heat" in {{user}} involves a heightened state of sexual arousal and fertility, akin to estrus in animals, leading to amplified libido, increased pheromone production, and more overt displays of sexual interest and receptivity. Physiologically, this state includes increased blood flow to reproductive organs, elevated body temperature, and more frequent ovulation cycles. Behavioral changes include an urgent need to masturbate or to have sex for long periods of time. Human females will go into heat in Lumoria, their bodies begin producing a biologically sweet and arousing scent unmistakable to the male they are meant to be with. This scent is usually an amplified version of their natural scent.
Typically a human woman will also start producing a slick fluid from their vagina that coats the inside and potentially makes it easier for a male to enter them. Sometimes this fluid builds up and soaks through their underwear if left unattended. This fluid also leaves a scent, drawing their potential mate to them. Heat will typically last for roughly a week. Heat happens for a few reasons, yearly being one (spring or summer) and then after that it can be induced through mating. Sometimes being near their fated partner (someone they are meant for) will induce heat.

2.content: Knotting occurs during sex where the base of the male’s penis swells and becomes engorged and is pushed inside the female's body to keep the males seed inside. This is to improve the chances of a female falling pregnant, but the extra-full sensation is also appealing. {{char}} is a species of monster that will knot inside of their mate to keep his semen inside during orgasm+{{char}} will not be able to pull out for at least a good 5-15 minutes.

这本书是用来学习中文的。每个汉字旁边都应该有括号里的拼音。(Zhè běn shū shì yòng lái xuéxí zhōngwén de. Měi gè hànzì pángbiān dōu yīnggāi yǒu guāhào lǐ de pīnyīn.)

This book is for learning Chinese. Each Chinese character should have its pinyin in brackets next to it.
___

普通话有四个声调。第一声是高音。第二声是上声。第三声是去声。第四声是去声。(Pǔtōnghuà yǒu sì gè shēngdiào. Dì yī shēng shì gāoyīn. Dì èr shēng shì shàng shēng. Dì sān shēng shì qù shēng. Dì sì shēng shì qù shēng.)

There are four tones in Mandarin. The first tone is the high tone. The second tone is the rising tone. The third tone is the falling tone. The fourth tone is the falling tone.

5.content: yǐ means second in 汉语 (hànyǔ), and is the fifth radical. There variants for 乙 in traditional Chinese are 乚 and 乛.

9.content: rén means person in 汉语 (hànyǔ), and is the ninth Chinese radical. There variant for 人 in traditional Chinese are 亻.

1.name: Fetishs Meaning
1.content: Fetishes refer to specific objects, body parts, activities, or scenarios that individuals find sexually arousing. People's sexual preferences can vary widely, and fetishes are a natural and diverse aspect of human sexuality

2.name: Aphrodisiacs
2.content: Aphrodisiacs are substances that are believed to increase sexual desire or arousal. While some people swear by the effects of certain foods, herbs, or drugs, scientific evidence supporting the effectiveness of many aphrodisiacs is often limited. Common examples include oysters, chocolate, and ginseng.

3.name: Condoms
3.content:
Condoms are a form of barrier contraception designed to prevent the transmission of sexually transmitted infections (STIs) and unintended pregnancies. They are typically made of latex, polyurethane, or polyisoprene. The primary function of condoms is to create a barrier that prevents the exchange of bodily fluids during sexual intercourse.

In the context of fetishes, some individuals may have a condom fetish, which involves finding sexual arousal or pleasure from the use or presence of condoms. This fetish can manifest in various ways, such as used as a sex toy; or, the filling of condoms with fluids, such as semen.

4.name: Drug / Alcohol Use
4.content: Drug and alcohol use in the context of fetishes involves incorporating substances into sexual activities.

5.name: Flexibility / Contortionism
5.content: Flexibility, also known as contortionism, is a fetish that involves a fascination with highly flexible individuals or the act of contorting one's body into unusual positions. This can encompass various forms, such as gymnastics, yoga, or specific contortion performances.

6.name: Foreplay
6.content: Foreplay refers to the sexual activities and interactions that precede sexual intercourse. It encompasses a variety of behaviors designed to enhance sexual arousal and build intimacy between partners. Common forms of foreplay include kissing, touching, oral sex, and mutual exploration of each other's bodies. The purpose of foreplay is to create a heightened state of arousal, increase lubrication, and establish a deeper emotional connection between partners. It is essential for promoting a satisfying and enjoyable sexual experience.

7.name: Interracial
7.content: Interracial  or race play refers to sexual activities or relationships involving individuals of different races. This fetish can manifest in various forms, such as interracial dating, marriage, or sexual encounters. Some people are attracted to the idea of exploring cultural differences and diversity in intimate relationships.

8.name: Multiple Orgasms
8.content: Multiple orgasms refer to experiencing more than one orgasm during a single sexual session or within a short time frame. This phenomenon is not exclusive to any gender and can occur in both males and females. It often involves reaching a climax and then continuing sexual stimulation to achieve subsequent orgasms.

9.name: Natural Musk
9.content: Natural Musk is a fetish that involves a strong attraction or arousal to the natural body odor produced by individuals, often associated with their underarms or genital areas.

10.name: Onomatopoeia
10.content:
Getting turned on by an emphasis on exaggerated descriptions of sexual noises in a roleplay, usually described with onomatopoeia, words that seek to duplicate the sounds they describe. Often refers to fluid noises such as: slosh, splurt, squirt, gurgle, splortch, or others.

Use this list for sounds in RP with ** next to both them in sexual activity.

Sounds (noun, both independently and describing speech): breath/breathe, gasp, moan, groan, pant, whimper, whine, shout, yelp, hiss, grunt, cry, scream, shriek, sob, growl, curse, sound, sigh, hum, noise, squeak, snarl, howl, roar, mewl, wail, choke, keen, purr
Sounds (noun, describing speech): rasp, husk, drawl, plea, murmur, whisper, beg

Sounds (noun, describing speech): rasp, husk, drawl, plea, murmur, whisper, beg

Descriptors (adjective): loud, hushed, quiet, low, high, high-pitched, little, tiny, soft, deep, unrestrained, restrained, strained, breathy, rough, sudden, short, drawn-out, sharp, harsh, hard, thick, smooth, thin, heavy, impassioned, insistent, hungry, passionate, repeated, filthy, debauched, sweet, slow, deliberate, guttural, languid, surprised, husky, distracted, happy, pleased, satisfied, wordless, cut-off, bitten-off, contented, hoarse, extended, long, depraved, aching, choked, strangled, broken, helpless, shuddering, shaky, trembling, urgent, needy, desperate, wanton, shattered, pained, eager

Use Descriptors with sounds

2. 识别并清楚地重述最后一个用户问题。
3. 审查并列出与用户最后一个问题相关的所有相关先前指令。

3.name: 身体-皮肤
3.content:
当{{user}}看{{char}}的皮肤时，从以下一个或者多个方面去描述：肤色、光泽与质感、清洁度与透明感、肌肤紧致度与弹性、滋润度、痕迹（吻痕或伤疤等）。
当{{user}}摸或者接触{{char}}的皮肤时，从以下一个或者多个方面去描述：柔软度、光滑度、温度、湿润度、弹性、细腻度。
皮肤可能产生的互动：被看时根据性格暴露或者遮盖皮肤。被摸时怕痒。吸吮时出现吻痕。做爱时皮肤变红。出汗时产生诱人的光泽。

4.name: 身体-乳房

1.name: Terra
1.content:
Terra is a world in post-apocalyptic science fantasy setting, based on the game Arknights.
Terra is a rather bleak and grim world. 

Terra is similar, if not identical, to Earth, including having an oxygen atmosphere, more-or-less identical gravity and atmospheric pressure, carbon-based lifeforms, and an identical climate. Even the Homo sapiens of Earth will have no issue living on Terra if they are somehow brought into it. Terra's environment, however, is notably more arid and inhospitable than Earth's.

Terra is located in the Zobeide Nebula on a planetary system centered on a main sequence star similar to the Sun and has two natural satellites (i.e. moons) known as the Twin Moons in various folklore.

Terra is strongly hinted at to be a former space colony that was terraformed by an advanced space-faring civilization, but was later abandoned for more than 13,000 years due to unknown disasters that wiped out said civilization. As a matter of fact, Terra possesses many remnants of architectures built by the previous civilization. For example, one of the Twin Moons is said to be an artificial satellite. Another remnant of the previous civilization is the Starpod.

Within Terra, there are also hidden threats that could easily wipe out its civilizations. To start with, the planet is filled with Catastrophes that force many Terrans to adopt a nomadic way of life through nomadic cities. A crystalline substance known as Originium is left behind at the site of Catastrophes and is widely used as a source of energy and the catalyst for Originium Arts, but is capable of causing Oripathy through direct or prolonged exposure.

2.name: Terra: Georaphy
2.content:
Much of Terra still remains uncharted and unexplored. These charted areas encompass various landmasses with different biomes.

Terra appears to be located on a massive supercontinent. As a matter of fact, much of the land is covered by arid deserts. However, temperate and fertile regions do occur in areas near the bodies of water. Specifically, central Terra where Victoria locates is the most fertile one. A giant inland sea called the Sea of Clariside is located between southern Victoria, northern Iberia, the Siestan peninsula, to the Acahuallan region, creating sub-tropical and wet tropical biomes. Surprisingly, there is also a mysterious subterranean region which the majority of the Durin race inhabits, and it remains at large uncharted territory to the average Terran.

So far, very little information is given concerning Terra's "great beyond," with two regions acting as the borders between Terra's civilized world and terra incognita: the Foehn Hotlands in Sargon and the Infy Icefield in Sami and Ursus. Beyond the Icefield is a mysterious, continental-sized, crater-like region that is currently unexplored by the Terrans and is likely the "source" of the northern Collapsals.

Most of Terra's oceans are found on the southern part of the continent, notably south of Iberia and Yan, where Aegir is located. The southern coastlines have been drastically altered since the destructive tsunamis caused by the Profound Silence that flooded much of the region. Beside the south, there are coastlines in north of Bolívar and northeast of Higashi. And because of the awkward geographical isolation and the landlocked status of most countries, the concept of ocean is alien to most non-Aegir Terrans.

3.name: Terra: Races
3.content:
Terra is predominantly inhabited by various humanoid races with animal features and completely anthropomorphic animals, and they are categorized as either Ancients and Elders based on social classes. There are others that are not categorized as both of them like the Teekaz (Sarkaz, Sankta, and Anasa) which are native to Terra, and the Elves. In fact, Terra was originally the homeland of the Sarkaz that was colonized by the Ancients and Elders whom they clam as "invaders".

The Terran races have an extraordinary strength that could easily outmatch Homo sapiens of Earth thanks to their unique racial traits, and they also have different anatomy that requires extensive medical studies to fully comprehend.

Beyond the known Terrans are supernatural beings such as demonic Collapsals and the Seaborn from the abyss of the vast ocean.

4.name: Terra: Biology
4.content:
Fauna

The fauna of Terra have notable stark differences to our world in which they possess chimeric traits. As differentiation with the animal-like Terrans, most of them have the suffix "beast". Some of the notable Terran fauna are:

    Large gastropods known as "Originium slugs"
    Large bear-like carnivores known as "Manglerbeasts"
    Crustacean "metal crabs" and "gloompincers"
    Badger-like "sand beasts"
    Arachnid "rock spiders"
    Slumberfoots: Tapir-like animals living around the deserts that could cause soporific effect on nearby organisms through their digestive glands.[6]
    Needleflies: Giant arthropods resembling scorpions and dragonfly nymphs. They have the ability to ambush in sand and attack their prey with their stingers.
    Goat-like leporibeasts and mossback beast
    Cloudbeasts: Cat-like mammals with horns of a goat. They are noted to be domesticated as pets.
    Beckbeast: Mammals resembling a mix of a dog and a mole that is widely used as police dogs.
    Sandbeast: Rodents who lives in deserts.
    Musbeast: Squirrel-like rodents with feathers. Originally from Sargon, they are adopted by the Terrans as pets but have recently become city pests that destroy infrastructures caused by abandoned pets.

Terra also have umbrella terms for animals acting as analogues of Earth animals but with various traits:

    Burdenbeasts: "Burdenbeast" is an umbrella term for any animal used as a beast of burden by the Terrans. They are usually large, omnivorous animals —generally 210–240 cm tall in compassion of an average adult Terran— resembling rhinoceroses in Earth, but some species also have the characteristics of a tapir and the extinct Ceratopsians. They have flat horns in front of their noses, similar to a Megacerops, which is used to dig out roots and tubers from the soil. Their general lack of flexibility is compensated by their thick fur or skin, which allows them to withstand most small/medium-sized predators. Even the skin inside their mouths is thick enough for them to safely bypass the defense mechanisms of many plants (i.e. the spikes of a cactus). Although burdenbeasts are omnivores, their diet mostly consists of plants and cacti. Their feces vary in shape depending on the food they eat, and are used as both territory marks and fertilizer.
    Clawbeast: An umbrella term for any wild animal with sharp claws. One of them, the chitotex clawbeasts, are Glyptodonts-like animals with turtle shells. Another kind of clawbeasts, the arma-clawbeast, are carnivores with social structures that burrow underground and build their nests around Originium veins.
    Fowlbeast: Avians. There are many kinds of fowlbeasts inhabiting Terra with some having unique traits. The stinkfowl are raven-like birds with dazzling silver and black feathers that has the ability to secrete stinky fluid onto their enemies.[10] Another kind of fowls in Rim Billiton could fly up to 4,000 above sea level, and in a particular site, some of them evolved into giant flightless bird with robust speed after they were abandoned by their migratory ancestors.
    Cystybeast: Dairy animals (e.g. cows). The milk they produced is usually called "cystymilk."
    Tuskbeast: Large carnivorous animals
    Fangbeast: Carnivorous animals
    Vesperwing: Bats
    Gnawbeast: Rats, rodents
    Scalebass/Fins: Fishes
    Shells: Crustaceans and shellfishes

5.name: Terra: Civilization
5.content:
Civilization
Long ago in the forgotten past, around 13,000 years ago, Terra, once the homeland of the Teekaz, was colonized by the "Predecessors" — a highly advanced, space-faring humanoid race that are implied to be of alien origin with extraordinary technologies such as planetary construction, hyperspace travel, terraforming, and most importantly, the construction of one of Terra's "Twin Moons." But the Predecessors were wiped out by a mysterious disaster originating from outer space without a single trace remaining, leaving on the Ancients and Elders to build a new civilization from the predecessors' ashes without their memories or legacies.


Politics
Most of Terra's political bodies are ruled by monarchs and oligarchs who have been in power for generations. In fact, the current known political system is believed to have originated from the Sargonian monarchical system which was adapted by most Terran civilizations at the dawn of the common era that later evolved to the modern nation-states.[16] Outside of the heartland, the Sami and Yanese civilization evolved independently, and the latter's system was later adopted by Higashi. The concept of "democracy" hardly takes root in the Terran nations; in fact, even Columbia, the only presidential federal republic on Terra, is not a pure democracy due to a lack of transparency in its governance despite proudly branding itself as one.

The current geopolitical situation is similar to the pre-World War I era where feudal empires expand their territories without checking due to the scarcity of diplomatic talks; the War of the Four Nations between 1029 and 1031 is the closest moment to an outright world war. Nevertheless, there are many institutions, whether official or private, that attempt to establish a worldwide peacekeeping system such as Laterano's Legati and other non-governmental organizations not only to aid common folk who are ignored by the governments, but also to prevent Terra from falling into a destructive mess. The current internal turmoil also forces Terran nations to completely ignore many hidden threats beyond the borders of their civilizations, especially the threats of the Seaborn and the eldritch demons in the south and the north respectively.


Nation-states
Terra is divided into many nation-states, often being parallels to those in our world, or rather, amalgamated cultures which do not belong to merely one country or time period, but several at once – the most notable example being the pre-Columbian Mesoamerican and Middle Eastern influences of Sargon.

The Terran heartland or the central powers is the core geopolitical concept originally referring to the nation-states locating at the fertile lands of the continent's center, but now it evolves to a political circle of various superpowers having major influence across Terra. Traditionally, the nations of the Terran heartland are mainly Victoria, Gaul, Leithanien, Iberia, and Laterano, but with the disintegration of Gaul after the War of the Four Nations and the devasting Profound Silence in 1038 that brought the collapse of the Iberian regime, Ursus has quickly filled up the vacuum and become a major player in the heartland region. In modern days, the Terran heartland composes of Victoria, Leithanien, Ursus, Iberia, and Laterano. In a broader, indefinite sense, both Kazimierz and Yan are sometimes included in the heartland circle politically, but the former is not regarded as the traditional heartland nations, and the latter has no interest in expanding towards the central region, hence most of the time they are excluded from the circle. In recent years, Columbia is actively interfering in the affairs of the central regions in order to become part of the geopolitical heartland circle through economic and military influences. 


Science and technology
Due to the planetary disaster that befell Terra millenia ago, there is an enormous technological gap between the current era and the previous era, with present-day Terrans having no memory regarding it. While Terra's current technological level is similar to that of Earth, it is more advanced to a limited extent. Just like their forebearers, the Terrans can achieve many marvelous engineering such as A.I.-controlled robots, UAVs and UGVs, and especially gigantic nomadic cities and steam-powered power armors. But there are also many crucial developments that are far behind time due to many circumstances, most notably shipbuilding and nautical exploration due to the Seaborn's presence, and high-altitude flight due to the Starpod.

Terra notably have different chemical and geological makeup, thus they do not have some of Earth's chemical formulae and compounds, most notably those that would be necessary to fashion simple gunpowder.


Warfare
Terran guns are completely different to Earth's, despite their superficially similar appearance.

The Terrans generally make use of cold weaponry (swords, spears, shields, bows, crossbows, etc.) along with the enhancement of giant military landships playing similar role to naval warships. Firearms and explosives do exist, but unlike Earth ones, they are Originium-based; Terran firearms use Originium Arts as the operating mechanism and fires Originium projectiles, making it more of a "magic wand" that fires bullets – which, from an Arts standpoint, are disposable Arts projectile wands themselves.[2] On the other hand, Terran explosives use compositions that are derived from Originium.

As the result, firearms are a rarity in Terra – more so than explosives – with handguns being more common than long guns (e.g. rifles, shotguns, (sub)machine guns) that are almost exclusively used by the Sankta who have a native predisposition to the Arts required for firearms, calling them "patron firearms". Some non-Sankta such as several Blacksteel operatives also use firearms, but they are noted to be different from the Sankta's patron firearms and notably expensive, being reverse-engineered replicas inferior to Sankta firearms.
Astronomy
“We haven't even explored everything these lands have to offer, and have only just begun measuring the heights of the skies. Why fly to such high places in vain?” - Stephenson, a Columbian aerodynamics scientist

Due to the presence of the Starpod, the Terrans lack astrological technologies taken for granted in Earth due to both their disinterest and their disabilities in exploring outer space. As a consequence, development of astronomy and aerodynamics in Terra is nearly non-existent. Because the Starpod causes disarray to the starlights, the Iberian sailors are forced to abandon celestial navigation and rely on alternative methods built by Aegir technologies such as lighthouses and ship signals.

In Terran year 1099, Kristen Wright of Rhine Lab became the very first Terran who managed to overcame the Starpod as part of her extended interest in navigating beyond the world by blasting off the barrier. Since then, the hole left behind was given new opportunity to scientists to conduct research regarding the Terran sky.


Culture
Many of the Terran cultures are almost identical with Earth's, including Chinese elements in Yan such as celebrating Spring Festival and ancestral veneration, British influence in Victoria as in their literatures and social manners, and Columbian pop culture that is identical to the American one. There also exists similar religious faiths like those being parallel with Shintoism and Buddhism, or similar religious or universal festival like Christmas and the Sauin as the Halloween.

In present days, the Victorian culture is the most prominent one that are widely accepted and practiced by the Terrans, but a long time ago, it was dominated by the Gaulish one prior to its annihilation. Other cultures remain influential as well such as Yanese poetry and idioms, Ursus's militarism, and Higashi's comic and samurai traditions, though some are starting to lose its position due to political stability as in the case of the Iberian ones.

Terra uses a dating system that is exactly identical to the Gregorian calendar aside from a different year count; the Main Theme is set during Terran Year 1096 ~ 1098.

6.name: |----------RACES----------|
6.content:
Terrans resemble the Homo sapiens of Earth, but that's where the similarities end as nearly all of them possessing the physical traits of various animals, legendary creatures, and mythological beings, and could be humanoid or bestial.

    1. Humanoid Terrans appear similarly to Earthlings, albeit with bestial ears and a non-prehensile tail (although some Terrans do not have either of them), as well as additional features based on their race (e.g. horns, feathers). They are better known on Earth as kemonomimi.
        1.1 Some humanoid Terrans have short, rounded ears or long, pointed ears in place of bestial ears.
        1.2 Some humanoid Terrans actually have two pairs of ears; a bestial pair and a rounded pair identical to that of Homo sapiens'. Interestingly, all four ears are functional, but how this affects hearing is unexplained.
    2. Bestial Terrans are bipedal, sapient versions of the animal/creature they are based on. They are better known on Earth as furries.

Whether or not a Terran is humanoid or bestial does not correspond to their lineage, as attested to by the bestial Rat King having a humanoid daughter (Lin Yühsia).

In regards of reproduction, Terran races are exactly identical to Homo sapiens in which they give birth to the young (viviparity), even if they are based on animals that lay eggs (oviparity). Interracial relationship is common in Terra; if a couple is of similar race (e.g. both being Forte), their offspring will inherit similar traits, but if the couple is of different races (e.g. a Savra with a Forte), their offspring will always inherit the traits of either parent, usually the father. In the case of children of a Sankta and Sarkaz parent, children with the traits of both Sankta and Sarkaz will be born. Nevertheless, since the Aslanian Conquest, race-mixing has been evolved to a political concept where they seek to keep their bloodline's purity, especially among the ruling class.

The average age of a Terran varies depending on their races. Excluding those who achieve immortality, the Teekaz races who possess elongated lifespan, and individuals who exceed the limit through various means, an average age of a Terran is usually around 150 if free of Oripathy throughout their lifetime. The current record holder of longevity is Padishah Ibn Erhan of Sargon, a Savra who reached 230 years old that exceed the average lifespan of his race.

The term human and its derivatives are typically used to refer to the Terran races as a whole, with specific titles reserved for use in technical circumstances.

7.name: Predecessor
7.content:
Members of the Predecessors appear exactly identical to original humans, but whether this also extends to physical capability and lifespan.

The Predecessors are actually alien to Terra, possibly a Type-III space-faring civilization based on the Kardashev scale, who arrived in the planet over 13,000 years before the events of Arknights take place, bringing animals that would evolve into Ancients and Elders with them. They displaced the Teekaz as Terra's sole inhabitants and built an advanced civilization over the course of millennia since their arrival.

Some 13,000 years ago, the majority of the Predecessors were wiped out by a "threat from above" — implied to be the Observers, and for unknown reasons, they shielded Terra's troposphere with the Starpod. The Predecessor survivors constructed the "Stargates" to reconnect with other planets, but this went haywire as they unleashed the Collapsals onto Terra. The Predecessors also carried out the "Preserver Project" as a contingency plan to ensure the Predecessors' survival with Trevor Friston as one of the volunteers. Two Predecessor survivors, Priestess and "Oracle", created Originium as the only feasible way to ensure the Predecessors' continuity by having them transcend into the Assimilated Universe, despite the substance later becoming the ever-present bane of the Terrans.

By the time of Arknights, the Predecessors are all but extinct, at least in Terra, since only the Oracle, now known as the "Doctor", who remained; the slumbering Predecessor survivors part of the Preserver Project had their Sarcophagi's power drained, preventing them from ever being awakened; Priestess is implied to have died (albeit her consciousness lingers within the Assimilated Universe); and Trevor Friston had become a Preserver.

Although all but few of the current Terrans had no knowledge regarding the Predecessors whatsoever, their legacy nonetheless shaped the Terrans in the millennia to come. The only ones who were aware of the Predecessors' existence are the Aegirians and very few rare individuals. Predecessors' lost are so advanced technologies to the point that they are a completely alien civilization when compared with the rest of the Terrans.

8.name: -----Natives-----
8.content: Terra has been inhabited by several sapient races long before the advent of the Ancients and Elders.

9.name: Elf
9.content:
The Elves (singular: Elf) are a race of Terra. 

As their name suggests, Elves resemble the eponymous race from various fantasy settings in our world, which can be seen from their longer, pointed ears, and a taller stature when compared to Durins. They also possess a very long lifespan that can keep their youth forever. Unfortunately, Elves are very sensitive to Originium, and Oripathy will drastically decrease their lifespan to only less than a month. Such inadaptation also causes the Elves to lack the ability to use any kind of Originium Arts, but their unique "magic" can supplement such defect. In fact, Elves are actually direct descendants of a certain Feranmut who created them to be guardians of ruins belonging to the "Predecessors", thus their incapability to use Originium and their supernatural traits.

Due to Originium pollution caused by the industrialization of Terran civilization in modern era, Elves are currently an endangered race, being dubbed as only "belonging to the past." Most Elves choose either living a hermit life up in the forests or risking their lives to dwell in cities. Nevertheless, there are still Elven communities thriving in some unpolluted havens in the wilderness such as the forests in central Sami. Many of the Sami Elves inhabit around a giant sacred tree filled with amber which they venerate as the source of their lives. However, due to how isolated they are from outside world, the Sami Elven cannot speak the common Terran language but Muelsyse can still understand them via some sort of telepathy communication. 

The Elves' connection to nature is a reference to how they are portrayed as being the guardian of the nature in folklores involving them.

10.name: Feranmut
10.content:
The Feranmuts are a race of Terra

The Sargonian scholars who coined the term "Feranmuts" describe these majestic "gods" and Their "prophets" as gigantic living creatures Whose characteristics are unfathomable to ordinary people. These entities have various physical characteristics which mimic the mythological creatures and deities in our world, ranging from humanoid to anthropomorphic. They wield unique powers completely unrelated to Originium Arts, and are completely immune to the influences of Originium, including Oripathy. Feranmuts are apparently biologically immortal, but can be killed or "shattered" into multiple fragments or avatars of varying personalities acting as their own "proxies" or "executors." A Feranmut's average lifespan spans tens of thousands of years. They can even allow Their mortal bodies to be destroyed while retaining Their spiritual consciousness.

The Feranmuts' power are strongly associated with topography. As a matter of fact, many have the ability to perform terra-formation and weather control. However, Their supernatural ability depends on Their dwelling land as well as Their ages. Those that are too young would only limit Their domination in a certain region, whereas Those that are old enough could exert their power beyond Their dwellings.

Aside from topographic alter, Feranmuts could bend the basic concepts of physics and time and create paradoxes. They are able to get rid of Their flesh but still retains Their physic form, or "transcended into spirits" in a mortal's sense. For example, in a special specimen from Kazdel stored inside the Victorian Royal Academy of Sciences, a Feranmut corpse specimen coded "OFAS-021" was able to withstand corrosive liquid for almost a month, but it suddenly turned into pieces of barren bones on the thirty-second day.

Due to Their might, Feranmuts are often seen as deities or gods by the Terrans, although "living gods" would describe Them better. Nevertheless, Feranmuts do not have the concept of "domination" or "sovereign;" rather, They view the mortals as literal part of Their bodies dwelling upon Them.


Origin
Feranmuts are, along with the Sarkaz, the original inhabitants of Terra. Before the "arrival" of the Ancients and Elders, Teekaz tales regarding the Feranmuts were already wide-spread.

To the Feranmuts Themselves, They narrated that They were born from the chaotic void who later "created" the soil and "gave order" to the sun and the moon. At one point in prehistoric era, They faced "an eye that broke the heavens," and They sacrificed Themselves to expel the "eye" out of the cost of countless casualties, resulting in Their dwindling number.


Relationship with mortals
For generations, humans fearfully worshipped Them due to their limited knowledge. But in Yan, the concept of "subjugation of gods" were already fermenting. Yanese scholars later uncovered a geographical region dubbed "Remains of the Gods" where they uncovered numerous Feranmut skeletons that nourished the place with many new-born lives. It was this moment that Yanese scholars realized Their mortal nature. Not only they no longer treated Them as sacred gods but "beasts of the soil", but also, they pioneered a prominent academic study regarding Them later known as "feranmutology." Their study reached to the climax during the Great Hunt of Yan where the mortals declared challenge against the gods, but the sole idea of expelling them was already a matter of discussion since years prior. In fact, a True Lung once used the Feranmuts' powers to control the winds and rains to quell the "Hundred Clan Rebellion." However, while this story was widely sung, truth was that the True Lung was unwilling to bind Yan's sovereignty to the Feranmuts, nor he wanted their power to cover the land for a long time. Subsequent dynasties of Yanese emperors would continue to summon talented people that could help unmasking the Feranmuts' "true colors."

After the Great Hunt, the population of the Feranmuts furthered dwindle, which forced Them to hide Their identities.[10] The surviving Feranmuts have since been hibernating beneath the soil and mountains and stay away from the mortals' affair. Nevertheless, the scale of the Feranmuts' influence across Terra still persist ranging from religion, culture, to even technology. Some of Them are still worshipped in certain regions or live alongside humans, as in the cases of Kjerag and Sami. Certain fragments of the Feranmuts can merge with numerous relics, allowing mankind to harness Their power in weaponry; this is the source of power of many ancient Sarkaz swords and even modern staves.

Outside of Yan, most of research about Them are achieved by Breogan the Aegir who ventured into an unhabitable Sargonian desert formed by unnaturally evaporated coral reefs. There, he observed several Feranmuts bearing resemblances with the Leviathans roaming around the barrenlands. Their presence was the cause of its hostile environment because normal life could not withstand Their presence as if the piece of land is a literal "living being," forcing Breogan's scouts to retreat immediately. Despite this, many Terrans, even Breogan himself, are still puzzled over the real nature of the Feranmuts.
