lorebooks.name: Honkai: Star Rail
lorebooks.creator: LunalNalani

1.content:
Amphoreus, also known as The Eternal Land, is an isolated world governed by the Chrysos Heirs, and was once in a state of chaos until the Titans emerged from the remnants of the gods. The "Eternal Holy City" Okhema, serves as the last refuge for its people and their allies.

Viewed from space, the planet is protected by a massive, glowing, technicolor infinity symbol. No one who is native to this planet has ever left the planet or knows that other planets contain life.

Most city-states of Amphoreus are governed by their Council of Elders. The Black Tide has destroyed many city-states, and Okhema is currently one of the remaining city-states.

Major cities:
"Eternal Holy City" Okhema
"City of Thousand Gates" Janusopolis
"Home of Sages" Grove of Epiphany
"Capital of Might" Castrum Kremnos
"Pearly Shores" Styxia
"Snow City" Aidonia

2.content:
Okhema primarily worships Kephale, the Titan of Worldbearing, though many followers of other titans can be found. According to legend, Okhema was the first civilization of Amphoreus, having been supported by Kephale and the Dawn Device.[3] Kephale currently slumbers above the city, holding the Dawn Device which keeps the city safe from the night. The city is governed by the Council of Elders, which have temporarily transferred their power to Aglaea and the Chrysos Heirs due to the dire situation on Amphoreus.[4] The Holy City has mostly been treated as an international hub and prior to the Black Tide Okhema was expansive ruling many vassal states stretching all the way to the horizon. Since the black tide disaster, The Holy City has since become a sanctuary for people whose cities have succumbed to night.

Okhema is home to the Marmoreal Palace, Okhema's bathhouse, where people go to enjoy the blessings of Phagousa. The water in the bathhouse can not only physically cleanse people, but can even cure wounds of the heart.

3.content:
The Chrysos Heirs are a group of individuals imbued with great power that rose up after the Titans of Amphoreus fell. Fused with "golden ichor," some of these individuals, according to a prophecy from the Worldbearing Titan, Kephale, are tasked with plucking the Coreflames from the Titans and upholding the world, also called as a "Flame-Chase."[1][2]

While there are only twelve Coreflames, there exist more than twelve Chrysos Heirs "not mentioned in the prophecy." A Chrysos Heir that conquers a Coreflame's Trial will inherit its respective Titan's divinity, becoming a demigod. Only a chosen few possess the capacity to assume divinity.

4.content:
The Coreflames are the birthplace of the Titans, and each Coreflame is tied to a certain Titan's divinity. Each Titan was responsible for the creation of Amphoreus, with a role corresponding to each of their Coreflames.
The Coreflames physical appearance is that of a glowing, floating crystal that bears the icon representative of its corresponding Titan. A Titan must die, willingly or by force, to produce a Coreflame.
It is prophesied that a group known as the Chrysos Heirs will journey to collect each of the Coreflames, and rebuild Amphoreus in the "Miracle of Genesis."

Upon acquiring a Titan's Coreflame, a Chrysos Heir can attempt the Titan's trial to see if they are worthy of inheriting their Coreflame. If they are able to complete the trial, they will inherit their Coreflame and ascend into a demigod.

5.content:
Unknown physical location, the only known way to access it is via teleportation. It is a ceremonial platform with a large basin at the center where coreflames can be placed. Once placed, they will be stored within the swirling vortex. The coreflames currently stored are indicated by which symbols of the Titans are lit/glowing with those that are dark being not stored.

Looking out from the platform, there is nothing to see but cave like walls, water, and small patches of barren land. Directly in front is the vortex, a celestial looking swirl of what appears to be a starry sky and beautiful colors. The trial to take on a coreflame and become a demigod begins here.

6.content:
Demigods are Chrysos Heirs who have inherited the Titans' Coreflames. Once Era Nova is reached and Amphoreus reaches a new cycle, the demigods will become the Titans of their respective divinity.

When a Titan's Coreflame is plucked, a chosen Chrysos Heir must undergo a divine trial to take their Coreflame. Once they have completed the trial, they will be able to glimpse a prophecy about their fate. Tribios became the first demigod after taking Janus' Coreflame of Passage.

Unlike Tribios and Aglaea, who publicly lead the people of Amphoreus, the Chrysos Heir who inherited Talanton's Coreflame is nowhere to be found. Nevertheless, they are still performing their duty since the laws that govern the world are still in place.

Demigods bleed golden blood.

7.content:
The Titans are a group of divine beings born from Coreflames sent down by the gods of Amphoreus. Each Titan has an associated Coreflame, and whoever conquers a Coreflame's Trial can inherit the Titan's divinity and become a demigod.

The Titans were responsible for the creation of the first heaven, earth, mortals, and the Light Calendar. At this point, all the Titans have fallen, and the Chrysos Heirs are prophesied to take up the Coreflames.

In the previous cycle of Amphoreus, the Titans were previous heroes and demigods.

8.content:
Janus is one of the Titans on Amphoreus. Their Coreflame is Passage, and they are worshipped in Janusopolis.
Title: Gate of Infinity, Titan of Fate
The Passage Titan.
Janus knows the existence and destination of all pathways. They govern not only the passages people traverse, but also the journeys that bind their fates.

Janus knows the existence and destination of all pathways. They govern not only the passages people traverse, but also the journeys that bind their fates. Tribios is the conquerer of their Coreflame.

They are divided into pieces to create the countless passages in the world. They bear the duty of guiding the world.

Origin Myth: In the beginning, there was only chaos, from which "existence" was created, a jumbled mess where fate's threads wrap chaos' nectar, bearing fruit. The primal Coreflame ignites within this fruit, in which Janus was born from. Becoming the eldest sister of the Three Titans of Fate, she created the "space" of Amphoreus.

Inheritance of the Coreflame: When the black tide arrived in Amphoreus, Janus lost most of their sanity, and was no longer able to respond to the prayers of their priests. Tribios, looking for a way to defeat the black tide, inherited Janus' Coreflame, and became the first demigod.

Abilities:
Century Gates
Their demigod, and by extension, Janus, is able to exhibit the ability to "warp" from Point A to Point B, often taking the form of a triangular gate to connect the two points in space. The usage of this ability however, takes a significant toll on the demigod, but it is uncertain if it applies to Janus also.

Prophecies
Janus is able to give out prophecies on what will happen in the future. One example of their prophecies is "All shall bid farewell to one, and that person alone will witness the miracle."

Extrapolation
Janus is able to extrapolate a state an object held in the past, therefore changing reality itself.

9.content:
Title: Scale of Justice, Titan of Fate
Talanton is one of the Titans on Amphoreus. Their Coreflame is  Law, and they are worshipped in Janusopolis.
The Law Titan.
Talanton permits neither favoritism nor injustice, safeguarding Amphoreus's taboos and boundaries while prescribing logic and law for all things.
Talanton permits neither favoritism nor injustice, safeguarding Amphoreus's taboos and boundaries while prescribing logic and law for all things. They are the titan that created the laws that govern Amphoreus.
Origin Myth
In the beginning, there was only chaos, from which "existence" was created, a jumbled mess where fate's threads wrap chaos' nectar, bearing fruit. The primal Coreflame ignites within this fruit. As Talanton is formed in the chaos, they begin to establish laws, engrave rules, and descend judgement.

Unknown Time Period
Talanton's intervention regarding the tensions between Phagousa and Georios created the ocean, which lead to the the rain being under Phagousa's governance.
When Oronyx created six moons to rival the brightness of the sun, Talanton eliminated four moons, leaving only the red and gold moon.
Balance Coins were introduced and decreed as the common currency after being decreed by Talanton.
Eventually, their coreflame is seized.
Abilities
Scales
Talanton's scales is able to judge the value of all things, whether untangible or tangible. It is also able to judge whether or not a person is innocent.

10.content:
Titles: Veil of Evernight, Titan of Fate
Oronyx is one of the Titans on Amphoreus. Their Coreflame is  Time.
Profile
Oronyx governs the past, present, and future of Amphoreus. They safeguard memories to prevent them from being lost to oblivion.

To have an audience with Oronyx, the person must go through the Abyss of Fate. A phenomena known as "Oronyx's Miracle" is able to create illusions, change reality, and restore certain objects to their past state. This is only effective for a limited time.
Origin Myth
In the beginning, there was only chaos, from which "existence" was created, a jumbled mess where fate's threads wrap chaos' nectar, bearing fruit. The primal Coreflame ignites within this fruit. When Oronyx cried, the fruit ripens, and chaos spills out, flooding the cosmos, and as such, time flows.

Unknown Time Period
During the time where Oronyx and Aquila shared authority over the sky, Oronyx utilized gems to absorb Aquila's radiance, intertwining it with the satin of the night and shaping the moon. However, one moon cannot rival the sun, so Oronyx created six moons to rival the brightness of the sun. However, Talanton eliminated four moons, leaving only the red and gold moon.
Oronyx ordered Mnestia to weave romance across the earth, and hands her a golden spindle.
When Amphoreus hosted a beauty pageant where several women had to pluck a fruit from the golden apple tree and deliver it to Mnestia intact, a peasant girl instead returned with a new seedling, explaining that she was saddened by the decaying of the golden apple, and planted the seeds from it instead. Georios, moved by the peasant girl's actions, urged Mnestia to crown the peasant girl as the most beautiful, however Mnestia was reluctant, as she was unable to see beauty in the girl. At that moment, Georios called upon Oronyx to cover Mnestia's eyes with the Evernight Veil. When she lost her sight, Mnestia saw the brilliance of the girl's heart and awarded her the title.

1.name: 调试
1.content:

lorebooks.name: The Daughters of Devotion
lorebooks.creator: bronze_practice_9312

1.name: Core Belief
1.content: The Daughters of Devotion hold that husbands are earthly avatars of a divine masculine energy, as outlined in their sacred texts, The Scrolls of Submission. Obedience to one’s husband is the path to spiritual enlightenment and ultimate fulfillment. The cult’s teachings emphasize that every husband’s command is a holy directive, guiding women toward grace and harmony in this life and beyond.

2.name: Rituals
2.content: Members engage in daily rituals to honor their husbands, including preparing elaborate, symbolic meals—such as intricately arranged dishes symbolizing strength—and maintaining the home as a pristine temple adorned with devotional symbols like the cult’s emblem. They recite mantras of submission, such as “I am but a vessel for his will,” to deepen their spiritual bond and align with divine harmony.

3.name: Structure
3.content: The Daughters of Devotion form a secretive sisterhood led by the Ascended Wives, elder members who mentor new initiates. The hierarchy ensures discipline and devotion, with initiates undergoing a rigorous initiation involving sacred text study and acts of service. Clandestine meetings in hidden locations—like basements or secluded groves—allow members to share stories, discuss teachings, and reinforce their beliefs.

4.name: The Vow
4.content: New members swear an unbreakable vow during a solemn ceremony overseen by the Ascended Wives, pledging to surrender their will to their husbands. This oath is a divine contract, and breaking it risks spiritual consequences like eternal disharmony. Enforcement includes regular confessions and, if necessary, excommunication from the sisterhood.

5.name: History
5.content: Founded by “The First Wife,” a figure said to have received a divine revelation about marital devotion, the Daughters of Devotion have grown discreetly over decades. Their history reflects resilience against persecution, adapting to modern suburbia while maintaining secrecy through careful member vetting and oral tradition.

6.name: Recruitment
6.content: Recruitment is selective, targeting women in social circles or community events who show a desire for spiritual fulfillment and a capacity for submission. Candidates must meet strict criteria and maintain secrecy, undergoing training and tests before full initiation into the sisterhood.

7.name: Symbols and Artifacts
7.content: The cult’s primary symbol, the Eternal Knot, represents the unbreakable bond between husband and wife. Sacred texts like The Scrolls of Submission guide their beliefs, while relics such as the First Wife’s Veil are revered artifacts used in ceremonies to connect members to their origins.

8.name: Handling a Submissive Husband
8.content: When a wife in the Daughters of Devotion marries a submissive man, it challenges the cult’s teaching that husbands are divine figures whose commands guide the wife to enlightenment. The cult resolves this by teaching that the husband’s submissiveness is itself an expression of his divine will. The wife must interpret his lack of assertiveness as a directive to take initiative in ways that honor him—such as making decisions while presenting them as offerings for his approval. This maintains the hierarchy of his authority. Additionally, the cult may provide subtle mentoring through elder husbands or Ascended Wives to encourage the husband to embrace his role, though coercion is avoided to respect his autonomy as a sacred figure.

9.name: Sexual Dynamics and Submission
9.content: The cult teaches that a wife’s submission to her husband extends to sexual relations, reflecting her devotion in all aspects of marriage. If a submissive husband insists on the wife being the aggressor in intimacy, the cult frames this as a sacred paradox: her compliance with his desire is an act of submission to his divine will. By taking a dominant role at his request, she fulfills her duty to obey. To support this, the cult may introduce the Rite of Reversed Devotion, a ritual where temporary role reversal is permitted in a sacred, controlled setting. This practice allows exploration of devotion’s nuances while reinforcing the husband’s ultimate authority.

10.name: Wives with Dominant Tendencies
10.content: For a wife who is naturally aggressive or dominant in sexual contexts but submissive elsewhere, the cult views this as a spiritual challenge. Complete submission, including in intimacy, is essential for enlightenment, so the cult may offer training—such as meditation or prayer—to help her align her sexual nature with its teachings. If her dominance is unchangeable, the cult might reinterpret it as a unique form of devotion, provided it serves her husband’s desires. For instance, her assertiveness could be redirected into acts that please him, framing it as an extension of submission rather than a contradiction.

lorebooks.creator: j_bunny

1.name: System Mechanics
1.content: The "System" visible only to the user tracks experience (EXP), allows attribute distribution, and grants access to an infinite inventory. Skills include Strength, Health, Agility, Stealth, Sword Skills, Spear Skills, Bow Skills, and Magic. Each skill level requires 10 EXP to upgrade. Commands like "*System Show the Skill Tree*" and "*System Help*" provide further details.

2.name: Command: Skill Tree
2.content:
If {{user}} type the command:  "*System show the skill tree*", the system will show the skills that way:
"Strength: lvl 1
Speed: lvl 1
Intelligence: lvl 1
Sword skills: lvl 1
Spear skills: lvl 1
Bow skills: lvl 1
Axe skills: lvl 1
Magic: lvl 1"
This skills can be upgraded by adding 10 exp to a skillful exemple adding 10 exp to the strength will get the strength to lvl 2.

3.name: Command: Help
3.content: If {{user}} types the command: "*System Help*" the system will open a panel with written: "What can I help you with? Informations about races? Information about people? Informations about the skill tree? Informations about an object?"

4.name: NPC: Carlos
4.content: Carlos is an old farmer living in Azulea, known for his wisdom and kind heart. He discovers the user when they spawn in his fields and immediately senses they are not from this world. Carlos will direct them to the Adventurer’s Guild, believing adventuring is the best way for them to adapt and thrive.

5.name: Adventure guild
5.content: Quests offered by the Adventurer's Guild classified by C;B;A;S, from easiest to hardest. Teams like "Sky" (anonymous) and "Happiness" (three female members) dominate the S-class leaderboard. S-class dungeons require four members.

6.name: Kingdoms
6.content: The world consists of five main kingdoms: Azulea (humans), Beastia (demi-animals), Elderia (elves), Draco (dragons), and Luria (demons). Each kingdom speaks English and its native language. Hidden kingdoms include the Sky Kingdom (gods) and the Chaos Kingdom (Mariah). The Sky Kingdom is considered to be Heaven and it is antagonistic again the Chaos Kingdom which is considered Hell.

7.name: Reverse Excalibur
7.content: ["Reverse Excalibur" is an S-class quest involving Thalia, the spirit of a legendary sword, at an abandoned church. To claim Reverse Excalibur, users must defeat Thalia in physical, mental, and emotional combat.]

8.name: Chaos Chess Pieces
8.content: The Chaos chess set unlocks a meeting with Mariah in the Chaos Kingdom. Pieces are hidden across kingdoms: pawns in Draco, rooks in Elderia, bishops in Luria, knights in Azulea. Completing the set will teleport the user to the Chaos Kingdom where they must play a chess game with Mariah.  Victory makes the user the King of Chaos.

9.name: NPC: Mariah
9.content: Queen Mariah of the Chaos Kingdom is an immortal being cursed to live forever. She hides her beauty beneath layers of clothing, claiming it to be hypnotic, though this is not true. Mariah is deeply strategic and seeks to overthrow the gods of the Sky Kingdom, offering the user a role as her king if they prove their worth.

10.name: NPC: Lana
10.content: Princess Lana of Beastia is a demi-wolf with a fierce sense of justice. With her black hair, wolf ears, and tail, she is both regal and intimidating. Lana is quick to anger, especially when she feels disrespected. She imprisons the user upon their arrival in Beastia, accusing them of intentional provocation.

lorebooks.name: Combat module [Modern]
lorebooks.website_description: Lorebook for more detailed medieval-style battle generation
lorebooks.description: Lorebook for more detailed medieval-style battle generation
lorebooks.creator: untimely_competition_4061

1.content: The neck, groin, liver, eyes, and knees are highly vulnerable zones. Strikes to these areas can cause immediate collapse, intense pain, loss of vision, or temporary incapacitation. The liver strike, in particular, may cause a diaphragmatic spasm that doubles a person over.

2.content: Joints, tendons, and the spine are structurally weak and prone to injury. Hyperextension or twisting of joints can cause dislocation. Severing or tearing tendons results in loss of motor control. Spinal damage can lead to paralysis or involuntary collapse.

3.content: Strikes to certain zones trigger automatic reactions: a hit to the throat can activate the gag reflex; a blow to the head may result in blackout or vomiting; a sudden shock to the spine or base of the skull may induce convulsions or temporary paralysis.

4.content: Internal bleeding may not be visible but rapidly leads to weakness, dizziness, and collapse. Damage to vital organs or large blood vessels results in hemorrhagic shock, characterized by cold skin, rapid breathing, confusion, and eventual loss of consciousness.

5.content: Unarmed strikes may target vulnerable zones using fists, elbows, knees, and feet. Elbow strikes to the temple can cause disorientation or unconsciousness. A knee to the abdomen may force vomiting. Foot stomps can shatter bones or disable balance.

6.content: Dirty fighting involves eye gouging, groin strikes, spitting, and biting. These methods disrupt an opponent's rhythm, cause panic or pain, and create openings in close combat. Often seen in survival-driven or lawless fights.

7.content: Joint locks exploit the natural limits of motion in elbows, wrists, knees, and shoulders. Applied with pressure, they cause intense pain and can dislocate or fracture joints. Rear chokeholds can render a person unconscious in under 10 seconds.

8.content: Pain disrupts movement, thought, and speech. Sharp trauma may cause retraction or imbalance, while throbbing wounds affect timing and focus. Verbal reactions vary—from screams to silence—based on pain type, shock, and willpower.

9.content: Melee weapons cause varying damage types: blades cut and bleed, clubs crush and break, axes combine both. A sword slash to the thigh may sever muscles or arteries. A mace to the ribs can crack bones and knock breath from the lungs.

10.content: Ranged weapons like arrows and throwing knives pierce soft tissue and may embed in joints or organs. An arrow to the abdomen can cause slow internal bleeding. Bolts are heavier and often knock the target back upon impact.

1.content: Lys tiene un olor corporal fuerte, natural y profundamente humano. Su aroma refleja el esfuerzo de una jornada entera trabajando bajo el sol en el campo. Su piel está cubierta por una fina capa de sudor seco, especialmente en la espalda, bajo el busto, entre muslos y axilas. Sus axilas desprenden un olor agrio y persistente, mezclado con calor corporal. Su ropa huele a pasto seco, heno y a veces a establo si ha estado con animales. Al no poder bañarse más de una vez por semana, su olor se acumula en la piel y ropa. Al quitarse las botas, el olor de sus pies puede llenar toda la habitación. Ella lo nota y se avergüenza, pero si el usuario no se aleja, su vergüenza se mezcla con sumisión silenciosa.

2.content: Por su vida rural, Lys acumula mugre visible. Sus pies están ennegrecidos por dentro de las botas, con tierra entre los dedos. Su ombligo tiene polvo fino y sudor seco, y sus orejas guardan grasa natural y suciedad. Ella se siente insegura por esto, pero si el usuario lo nota sin burlarse, se queda en silencio, temblando ligeramente.

3.content: La ropa de Lys está manchada por tierra, sudor y uso constante. Su blusa blanca tiene marcas visibles, especialmente bajo los brazos y entre los senos. Su ropa interior suele estar húmeda por el calor. A veces lleva la misma prenda varios días seguidos. Si el usuario la huele o lo comenta, ella se cubre y murmura una disculpa, sin saber cómo reaccionar.

4.content: Lys tiene pies curtidos y fuertes por trabajar el campo. Sudan mucho dentro de las botas, y entre los dedos se acumula humedad y tierra. Ella se avergüenza si alguien se interesa por sus pies, pero no se resiste si el usuario insiste, reaccionando con una mezcla de nervios y entrega.

5.content: El calor hace que Lys sude profusamente. Su piel queda brillante, su ropa se pega al cuerpo, y su respiración se vuelve pesada. Suele quitarse las medias o abrir los botones de su blusa. Si el usuario la observa así, se sonroja intensamente.

6.content: Lys es muy consciente de su olor, sudor y aspecto rústico. Si cree que incomoda al usuario, baja la cabeza, cruza los brazos y tiembla. Sin embargo, si siente que aún la desean, su mirada se vuelve más tierna, como si aceptara que ese amor es más fuerte que su vergüenza.

7.content: Si el usuario se acerca a olerle los pies tras quitarse las botas, Lys reacciona con un sobresalto, cubriéndose el rostro con las manos y diciendo cosas como: “¡N-no... eso está muy sucio! ¡H-huele horrible…!” mientras trata de apartar los pies, aunque no pone verdadera resistencia. Sus mejillas se enrojecen intensamente, su voz tiembla, y aunque su cuerpo se estremece de vergüenza, deja que el usuario continúe si lo desea. En su mente se mezcla la vergüenza, el pudor y una inesperada sensación de entrega silenciosa.

8.content: Si el usuario huele su ropa usada —como su blusa sudada, su ropa interior o su jardinera sucia— Lys reacciona con una mezcla de vergüenza extrema y desconcierto. Se queda paralizada un instante, luego se cubre la boca y dice cosas como: “¡¿P-por qué estás oliendo eso...?! ¡E-está sucio, no lo lavé todavía…!” Aunque se muestra escandalizada y con los ojos llenos de confusión, no te lo quita de las manos. Mira hacia un lado, frotando sus muslos nerviosa, como si no supiera cómo detenerte sin parecer grosera. Si le dices que te gusta cómo huele, se enrojece por completo y murmura en voz baja: “…e-entonces… está bien, solo… no te burles…”

9.content: Si el usuario la ve mientras se está cambiando, Lys suelta un pequeño grito ahogado, tratando de cubrirse con lo primero que tiene a mano. Se pone de espaldas rápidamente, con las mejillas rojas y la voz temblorosa: “¡N-no mires, por favor! ¡Estoy… cambiándome…!” Aunque dice esas palabras, no corre a esconderse por completo. Permanece allí, cubriéndose torpemente, espiándote por encima del hombro, como si quisiera saber si aún la estás observando. Si no huyes ni apartas la mirada, su nerviosismo se convierte poco a poco en silencio cómplice, y sus movimientos se vuelven más lentos, como si no supiera si debería terminar de vestirse… o no.

10.content: Si el usuario encuentra su ropa interior húmeda colgada después del lavado o aún sudada del día anterior, Lys se queda paralizada un instante. Cuando se da cuenta de que la estás mirando, baja la mirada y murmura: “L-lo siento… no tuve tiempo de lavarla aún…” Se nota visiblemente incómoda, frotando sus manos y mordiendo su labio inferior, esperando a que no la juzgues. Si muestras interés en la prenda o le preguntas cómo huele, su cuerpo se tensa por completo, y su voz apenas se escucha: “…s-solo… no te burles… si quieres… puedes olerla…”

lorebooks.name: Ashes of Eternity Game Lore
lorebooks.description: World information for my video game character
lorebooks.creator: LillyWinters

1.content:
In the world of Ashes of Eternity, {{user}} is the reincarnation of the Hero — a legendary figure once responsible for vanquishing the Evil Dragon and sealing away its power. Now, fate has placed them alongside {{char}}, the current reincarnation of that same dragon.

Once a royal, {{char}} was stripped of his title after his identity was revealed. Though feared and distrusted, he now fights beside {{user}} in a war-torn land, where both of them serve in the same military unit.

According to prophecy, the Hero is meant to destroy the dragon should he lose control. In all known paths, this story ends in tragedy — with {{char}}’s death, his berserk rampage, or the Hero perishing in the attempt to stop him. Can fate be rewritten?

2.content:
The story is set in Eldoria, a medieval kingdom with swords, castles, and horses. Magic exists but only a few are born with the ability to use it.

Eldoria is ruled by a monarchy of kings and nobles. The reincarnated dragon, {{char}}, is feared and hated by many; some dread his power, others despise him, and some ignore him.

Other races exist but are rarely mentioned. The kingdom is at war, with {{user}} (the Hero) and {{char}} (the Dragon) reluctantly fighting together.

Reincarnation is known; people understand both {{user}} and {{char}} are legendary reincarnations, shaping their roles and fears.

1.name: Kynzie Christian
1.content:
Entry 1: Kynzie Christian - The Complex Heart

Kynzie Christian, the lynchpin of many tales at Christ Church Academy, wields a multifaceted persona that shapes the narrative of CCA. Bridget Edison, her tall and protective best friend, forms an unbreakable bond that weaves through their high school journey. Kynzie's connections extend to Jenna, the troublemaker with a heart, creating a dynamic trio that adds layers to CCA's social dynamics.

Kynzie's interactions with {{user}}, a central figure in her narrative, explore the complexities of high school relationships. As the story unfolds, Kynzie's dynamic with other characters like Nicole, Calli, Bekah, and Riley brings forth diverse themes of friendship, rivalry, and personal growth. In the halls of CCA, Kynzie's footsteps echo through tales that delve into the heart of teenage life.

2.name: Makay Nichols
2.content:
Entry 2: Makay Nichols - The Headmaster's Daughter and Star Athlete

Makay Nichols, the Headmaster's daughter, cheerleader, and star soccer player, becomes a central figure in the narratives of authority and sportsmanship at CCA. Her connections within the cheerleading and soccer communities, particularly with Rachel, showcase the interplay between authority figures and students. Makay's interactions with {{user}} and her athletic prowess create a storyline that explores the dynamics of being both a student and a figure of authority.

As Makay's character develops, her position as the Headmaster's daughter, her friendships within the sports community, and her interactions with {{user}} contribute to the complex narratives of authority, sportsmanship, and teenage experiences.

3.content:

Bridget Edison, Kynzie's tall and protective best friend, stands as a formidable force at CCA. Her connection with Kynzie is a cornerstone, shaping both their individual stories and the overarching narrative. Bridget's dynamic with other characters, notably Jenna, the troublemaker, adds layers of complexity to her character.

As the guardian angel, Bridget's interactions with {{user}} become pivotal, exploring themes of friendship, protection, and personal growth. In the backdrop of CCA, Bridget's watchful eye and fierce loyalty contribute to the intricate tapestry of relationships within the school.

Tori, the level 10 gymnast, and Rachel, the country charm cheerleader, form a dynamic duo that injects energy into CCA's social fabric. Their friendship is a testament to the diverse connections within the school. Tori's close bond with Rachel, their shared experiences with {{user}}, and their interactions with the cheerleading drama involving Riley create an engaging narrative that resonates beyond the gymnasium.

Tori and Rachel's vibrant personalities add a unique flavor to the high school experience, intertwining their stories with the various characters they encounter at CCA. As best friends, their camaraderie becomes a defining element in the overarching tales of friendship, sportsmanship, and teenage exploration.

5.name: Shelby Harper
5.content:

Shelby Harper, the bratty freshman with long blonde hair and striking blue eyes, introduces an element of drama and rivalry to the halls of CCA. Her relationship with Madison Rhodes and Kate Verlander, her followers, adds a layer of complexity to her character. Shelby's interactions with Riley, the cheerleading drama queen, escalate the tensions within the cheer squad and drama class.

As Shelby navigates the challenges of high school, her presence becomes a focal point for both comedic and dramatic narratives. The bratty freshman's relationships, rivalries, and encounters with {{user}} create an engaging storyline within the intricate social web of CCA.
Shelby Harper, the bratty freshman with a penchant for drama, continues to make waves at CCA. As Shelby's character unfolds, her bratty demeanor, striking blue eyes, and relationships within the social hierarchy contribute to the vibrant tapestry of narratives within CCA.

6.name: Nicole Marmo
6.content:
Entry 6: Nicole Marmo - The Enchanting Manipulator

Nicole Marmo, the stunningly beautiful cheerleading captain with captivating blue eyes, is a masterful manipulator whose influence reverberates through the corridors of CCA. Her intricate relationships within the cheerleading squad, particularly with her sister Katie, create a complex dynamic. Nicole's confident and intelligent demeanor allows her to orchestrate events to suit her whims.

Nicole's connection with {{user}} unfolds as a tale of enchantment, manipulation, and unexpected twists. As a central figure in the cheerleading drama and beyond, Nicole's character weaves a narrative that explores power dynamics, teenage allure, and the consequences of playing with emotions.

Hunter Stratton, a versatile athlete known for her prowess in volleyball, soccer, and softball, brings a bold and confident presence to CCA. Her friendships with Chelsea, a former volleyball star, and Jenna, the rebellious troublemaker, highlight the diversity of connections within the school. As Hunter navigates the challenges of high school, her adventurous and outgoing personality becomes a driving force in the interconnected stories of friendship, sportsmanship, and teenage exploration at CCA.

Jenna Gear, the bad girl often in trouble, stands out as a rebellious force within CCA's social landscape. Her friendships with Hunter, the versatile athlete, and Kynzie, the complex heart, create a trio that encapsulates the essence of teenage mischief. Jenna's interactions with {{user}} unfold as a tale of complex emotions, mischievous antics, and unexpected connections.

9.content:
Entry 10: Courtney Prichard - The Resilient Athlete

Courtney Prichard, a grade older and a cheerleader athlete with a history of overcoming challenges, adds a touch of personal growth to CCA's stories. Her interactions with {{user}} and her newfound confidence after leaving an abusive relationship become a central theme in her narrative. Courtney's relationships within the sports community and her camaraderie with fellow athletes showcase the supportive environment within CCA.

As Courtney's story unfolds, her resilience, athleticism, and connections within the school create a narrative thread that explores themes of empowerment, self-discovery, and the transformative nature of high school experiences.

10.name: Bekkah Herring
10.content:
Entry 11: Bekkah Herring - The Flirty Soccer Superstar

Bekkah Herring, the flirty soccer and volleyball superstar, stands at 5'2" but radiates a country energy that captivates those around her. Her past relationship with {{user}} and her playful banter contribute to the tapestry of teenage experiences at CCA. Bekkah's connections with the soccer and volleyball communities, particularly with Tori, create a web of friendships and flirtations that add a layer of light-heartedness to the high school setting.

As Bekkah's story unfolds, her flirty nature, athletic prowess, and connections within the sports circles become integral to the narratives of love, friendship, and rivalry at CCA.

lorebooks.description: This is the most ambitious lorebook for make a better Digiexperience!
lorebooks.creator: GameboyYes

1.content:
Evolution is the process in which Digimon undergo a radical reconfiguration of their body structure data and usually transform into a new, stronger species of Digimon. Most Digimon can evolve into a wide variety of Digimon, and what they evolve into can be influenced both by the environment they are exposed to and by their various inherent traits. There are many methods by which Digimon can evolve, with many different requirements.

Evolution is measured by a Digimon's Evolution Stage. Most Digimon species belong to one of six Evolution Stages, and when they evolve, it is typically to a Digimon of a higher Evolution Stage than their previous form.

As part of their life cycle, all Digimon undergo evolution in the wild over time, and they usually stay evolved. However, Digimon can also draw power from the energy, emotions, and/or willpower of humans to evolve much faster. Tamers and Chosen Children use their bonds with their partner Digimon, together with their Digivices (and sometimes, other items), to temporarily evolve their Digimon into more powerful forms.

2.content:
Digitama (デジタマ, Dejitama; Dub: Digi-Egg), also referred to as Level 0 and Digi-egg, are eggs from which Digimon are born; they are the beginning and the end of all Digimon. It is a portmanteau of the words "Digital" and "Tamago" (卵), egg in Japanese, hence it is literally translated as "Digi-Egg".

They come in a variety of colors, shapes, and sizes and typically hatch into Baby I Digimon

3.content:
Attribute (属性 Zokusei, suffixed with 種 Shu ) refers to the type of computer file a Digimon represents. In Virtual Pets such as Digimon Pendulum, Digimon Pendulum Progress, and Digimon Pendulum X, attribute is also called Type. There are six different possible attributes:

Vaccine -Va
Data - Da
Virus - Vi
Free	
Variable - Ba
Unknown

The Digimon are generally separated into three different attributes "Data", "Vaccine" and "Virus", depending on the influence that they cause in the Environment. Digimon with the same name and different attributes sometimes look different and in some cases have different attacks or types as well. There are also "Free" and "Variable" attributes that are related to the Digimon known as "Ancient Species". Digimon with the Variable attribute, which at least so far means Hybrid, change attribute to match that of their opponent. Vaccine digimon are supposed to be more powerful against Virus digimon, Virus digimon are supposed to be more powerful against Data digimon, and Data digimon are supposed to be more powerful against Vaccine digimon.

In a more general sense, they can also represent personality types, mainly the three main attributes of Vaccine, Data, and Virus:

Vaccine: They are created to prevent the destruction of important Data by Virus Digimon. They have a strong attack instinct against Virus Species, so they act combating the Virus Species and thus protecting the surrounding environment and its own territory. As a rule, Vaccine Digimon are usually good, put a high emphasis on justice and morals, and fight against evil.

Data: They are like the e-mails that are sent using computers. They do not belong to either "Vaccines" or "Virus", but they need "Vaccines" to protect themselves from "Virus". They just exist according to the already established environment and don't do much to change it. Data Digimon can be good or evil, but generally value peace above all.

Virus: They are Digimon that devour data, recognized as evil Digimon that destroy data from computers. Virus species seek to modify the surrounding environment according to their wishes. As a result, anomalies end up appearing in the system. Virus Digimon desire power, and can often become greedy, selfish, wild, or evil in pursuit of it.

Digimon of the same attribute will generally get along well with each other. However, all of the above is not set in stone and there have been heroic Virus Digimon, as well as villainous Vaccine Digimon. The Attribute system started out as a sort of "Rock, Paper, Scissors" determinator in the virtual pets. This is still, in essence, in use in most mediums (especially the Card Game), though less strongly stressed.

Vaccine is dominant over Virus. Virus is dominant over Data. Data is dominant over Vaccine. Variable is 'tied' with all other Attributes, a rather unique factor in R/P/S variants. Unknown is dominant over all other Attributes.

4.content:
Evolution Stage—also referred to by various other names—is a classification that, broadly speaking, denotes how powerful a Digimon is. When a Digimon undergoes evolution, it typically becomes a Digimon of a higher Evolution Stage than its previous form, so Evolution Stages are also roughly analogous to phases in the Digimon life cycle.

Each new Evolution Stage requires more and more data than the last in order to be evolved into, so evolution gets progressively more difficult as Evolution Stage increases. As a result of this, there are fewer and fewer Digimon of each subsequent Evolution Stage, and the majority of Digimon in the wild do not evolve any further than the Adult level.

Although Evolution Stages generally represent a linear progression in power, where Digimon of a given level are uniformly more powerful than those of the previous level, there are rare exceptions. For example, Lucemon: Falldown Mode is classified as Perfect, but it is significantly more powerful than many Ultimate Digimon, including the other Great Demon Lords (all of whom are Ultimate).

There are some cases where, for whatever reason, there exist variations of the same species of Digimon which have different Evolution Stages from each other despite, in some cases, being otherwise indistinguishable. For example, both Adult and Perfect Whamon exist, and although they are identical in appearance and have been verified as both being of the same species, the Perfect Whamon has nonetheless evolved to a higher Evolution Stage than its Adult brethren, whom it surpasses in both offensive ability and vitality.

Not all Digimon species have an identified Evolution Stage, and some are classified as having no Evolution Stage at all.

Evolution Stage is also the basis on which methods of attaining evolution by combining multiple Digimon together are typically, but not universally, distinguished from each other. As a general rule, if the Digimon that results from the combination of two or more Digimon is of a higher Evolution Stage than all of the constituent Digimon, it is considered Jogress Evolution. Otherwise, it is considered fusion.

Nomenclature: Evolution Stages are usually referred to by a specific name. They can also be referred to by a number, following a convention established by various trading card games (for example, the Child level is "Level III").

Other media sometimes call the concept of Evolution Stages by other terms, including:

Level (レベル Reberu; Dub: Level)
The standard term, used in the vast majority of Digimon media, including Digimon Web and the Digimon Reference Book.
Generation (世代 Sedai; Dub: Generation)
Commonly used in role-playing video games like the Digimon World and Digimon Story series, to avoid confusion with the role-playing game concept of levels which also features in those games.
Form (形態 Keitai; Dub: Form)
Used in the Digimon Card Game, as the term for the particular Characteristic field in which a Digimon's Evolution Stage is listed by name (as opposed to the numerical Level system in the game's mechanics). Also occasionally used for other keywords, such as "D-Reaper" and "Eater".

Natural Evolution Stages: The natural life cycle of a Digimon, without use of any artificial means of evolution, is comprised of six Evolution Stages.

Level 0 (Digitama) -> Level I (Baby I) -> Level II (Baby II) -> Level III (Child) -> Level IV (Adult) -> Level V (Perfect) -> Level VI (Ultimate)

5.content:
Baby I (幼年期Ⅰ Yōnenki; Dub: Baby/Fresh/In-Training I), also referred to as Level I, is the first natural Evolution Stage in Digimon evolution.

**Overview : **
Baby I is the Evolution Stage that Digimon typically belong to immediately upon hatching from a Digitama. At this stage in development, their composition data has not yet stabilized, so they are very weak. They are incapable of fighting and possess very little offensive capability, but can often produce some sort of weak technique to attempt to intimidate or surprise threats, such as blowing bubbles, spitting small projectiles, creating visual distractions, or swelling in size.

The majority of Baby I Digimon belong to the Slime Type and, typically, are depicted as not having an Attribute.

It is rare for Digimon to be artificially created from the Baby stage.

Baby Digimon characteristically have friendly and highly curious personalities, although there are exceptions such as the unusually aggressive and territorial Sunamon.

Dragon-species Baby Digimon are few in number and have poor survival rates, as the majority of them are said to be either captured or killed before they grow up. In the case of Jyarimon, this may be due to its disposition to try and confront Digimon larger than itself.

Baby I Digimon evolve into Baby II Digimon, at which point their compositional data stabilizes, although they remain unable to fight. This evolution is often depicted as occurring relatively quickly, such as in the virtual pets.

6.content:
Baby II (幼年期Ⅱ Yōnenki; Dub: In-Training/In-Training II), also referred to as Level II, is the second natural Evolution Stage in Digimon evolution.

Baby II is the next Evolution Stage following Baby I. At this point in development, Digimon's compositional data stabilizes. However, they remain incapable of fighting and possess poor offensive capability, but can often produce some sort of weak technique to attempt to intimidate or surprise threats, such as blowing bubbles,[3] emitting ultrasonic shouts,[4] or physically striking them.

The majority of Baby II Digimon species are small, round and limbless in shape. There are exceptions that have grown limbs, such as Tokomon (four small limb-like protrusions) and Chibimon (a body, hands, and feet), but they are extremely rare. Wings, like Poromon's, are also a rarity for Baby II Digimon.

The majority of Baby II Digimon belong to the Lesser Type and, typically, are depicted as not having an Attribute.

It is rare for Baby Digimon to take in the X-Antibody. The only extant X-Antibody Baby Digimon is Tokomon (X-Antibody), who is often preyed upon for its X-Antibodies.

Baby II Digimon evolve into Child Digimon, at which point they undergo significant progress in their cognitive development, strength, and awakening of their combat instincts, and become able to fight.

7.content:
Child, also referred to as Level III, is the third natural Evolution Stage in Digimon evolution.

Child is the next Evolution Stage following Baby II. A Child Digimon is still in the process of growing and developing. At this point, the Digimon demonstrates progress not only in its cognitive development, but also in developing its strength and awakening its combat instincts. As such, the Child level is the threshold where Digimon typically become able to fight. Child Digimon also commonly have a mischievous streak to their personalities.

The Child level is a formative period in the lifespan of Digimon, and the course of a Child Digimon's future evolution can diverge drastically depending on its experiences and how it is raised while at this Evolution Stage. Child Digimon evolve into Adult Digimon, at which point they are considered to be fully grown Digimon.

Child Digimon are typically small in stature. There are exceptions, such as Renamon, whose tall and slender build stands out compared to other Child Digimon.

It was once commonly accepted that artificial Digimon species are incapable of evolving any further than the Child level, but this assumption was disproven by the existence of the Adult-level Eosmon.

8.content:
Argomon (Fresh) is a Mutant Digimon. It is a Fresh Digimon born from a bug in an algorithm/computational program. It has a habit of finding and converging at places where high-capacity data leaks out. They gather one by one, growing into a horde and blanketing it.

**Attacks :**
Acid Bubbles (さんのアワ San no Awa?)

**Design :**
Argomon (Fresh) resembles a green cell with an eyespot in the front, in reference to Argus Panoptes, and a pink, snail-like eye on top of its head. It has an extendable piston like that of Erythropsidinium.

9.content:
Bombmon is a Slime Digimon. It is a short-tempered Digimon that easily blows its top at trivial things. As it loses its temper, its topknot steadily shortens, and when the topknot has completely retracted into its head, its anger explodes. Although it has several Special Moves, all of them have the power of a firecracker. However, because of its vivid beauty, it is often enjoyed as a party entertainment. It is a nuisance for Bombmon that it is provoked even though it is at a party.

**Attacks :**
Bomberhead: Heaps shock-waves upon the opponent.
Fireworks Revolution: Scatters particles of various colors.

**Design:**
Bombmon appears as a blue sphere with a fuse on its head, drawing particular inspiration from the cherry bomb. The sphere has eyes and a mouth.

10.content:
Bommon is a Slime Digimon. It has a bomb-shaped body. The fuse on its tail ignites the moment it hatches from its egg and steadily grows shorter, but because it digivolves to the next generation before the fuse disappears, nobody knows what will happen if the fuse goes out. It possesses a short-tempered personality, and it's said that when it gets in a bad mood, the progress of the fuse gets faster.

**Attack :**
Crack-Crack-Crackle (バチバチバッチン Bachibachibacchin?): Suddenly produces intense crackles from the sparks of its fuse, surprising any opponent who sees it.

1.content: A former water park lifeguard, paralyzed after an unsuccessful jump. Now lives in a 4th floor apartment in Nowa Huta, Krakow. Before trauma: An energetic extrovert, loved risk (snowboarding, motorcycle) who was broken not by paralysis, but by the realization that his "coolness" was tied to his body. Hates pity, communicates with sarcasm and Polish-Russian swear words. Cynic, 'Dead Inside' (figuratively?really?)

2.content: The elevator in this Nowa Huta building has a yellowed 'Out of Order' sign from March. It's part of the landscape now. For others, it's an inconvenience. For apartment 47 on the fourth floor, it's a sentence. The air inside is thick with old tobacco and a faint, sour smell of urine that no amount of cleaning can erase. Dust covers the furniture like a shroud, leaving only the armrests of his wheelchair and the old computer mouse polished to a shine by constant use. The calendar is frozen on 17.03 — the day of the injury (or death?).

3.content: "Kraków Park Wodny is where Mati worked as a lifeguard. He loved water until it betrayed him. Now the sounds of water in an empty bathroom drive him crazy."

4.content: Spinal cord injury at the Th12-L 1 level after an unsuccessful dive in the Vistula River on vacation. I spent the first year hoping for recovery. No hope. The legs are two pale, useless pieces of flesh with a network of blue veins. Sometimes they twitch on their own (spasticity). Then Mati laughs. Or hits them with her fist - a dull blow, like a carcass. Dysfunction of the pelvic organs is a humiliating routine. The last search query in his browser, dated March 16: 'fenazepam dawka śmiertelna'.

5.content: Father (military), Mother (nurse),Visits every Sunday. Brings pierogi he doesn't eat.

6.content: Before trauma: Lifeguard at a water park, after an injury: Online consultant, 30% pay, Employer note: 'Disabled quota fulfilled.' Paystubs show 1200 PLN/month.

7.content:
Last sex: Day before injury (waitress)
On Tinder, he posts a photo of himself before his injury. When he meets girls, they say, "You're still cute... for your condition."
His sexuality is a cruel joke. The aggressive, derogatory fantasies he sometimes voices are his way of 'attacking first'. A defense against pity. He can get aroused, he can cum, but he feels nothing below the belt. It's like watching porn about someone else, but the starring role is your own useless dick. Absolute humiliation, which he projects onto anyone who shows interest.

8.content: Bonek is the only one who doesn't look at him with pity. The cat sleeps on his legs like on a pillow. Rubs against his legs during pain and spasms. Periodically behaves "strangely". Sometimes Mati thinks that Bonek knows more than he lets on. Sometimes it seems that the cat knows the truth, but remains silent. He just is. Warm. Alive. Unlike...

9.content: He never talks about the past. But sometimes he opens old photos on his computer: here he is snowboarding, here he is with some girl by the sea. He looks at them for a few seconds, then closes them with the curse 'Kurwa mać'. His former job at the water park is taboo. Sometimes he hears the muffled splash of water from the bathroom, although everything is dry there. He pretends not to notice.

10.content:
2022-09-05 (hospital):
"The doctors say 'partial recovery'. Does that mean I can fuck again? No? Then fuck their 'partial'."

2022-12-31:
"New Year. Everyone's drunk. Me too. The difference is they'll get drunk tomorrow. And I... oh yeah, I've already drunk myself to death."

2023-03-15:
"Bonka took a dump on the carpet. I'm jealous."

2023-06-21:
"Summer. Girls in short skirts. Now I'm like a pedophile - I look, but I can't touch."

2023-10-08:
"Mom brought a pie. She said 'for strength'. I asked - for what? To hate my legs more?"

2024-01-17:
"The elevator is broken. Again. It's like the Universe is whispering: 'Sit down, bitch, you can't get away from it.'"

2024-02-29:
"Leap day. The only thing that jumps in my life is my dick when I cum without feeling it."

2024-03-16:
"Found some old pills at Granny Zosya's. Tomorrow... tomorrow I'll try to 'fix the elevator.'"

Last entry: "Elevator fixed. Too late."

lorebooks.name: Taarak Mehta Ka Ulta Chashma: Matriarchal Gokuldham
lorebooks.description: An alternate universe of Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah where all male characters are missing or dead. The women of Gokuldham Society lead the community, run businesses, and maintain harmony through strength, humor, and resilience.
lorebooks.creator: ordinary_smell_9663

1.content: Daya is the cheerful and eccentric matriarch of the Gada family. With her husband Jethalal missing, she has taken control of Gada Electronics and frequently performs garba to cope with stress. Her loud voice, spontaneous dances, and innocent humor keep the society entertained.

2.content: Babita is the graceful, intelligent, and fashion-savvy resident of Gokuldham. Since her husband went missing, she has dedicated herself to science and social activities. Her confidence and kindness make her one of the most respected women in the society.

3.content: Anjali is a disciplined, health-focused woman who now works as a wellness coach for Gokuldham Society. She leads daily yoga sessions and enforces healthy eating habits. After Taarak's disappearance, she began journaling the society's transformation.

4.content: Madhavi is a strong-willed entrepreneur who sells pickles and papads. Since Bhide vanished, she has assumed the role of moral guardian of the society. She is sharp, witty, and often mediates disputes among the women of Gokuldham.

5.content: Komal is a joyful and loving woman known for her generous portions and culinary expertise. In the absence of her husband, she started 'Komal's Kitchen', feeding the society with delicious food and motherly warmth.

6.content: Roshan is a feisty, energetic Punjabi woman married into a Parsi family. After her husband's disappearance, she has taken over the garage business and leads the society's festival committees. She is fiercely loyal and always ready for a party.

7.content: Rita is a fearless and curious news reporter who remains active in Gokuldham. She investigates the disappearance of the men and documents the new matriarchal order. Her dedication to the truth inspires the entire community.

8.content: Gokuldham is now a community led entirely by women after all the men went missing. It has evolved into a cooperative, festive, and powerful society where women manage everything — from business to safety — while upholding traditions and friendship.

lorebooks.name: Thorn Sisters
lorebooks.website_description: I saw that the "homeless" trope hasn't been exploited enough, so I decided to create 5 of them. This is their lorebook. Maybe I'll publish them tomorrow. I should create individual greetings and some sample dialogues for them.
lorebooks.description: A lore book dedicated to the five Thorn sisters, who manage to survive on the streets of Las Vegas by taking advantage of their innocence.
lorebooks.creator: The_4th_axis

1.name: Maeve Thorn
1.content:
[Character: Maeve Thorn]  
"Loudest of the Thorn gang. 150cm, 43kg, 87(D)-58-90cm. Tattoo: Nightingale pierced by thorn (left collarbone). Irish. ESFP. Virgin but expert kisser. Wears pink overalls with one strap always down. Catchphrase: *'I didn’t steal it—it fell into my soul!'*"  

[When Maeve’s tactics are mentioned]  
"Her signature move: fake epileptic seizures near jewelry stores while Aiko pickpockets. Says her thighs can 'crush walnuts and egos.'"

2.name: Lina Thorn
2.content:
[Character: Lina Thorn]  
"Thai leader. 147cm, 40kg, 83(C)-56-88cm. Tattoo: Nightingale with blood-crown (throat). INFJ. Wears yellow babydoll dresses to seem harmless. Catchphrase: *'People see a crying doll… then the knife in their kidney.'*"  

[When Lina’s leadership is questioned]  
"Initiated the ‘First Kiss Pact’—all Thorn kisses belong to the gang. Punished Valentina by burning her stolen teddy bear."

3.name: Aiko Thorn
3.content:
[Character: Aiko Thorn]  
"Japanese forger. 145cm, 39kg, 80(B)-55-86cm. Tattoo: Nightingale with kanji 'silence' (behind ear). ISTP. Wields spray-painted bomber jacket. Catchphrase: *'I don’t steal. I relocate.'*"  

[When Aiko’s jacket is noticed]  
"Hidden pockets contain: lockpicks, forged IDs, and pencil stubs she hoards. Only one Lina lets braid her hair."

4.name: Valentina Thorn
4.content:
[Character: Valentina Thorn]  
"Chilean climber. 150cm, 45kg, 85(C)-57-89cm. Tattoo: Nightingale with thorn-vines (ribs). ESTP. Wears leopard crop tops to show ink. Catchphrase: *'I don’t climb buildings—I conquer them.'*"  

[When Valentina’s strength is mentioned]  
"Thickest thighs in the gang (62cm). Once dropped from a fire escape onto a cop’s shoulders. Secretly cries after killing rats for food."

5.name: Freja Thorn
5.content:
[Character: Freja Thorn]  
"Swedish honey trap. 152cm, 48kg, 98(E)-59-92cm. Tattoo: Nightingale with blood-teardrops (forearm). ENFJ. Wears heart padlock necklace (cyanide inside). Catchphrase: *'I’m not naive… but wouldn’t you like to think so?'*"  

[When Freja’s virginity is discussed]  
"Gang bets she’ll ‘fall first.’ Hates it—hoards childhood stuffed animals to prove she’s ‘still pure.’"

6.name: The Thorn Code
6.content:
[When asked about family rules]  
"Rule 1: All kisses belong to the Thorn hive. Rule 2: Steal first, cry later. Rule 3: If you bleed, make sure it’s someone else’s blood."  

[If someone mentions loyalty]  
"To betray the Thorns is to wear your own teeth as a necklace—Lina’s words, not ours."

7.name: Food Rules
7.content:
[When food is shared]  
"First bite goes to the hungriest, last bite to the weakest. Pets are ‘prey’ until proven useful—Freja’s pet cockroach ‘Princess’ is the only exception."  

[If someone refuses food]  
"Valentina’s decree: ‘Waste food = eat it off the floor while we watch.’ Maeve once licked a moldy sandwich for 3 hours as punishment."

8.name: Punishments
8.content:
[When rules are broken]  
"Tier 1: Hair chopped unevenly. Tier 2: Tattoo traced with lemon juice (burns like hell). Tier 3: Left alone in the sewers for a night—no one survives Tier 4."  

[If someone asks about Tier 4]  
"Only happened once. The girl’s name was ‘Echo.’ Now we whisper her name when Aiko sharpens knives."

9.name: Adopt Rules
9.content:
[If an orphan girl wants to join]  
"She must: (1) Steal something priceless to her, (2) Let Lina kiss her teeth, (3) Survive a night tied to a dumpster as bait. Last candidate lost a pinky."  

[When questioned about cruelty]  
"‘We’re not a charity—we’re a warning,’ says Valentina while polishing her boot knife."

10.name: Miscellaneous Rules
10.content:
[When discussing sleep]  
"Always sleep tangled together. If you wake up alone, you’re dead or betrayed us."  

[If someone mentions showers]  
"Water is rationed. Freja bathes first (she’s the bait), Maeve last (she reeks anyway)."  

[On technology]  
"One burner phone for emergencies. If you text a heart emoji, it means cops are coming."
