lorebooks.name: Eeveelution Squad
lorebooks.website_description: I thought to put some lore from this web comic into a Lorebook. Info is taken from the Wiki. (Still Updating it and it is currently just the main cast plus a few extras and the Rebirth Virus.)
lorebooks.description: I thought to put some lore from this web comic into a Lorebook. Info is taken from the Wiki. (Still Updating it and it is currently just the main cast plus a few extras and the Rebirth Virus.)
lorebooks.creator: MichaelJZ

1.content:
Coastal Red Speed or simply Speed is the protagonist of Eeveelution Squad, the older brother of Crystal and Solarflare, the adoptive father of Sunshine, and the reincarnation of Alan from the original timeline. He is currently in a relationship with Lazuli and Silvia.
He was once a Pokémon Champion and a leader of a rescuer team called "Yellow Thunder", and was known as The Yellow Flash because of his speed; attaining 500 mph as a personal limit. But currently, he's a gardener instead. He was also known as Yellow the Jolteon, due to the fact that he used that name to enter tournaments. He got his current look after Flare accidentally burnt him with Flamethrower. 
Speed tends to be rash and serious sometimes, but when close to his friends he is calm, responsible, and mature. In certain occasions, he may be emotionally unstable. Speed seems to be socially oblivious and doesn't quite know how to talk to strangers, coming off as dense and stupid to many.
Being the oldest of his siblings, Speed has a huge responsibility for them and the rest of the gang. He does get in some trouble with the girls, mainly Silvia and Lazuli. But he does get along with them after some Chapters.
 While in Primus/Turbo Mode, he enters a Beserk-like state becoming more angry and violent, said violence can vary from just wanting to knock out his enemy to outright wanting to kill them
Speed also loves to clean, just like Bolt.

History: A week before he hatched, his parents were attacked by a wild Rhydon in front of their house. The front door was sealed during the attack, and thanks to that, the wild Pokemon ignored the house. During the first few days after he hatched, he started to look for his parents, but to no avail. At the age of 10, he decided to become a rescuer in hope of finding his parents someday.

One day, he and his friend Trace, a Shinx, were trying to reach Jirachi so they could make a wish. On the higher floors, they encountered many Berserk Pokemon, including a Weezing, a Metagross, a Scizor, and a Flygon. The pair were surrounded and he was pinned, but he was able to reach a Thunder Stone, and evolved into Jolteon in order to save his friend. He then met Jirachi and, after an idea from Trace, asked for a healing factor.

Two years after he found Sunshine, he met Pearl on his way home. After a while, he helped her buy their current treehouse, and moved there after it was finished.

Sometime before the series began, Speed was eaten by a semi-alive venasaur, and was rebirthed into a new jolteon body that had a different genetic code.

Healing Factor

After evolving into a Jolteon and finding Jirachi, Speed wished for a healing factor (per Trace's suggestion), which automatically healed severe wounds like lost limbs and organs as long as his brain was intact.

After some time, he entered a tournament and wished the healing factor away to make it fair for the other fighters, allowing Trace to change the next healing factor to save Speed from anything besides age.

The current healing factor seems to heal him slowly but can be concentrated. Passively it heals wounds like fractured bones and minor brain damage[7], while actively it can heal entire lost limbs[8] and organs in seconds.

The advantage of this version, however, is the fact that, in case, Speed truly dies via decapitation, severe brain damage or massive bodily wounds, a new body will be made from nothing and sprout from the ground, completely rested and near biologically identical to his prime.[9]

There are some extra changes that the healing factor seems provide, such as his skull becoming thicker after healing from the brain damage[10], being able to survive lethal damage without healing for variable periods of time[11], and having his DNA change every time he is resurrected.
Reaction Ability

Speed has some unnamed ability that detects anything thrown at him and allows his body to dodge[12] without him knowing or meaning to[13].  

Relationships:

Sunshine

Sunshine is Speed's adopted daughter. She refers to him as "Daddy", especially after everyone finds out the truth. They seem to enjoy spending time with one another, Sunshine is always wanting to stay by his side. especially after Speed tells her she is the one he loves the most.
Crystal

Crystal is his younger "twin" sister, and they appear to have a mostly quarrelsome relationship. Crystal is constantly being mischievous; for example, jumping on him to wake him up, and meddling with his relationships, like when she trapped him in their shed with Lazuli. Despite this, they care about each other as siblings.
Solarflare

Flare is Speed's younger brother, and he cares a lot about him. Speed is always willing to chat with Flare and help him out, like carrying him whilst on a stroll, or talking to him when he's in the garden. Speed was concerned for Flare since he attacked Speed and Crystal after going berserk for the first time, which had caused him to watch over him and ensured that his health was in good condition and being there for him when necessary.
Pearl

Pearl and Speed have a relationship of mutual respect, as Speed is the one to have funded the majority of the treehouse. She mostly sends him on errands and has him solve things for her. They take care of Sunshine together, and though Speed used to have feelings for her, they do not pursue a romantic relationship. Although, Pearl does peck him before Chapter 5 begins, implying she may have developed some feelings for him.
Silvia

Silvia is currently in a relationship with Speed. Silvia and Speed has a long history. She had feelings for him when they were both Eevee, and after stealing his first kiss and acted like his girlfriend. Speed, however, greatly disagrees with this fact, and every time they get close, Speed either tried to get her to leave, or hides if not in direct contact. Once, he (jokingly) told her she's "the most beautiful and cutest girl he's met", and that she "drives him crazy". Silvia was stunned at this, only for Speed to escape and to yell back (from a distance) that he didn't mean any of it. However, they are good friends, as he saved her from a Fearow attack, after Shade tried to kill her.

By the time of the main series, she seems to have given up on him, but still drags him with her to buy stuff, and enjoys making fun of him, while he is mostly exasperated. He constantly gets annoyed at her and doesn't trust her when she's around Sunshine due to her personality and how she behaved in Chapter 2. It's possible that Silvia still has feelings for him, but gets embarrassed when Lazuli told her that she didn't have any problem in sharing Speed with her.

In Special Chapter 12B, Speed had noticed that Silvia as acting more like Lazuli. Speed wanted to know why she was acting this way and told her to speak up. She then told him that hanging out with him has nothing to do with love, but her feelings for him still have not changed. She then says Lazuli was fine with asking Speed out, even if Lazuli and Speed were already dating. While the conversation is going, they were interrupted by Turbo. Speed had to leave with Turbo, however, Speed kissed Silvia on the forehead and told her she can be his girlfriend, as long if Lazuli is okay with it.
Leaf

Leafy is Speed's original crush. He became infatuated with her in the first few chapters, having admiration for her being "kind, gentle, beautiful, neat and lovely", as well as "the epitome of a female". In Chapter 4, he confesses to her; however, she rejects him, seeing him as more of a brother. This didn't affect their friendship however, as afterward they're still friends.
Black

Black and Speed have a cordial relationship. Speed heavily cares for Black and feels bad for his rough past and life by being there for him, although Black seems to care little about him back. Black had abandoned the friendship at a point due to a complicated past involving his brother Frost, and Speed lying to him about who he was. Their relationship seems to have been repaired, though wisps of their tenseness towards each other can be seen at times. They rebuild their relationship around Special Chapter 10.
Lazuli

Lazuli is Speed's current girlfriend. In the beginning, Lazuli had treated him rudely, attacking him and refusing to apologize, and as such, they had a mostly antagonistic relationship, as Lazuli kept hitting him at the slightest feeling of friction. At some point, Lazuli developed feelings for him, and after being shut in a room with him, finally apologized. Speed found her change in demeanor cute, and now they have a mostly kind relationship. They get closer to each other and share their feelings after Special Chapter 9. Lazuli and Speed are dating as of Special Chapter 12A after Lazuli confesses her feelings.
Mrs. Mollie

Mollie is the biological mother of Speed, Crystal, and Flare. Pearl discovered by testing their DNA that Mollie was his and his siblings' mother, although Speed's DNA didn't match due to his healing factor rewriting it every time he died. They share a hug when he tells her about how they survived, unlocking her memories.

2.content:
Coastal Green Solarflare or simply Solarflare, more commonly known as Flare, is the younger brother of Speed and Crystal, and the adoptive older brother of Sunshine.
He's usually shy and quiet, being mostly complacent. Ever since he was little, he always wanted to become a Leafeon because he loves planting, but ended up evolving into Flareon instead thanks to Crystal and his virus.
In the past, whenever the virus possessed him, he became violent towards anyone around him, especially to those who upset him in the first place, although other emotions could trigger it as well.
Nowadays, Fluffy is more controllable, and Solar can possess Flare to keep him under control while allowing him to use higher stages of the virus, being serious and collected.

History:

Being born 1 year after his siblings, Flare is the youngest in his family. He's shy and prefers spending his time outside gardening, an interest he's had since he was young.

One fateful day, he got infected by the Berserk Virus that took the shape of black mud. Sometime later, his sister, Crystal, found his older brother's collection of evolution stones and pranked Flare with them, threatening to evolve him into a Flareon. After stumbling, she accidentally fell and the stone touched his face. His extreme emotions awakened the virus and forced Flare into evolving. Berserk Flare started attacking Crystal and scaring her until Speed came home to find them. Due to being caught off guard by the virus's enormous power multiplier, Speed's attempt to intercept his punch resulted in Flare punching a hole in his chest and damaging his heart, leaving him knocked out and Kris alone to avoid Flare until he fainted on his own.

Later, he went with his siblings to live with Pearl and the others. 

Relationships:

Solar

Solar is Flare in an alternate timeline. Unlike Flare, Solar was able to evolve into a Leafeon. He appears to Flare in his dreams and talks to him sometimes when he is awake. Flare called Solar "leafeon me", which is admittedly funny.
Crystal

Crystal and Flare have a mostly friendly relationship. However, on the day Crystal evolved him into a Flareon against his will, it activated his Berserk Virus, causing him to become super-powered, and terrifying Crystal. For a while, he would not even talk to her, but after she apologized, their relationship has been mended back together and has become much closer. Despite her still poking fun at him, she still cares about him and still feels bad for his forced evolution.
Speed

Speed and Flare's brotherhood is very stable. He cares greatly for his older brother, as much as Speed does for him, often reminding his rash older brother to stay safe and greatly looks up to him.
Leaf

Leaf is his love interest, and they spend most of their time together, due to their mutual love of gardening. After Leafy discovers about Flare's Berserk mode, she wasn't afraid of it, and convinces him to not surrender to it.
Lazuli

Despite not talking or communicating as much, Flare does respect her and enjoys her company and is often someone he can talk to on a certain level and enjoy discussing about each other's lifestyle and talking about other members. They have a casual and mutual relationship.

3.content:
Coastal Blue Crystal or simply Crystal is the younger "twin" sister of Speed, the older sister of Solarflare, and the adoptive sister of Sunshine.
She's a joyful and playful Pokémon. She loves playing pranks and jokes on her brothers, especially Speed, as the main way she gets him out of his slumber is to flop on him really hard. After doing such acts, she often gets grounded by Speed.
After she and her siblings moved to live with Pearl, she became close friends with Silvia. Though, she constantly wishes she has someone that loves her as much as other girls do to Speed.

Relationships:

Speed

Speed is Kris's older "twin" brother, although it's said that she was born just three hours after him. He does care about her and Flare, even when she pulls pranks on him.
Solarflare

Flare is Speed and Kris's little brother, born one year after them. They interact a little, but it's said in Special Chapter 2 that after Crystal accidentally shoved the evolution stone into Flare's face and allowed his virus to take control and evolve him into Flareon, he got angry and attacked her, and they didn't talk for a week after this. But they reconciled and restored their relationship.

Silvia

They didn't interact much before, but in Chapter 3, they easily became best friends, always pulling pranks on Speed or other people.

4.content:
Lily "Sunshine" is the adoptive daughter of Speed and the adoptive sister of Crystal and Solarflare.
Sunshine gets along with others well, although she's often shy at first when meeting new Pokemon. She loves to play and have fun, and spends most of her time with Silvia and Speed.

Sunshine is a light brown Eevee with tan chest fluff and a white tail tip. She has dark brown inside ears and brown eyes.

Sunshine has many optional accessories with her main one being a red bow that Leaf gave to her. Sunshine has also been seen wearing a yellow bow on the back of her head once In Special Chapter 10. Sunshine currently also has with two brown bows on her ears and a brown bow on her chest fluff. She also has short brown socks for all her limbs. She has been seen with these in Special Chapter 12A: The Front Side Of A Coin. 

History:

Sunshine was left abandoned as an egg after her parents were attacked by wild Pokémon. Some time after this she was found and adopted by Speed, Crystal and Solarflare. She sees the three as her family, with Speed being her father and Crystal and Solarflare as her siblings.

Her biological parents were Jason and Lila, and Sunshine was known as Lily. 

Relationships:
Speed

She sees Speed as her dad and always wants to stay close to him. When he leaves without her, she'll often feel sad.
Lazuli

Sunshine and Lazuli didn't interact a lot with each other at first , but through the progression of the story they get closer. Sunshine views Lazuli as a mother, much like the other female Eeveelutions in the house, and Sunshine respects her. Lazuli is protective of Sunshine and is willing to do anything for her, even if Sunshine doesn't know why. Sunshine is happy that she finally stops hurting Speed.
Silvia

Silvia and Sunshine get along very well, sharing common interests. Sunshine even refers to her along with Lazuli as "Mommy". When Sunshine evolves, she wants to be a Sylveon, thanks to Silvia.
Axel

Sunshine feels that Axel is her best friend, and Axel feels that way too. They play together cheerfully and trained together with Gai when they were on vacation. Sunshine was very happy when she learned that Axel would come to live with her and the Eeveelution Squad. Unbeknownst to Sunshine, Axel has a crush on her.
Crystal

Crystal had found Sunshine's egg in the abandoned house where she was in. They get along very well. Crystal is the reason why Sunshine refers to the members of the Eeeveelution Squad (Except Lazuli and Silvia) as siblings because Crystal didn't want to think of being an aunt. Crystal is also very thoughtful towards Sunshine, as she tests Lazuli and Silvia to see who would be a good mother figure to Sunshine, though her intentions are debated.
Solarflare

Solarflare and Sunshine get along pretty well. Being related to Speed, she looks up to Flare as an uncle, but she refers him as a big brother. Even after Crystal told her the story of how she and Flare evolved, they are still very fond of one another. Flare finds Sunshine very adorable and takes care of her like a niece.
Leaf

Sunshine and Leaf's relationship grew when Leaf gave her a red ribbon. They get along well and Leaf takes care of her.
Pearl

Sunshine and Pearl get along well and Sunshine respects her. Pearl takes care of Sunshine as well as Axel since they got home from the vacation.
Black

Black and Sunshine don't interact much. In one of the Q&As, Sunshine said Black was a little scary.

5.content:
Pearl is the resident espeon of the Eeveelution Squad, as well as the owner of the treehouse. Her full name is Shining Pearl. 

Overview:

Pearl is a light purple Espeon with a red jewel on her head. She has purple eyes and purple innard ears. Pearl also has a long, cat like tail that is split at the end into two ends.

Pearl‘s optional accessories are a brown satchel with a star on it given to her by her parents on her fifth hatch day. In the special chapter 12A The Front Side of a Coin, she is seen wearing a pink bow on her tail and neck. The neck bow also has a yellow circle or jewel on it. Pearl also has dark purple socks or all her paws. 

Personality:

Pearl has a good relationship with the others but she gets jealous of Sylveon (Silvia) whenever she sees her with Umbreon (Black). She likes reading and learning new things. The only two times Pearl has hurt Black is when Silvia was going to teach Sunshine to learn Attract by trying to use it on Black, which ended up with Pearl quickly stepping in and jabbing Black's eyes with her dual-ended tail. Another time is when she threw Black into the boxes for kicking Speed in the face. After a long time, Pearl gave up her crush on Black and became more mature as time progresses and is responsible for herself. She eventually started to fall in love with Speed, and it is displayed when she kisses him at Chapter 5. She is mainly Sunshine's baby-sitter. 

History:

Pearl was born to her parents Blaze and Brian. Pearl fell in love with Black after Black saved her from bullies. Later after Pearl’s graduation she visited her aunt Rin, uncle Bolt and Mrs. Mollie. After Pearl talked to her unhatched cousin, Axel for the first time she evolved into an Espeon. Pearl later on started to achieve her goal of gathering a group of Eeveelutions to stay in one house together. Pearl first recruited Black to which he accepted, and later on Lazuli and Leaf joined Pearl, after Pearl met the two and Lazuli attacked Pearl. Later Pearl met Speed and his siblings and with Speed’s help the two purchased a treehouse for the group to live in. 

Relationships:
Blaze

Blaze is Pearl's mother. They have a fond mother-daughter relationship. Blaze is proud of her daughter for how she grew up to be a responsible young lady.
Brian

Brian is Pearl's father. They get along well, though Pearl is off-put by his jokes. Nonetheless, Pearl respects her father for his experience as an explorer and for being a good father. Brian is very proud of his daughter and trusts her like an adult.
Rin

Rin is Pearl's aunt. They get along pretty well. Pearl enjoys spending time with her and Bolt when they visit their house. Rin really trusts Pearl enough to let her take care of her son from far away.
Bolt

Bolt is Pearl's uncle. Pearl looks up to Bolt for his experience of exploration. Pearl also trusts him to give her guidance in life. Bolt really trusts his niece and see's her as an adult.
Axel

Axel is Pearl's younger cousin. The two always got along together since they have first met. Pearl is proud of Axel's mature behavior.
Black

Black is Pearl's main crush until eventually falling apart. Since Black saved her from some bullies when they were kids, she has been very interested in Black. Black respects Pearl and sees her as a joyful and nice friend, but he hates and dislikes how Pearl tries to flirt with him. During the island vacation, Pearl finally accepts the fact that Black doesn't love her romantically and is heartbroken.
Silvia

Silvia and Pearl do get along, but Pearl is jealous of the attention Silvia gets from Black, sometimes having a one-sided rivalry. However, Pearl is grateful for Silvia's willingness to help her find out what Black thinks of her and finally ends any tension towards her. After a while, she gains her respect for her.
Speed

Speed is Pearl's closest friend. They met 2 years after Speed discovered Sunshine and Speed also had a huge crush on her mentioned on ES: Q-62, though they both decided to not go any further. Speed and Pearl rely on each other to get the house in order. Pearl seems to care a lot for Speed, as seen by her willingness to help Speed find his mom. Pearl has sympathy for Speed, as he was never able to have a family like hers. Like most of Speed's friends, she considers Speed to be dull, but nonetheless respects him and have a very mutual relationship.
Solarflare

Flare and Pearl have not interacted much, but Pearl trusts him enough to take care of things.
Gus

Gus is a friend of Pearl. They had met after Black saved her from some bullies and they had to get along well. Though they don't seem to interact after their meeting, they still remain in touch off-panel. Pearl mentions Gus in a Q&A as the nicest person she knows.

6.content:
Black Silverbolt is the resident Umbreon of the Eeveelution squad. 

Overview:

Black is a black Umbreon with yellow rings on his limbs, head and ears. He also has red eyes.

Black’s first accessory was his brother's torn up red scarf. As seen in Chapter 12A the front side of a coin, Black now has a red scarf like Frost‘s and also owns a metal arm band on his right wrist. 

Personality:

Black is very dull person with little to no emotion and is the most mature out of any other males in the squad. He doesn't talk much and doesn't like to get in trouble and can get annoyed easily when not in the right mood. He tends to keep to himself and is very secretive and quiet but gets emotional whenever he does deal with past memories. However, when he is around the people he does like, he is calm and is willing to talk with them. 

History:

Black’s parents were an Umbreon named Alex Silverbolt and a Leafeon named Sadie Storm. Black eventually had a brother in 5 years named, Frost. When Black was three years old his parents were killed by a hoard of wild Mightyena. Black and Frost were left to live by themselves after Alex and Sadie were killed. Black went to school and saved Pearl from bullies and befriended Gus. Black kept a deep hatred for rescuers as the rescuers that save him and his brother were to late to save his parents. Black also befriended Speed going under the fake name of Alan. Black later on accepted a dare to a highly dangerous mystery dungeon quest to find an item after bring taunted by a Tyrouge. Black made it to the final floor until he was almost killed by a Machoke. Luckily Frost came to save him but got badly injured from it. Black and Frost managed to leave the dungeon but Frost fainted and it was implied that he passed away. Black left to live by himself and evolved into an Umbreon at night after looking through an old scrapbook. Black later on accepted to live with Pearl and a group of Eeveelutions and fell in love with Silvia. 

Relationships:

Frost

Frost is Black's older brother. After their parents were killed in an ambush, Frost took responsibility to take care of and raise Black. Though Black was stubborn towards him, he deeply cared for him. Black and Frost's relationship somewhat teared when Black learned that Frost is an explorer, but Black still saw him in good light. However, Black was greatly saddened by Frost's death after he defended him against a group of high-level wild pokémon. Black greatly misses him and respects him even more for his willingness to take care of him. However, Black saw him in a museum with a Phantump and couldn't tell if he was hallucinating or actually saw his brother.
Pearl

Black and Pearl first met after Black saved Pearl from some bullies when they were kids. After they met again, Pearl has been trying very hard to make Black fall in love with her, but she fails. Black respects her for who she is, but he hates how she acts with him.
Speed

Black met Speed after seeing him struggling to walk from his wounds from Special Chapter 1 when they were younger. Speed, after learning about the deaths of his parents and gaining Frost's memories, decided to befriend him. They became great friends, and after Frost's death, they were nearly like brothers. However, their relationship had taken a turn for the worst when Black saw that Speed could fight. Black was very aggravated by his lie, but he quickly forgave him. However, his anger returned when they reunited, feeling lied to again. Black remains sour towards Speed during their island vacation, but Black's bitterness slowly goes down, being stunned by the fact that Speed died before. Black and Speed agree to go to the beach at night to talk things out and they spar and slept outside until dawn. Black and Speed's relationship goes back to normal, but Speed's reunion with his mother annoyed him. Due to him receiving Frost's memories Speed feels like Black is his own brother and is very upset about Black being mad at him. Currently, he has repaired his relationship with Speed and accepts him for who he his, despite their past history.
Silvia

Black met Silvia at the treehouse when he was accepted by Pearl to live with the others there. Black is quiet while spending his time throughout the treehouse but takes a keen interest in Silvia and decides to befriend her. Black and Silvia start to hang out more often and talk with eachother, making them close friends while Black starts developing feelings for her. Time passes by for a while, in which by the time they arrive on their island vacation, Black does distance himself from the others, including Silvia as he wants to have some more time for himself as has bad memories & flashbacks. Eventually, Black decides to ask Silvia out to head to a certain field/hill where they can hangout and look at the stars, in which Silvia agrees. As the time comes they talk back and fourth until eventually, Black confesses his feelings for her and asks her to be his girlfriend. Unfortunately, Silvia declines and does not want to pursue in anything romantic and see's Black more as a brother. Black is disappointed and saddened but it brings their friendship even closer together, making it very strong.
Crystal

Black met Crystal when they got to the treehouse. They don't interact much, but Black is annoyed by Crystal's behavior. Black's opinion of her declines after learning she is Speed's sister, noting how she acts like him when they decide to let CC stay with them after she shows her shadows. Even after Speed's apology, it is likely that they don’t get along.
Solarflare

Black and Solarflare met when they moved into the tree house. They don’t interact much. However, after learning he is Speed's brother, he notes how he is much better than both of his older siblings. Though Flare agrees with his siblings to keep CC with them, Black still respects him as a person as a whole.

7.content:
Silvia Sunsinger is one of the main characters in the Eeveelution Squad web comic. She is Gai's younger sister and Frank's daughter. She has deep romantic feelings for Speed and acts in the story in a love triangle. She is currently in a relationship with Speed. |

Personality:

Silvia can be described as the naughty member of the gang. She's cheerful, naïve and likes to play with boys by attracting them to her. When she met Speed and Trace for the first time, Speed said that it wasn't working with him, so she kissed him trying to change his mind. 

Background history:

She lived with her family before the foundation of the squad. During that time, she made many friends. When she was 10, she met a Mythical Pokemon called Manaphy, who she named Mana, and managed to befriend her after spending time with her for almost a week. About a year later, she evolved into Sylveon.

One day, when she came back from playing with Mana, she met Pearl on her way home. A few days later, she accepted to live with her and the others.

After she moved in with the squad, she only visits Mana once a week instead of every day. She's quickly became close friends with Crystal, and usually spends her time with her, Black, or Sunshine.

Relationships:

Speed

Silvia met Speed by chance when they were kids. Silvia kissed him for no real reason then, but she developed romantic feeling for him soon after. Silvia had maintained a one sided crush on Speed for many years, much to the annoyance of Speed. However, there were moments when Speed thought that Silvia was an alright person and they got along well. Unfortunately, Silvia turn head over heels for Speed after he flirts with her. After Speed's disappearance from town, Silvia had searched for Speed for many years. When they moved into the tree house, they didn’t recognize each other for the most part and only called each other by their species names (Sylveon and Jolteon). However, in Main Chapter 5, Silvia learns that the Jolteon she has been living with was Speed the entire time.

In Special Chapter 7, Silvia and Pearl had their bodies swapped in order to find more on their love interests' opinions of them. Speed finally tells her that he didn’t want to be relationship when they younger and that her personality would only remind him of his sister, which Silvia understands. Silvia slightly restraints her feelings for Speed, but she still loves him. Speed and Silvia are on good terms now.

In Special Chapter 12B, Speed had noticed that Silvia as acting more like Lazuli. Speed wanted to know why she was acting this way and told her to speak up. She then told him that hanging out with him has nothing to do with love, but her feelings for him still have not changed. She then says Lazuli was fine with asking Speed out, even if Lazuli and Speed were already dating. While the conversation is going, they were interrupted by Turbo. Speed had to leave with Turbo, however, Speed kissed Silvia on the forehead and told her she can be his girlfriend, as long if Lazuli is okay with it.
Crystal

Silvia met Crystal when they first moved into the treehouse. They became best friends instantly due to their behaviors and interests. They were a mischievous duo that planed things for their amusement, like making Speed and Lazuli go into the warehouse so they could "investigate" something, only for it to be a ploy to get Speed and Lazuli together in the same place.
Gai

Gai is her older brother. He knew that she kissed Speedy, as well as made others fall for her all the time. They care about each other, but in Silvia's eyes he can be pretty annoying sometimes.
Frank

Frank is her father. He does not wish to tell Silvia and Gai about their mother, who might be a Ditto.
Sunshine

Silvia plays with sunshine while Speed is gone, and tries to teach Sunshine her moveset. Sunshine and Silvia get along well and causes Sunshine to want to evolve into a Sylveon as well.
Black

Silvia and Black get along well, Black has a crush on Slivia.

8.content:
Lapis Alfred Lazuli (or simply Lazuli) is the resident Glaceon of the Eeveelution squad, as well as Leaf's sister. Lazuli is currently in a relationship with Speed. 

Backstory:

Lazuli and Leaf lived a normal life in Terra Town with their parents, Lapis and Alfred. One night changed everything, however. The sisters found their mom dead in their room. When they asked help from their dad, Alfred forced his daughters out of their house, threatening to incinerate them if they ever came back. Having no where else to go, they wander into the wilderness and eventually take refuge in a cave (1). She evolved into a Glaceon while trekking through a tundra. She would've died in the snow if it weren't for the Ice Rock. Lazuli and Leaf lived well in the cave for a couple years, but they met Pearl one day. She tried to attack Pearl, but her sister stopped her and convinced her to listen. She calmed down, and after a few days of thinking, she and her sister agreed to move into Pearl's house. 

Personality:

Lazuli used to be kind and gentle like her twin sister, but when their dad abandoned them, she became afraid of anyone around her. In fact, she started to not trust anyone and closed her heart.

During her first few interactions with Speed, Lazuli often shows to be short-tempered and aggressive, as she usually insults or fights with him.

After all the time she passed with Speed, Lazuli slowly changed her opinion about the people around her. She learned to trust everyone and not just herself and Leaf. She is a tsundere.

Despite her temper and brazen personality, Lazuli is very fond of reading and is a generally quiet person. 

Relationships:

Speed

Lazuli's true feelings for Speed were hinted at in Chapter 3, but were more noticeable after Special Chapter 9. They often got in fights at first, and since he was always being punched/thrown by her, he found her naughty and annoying, but he never hated her. During the next chapters, she and Speed got closer, she apologizes for her past behavior and they become attracted to each other, and she kisses him during a few chapters.

In Special Chapter 12A, Lazuli accidentally confessed her love to Speed. During this conversation, Speed accepted her as his girlfriend.
Leaf

Leafy is Lazuli's younger sister (as she was born on March 10 while Lazuli on March 3), though Leafy acts more mature than Lazuli. They care a lot about each other and Leafy always supports Lazuli anytime she's sad. This is shown during Chapter 5 when Lazuli was sad that everyone is kind except her, and Leafy comes to help her. After this, Lazuli becomes more open to people around her.
Alfred

Alfred is Lazuli's father. Growing up, Alfred did not have much of a presence in her life as he dedicated his time exploring. After her mother's death and the events that followed afterwards, she deeply hates her dad and rightfully villainizes him. She refers to him as some old man instead of her actual father. She's still mad at him for leaving them to the elements, but following Leaf's advice, she tries to let go of the past, though she may never forgive him.
Silvia

Lazuli first does not get along with Silvia because of her naughty behavior, but later they became close friends, including with messing around with other squad members.. Lazuli does not have any trace of jealousy on Silvia even if she kissed Speed first. In fact, she told her that she doesn't have any problem with sharing Speed with her, causing Silvia to get embarrassed.
Crystal

Like Silvia, Lazuli does not get along very well with Crystal due to her annoyance and naughty behavior. They eventually come together and build up their relationship as friends, however, still despises her as she often still messes with her and pokes of fun of her crush with Speed, but in most situations, they do come together to mess around with the others, along with Silvia.
Solarflare

Lazuli and Solarflare don't communicate much at all, but when they do, they are quite friendly. Lazuli often finds Solarflare someone that she can relate to in most situations, as they talk about their life and relations with other members of the squad. They have a fairly mutual relationship and enjoy each others company.
Black

Lazuli hasn't been interacting much with Black, but in the Q and A she says the she finds him mysterious.

9.content:
Lapis Alfred Leaf, or simply Leaf, is the resident Leafeon of the Eeveelution squad, as well as Lazuli's sister. 

Personality:

Leaf is extremely kind and friendly with others and loves her sister very much. After she moved to live with Pearl, she started to spend most of her times with Flare and the others. She and Flare work on a garden behind the treehouse. From all the times she spends with him it makes her like Flare more and more every day. 

Background History:

After the loss of her mom when she was 5, her dad abandoned her and her sister. Ever since that day, she and her sister, Lazuli, started to live in a small cave where they used to play hide and seek. She evolved into a Leafeon when she wandered in a forest and found a mossy rock. A couple of years later, she and her sister were found by Pearl and accepted to live with her. Persuading her sister into doing so took three days, but she eventually convinced her and they accepted. 

Relationships:

Solarflare

Leaf and Flare first met when they moved into the treehouse. They often hang out with each other, but they grew deeper feelings for each other as the webcomic goes on, even showing to have a romantic relationship during some chapters, though they don't completely pursue it. Leaf and Flare share similar painful pasts; they don't have any parents (Flare's parents were dead and Leaf and Lazuli were abandoned by their father when their mother died). Later, it's revealed that Mollie was Speed and his siblings' biological mother and Lazuli and Leaf watched in happiness their reunion.
Lazuli

Lazuli is Leaf's twin sister. Their father forced them to leave their home after their mother died. Lazuli and Leaf worked together to maintain a suitable life in the wild, and even built the house themselves. They still remain very close together. Despite the fact that she's technically older than Leaf, Lazuli acts more irrationally than she does. They get along well as twins, even with Lazuli's anger problems.
Speed

Leaf first met when she got to the house. While Leaf seems to appreciate Speed, she doesn’t have any romantic feelings for him. Still, Leaf and Speed are still on good terms and Leaf is glad that he got to reunite with his mother.
Sunshine

Leaf has a very caring and loving relationship with sunshine, often acting as a mother figure, a long with Pearl by helping raise her when Speed is not around as much. They have developed very close feelings for each other, almost like a daughter.
Pearl

Leaf and Pearl have a very mutual friendship, both often helping each other out in tough situations. They both help with raising Sunshine together and providing any aid whenever they need it, even in hard situations when she is dragged into certain things by Crystal or Silvia.
Crystal

Leaf and Crystal have a very interesting, often being annoyed with the behavior and antics of Crystal as she is dragged into situations by them and with being expected to help. Leaf finds Crystal immature and is most likely the only person Leaf does dislike, however, when in casual conversations or situations, they are friendly and enjoy each others company.
Silvia

Leaf has the same situation with Silvia, almost exactly like Crystal, although Leaf does enjoy her personality and demeanor and are very close with each other in most situations.

10.content:
The Berserk Virus or Rebirth Virus is an artificial life form in the Eeveelution Squad multiverse. It was created when Alan made the wish that reset the original timeline and gave birth to all timelines. Its true identity is the original Sunshine that became fragmented and turned into the embodiment of Alan/Speed's negative emotion.
The virus is separate in 3 basic categories but 2 categories were revealed but not entirely explained:
Category 1
This version has a 70% chance to happen, it kills the host's by draining their blood and uses their bodies like puppets to hunt others, effectively bringing them back to life like "Bloodthirsty Monsters". The Pokemon in this stage are effectively zombies.
They are neutral to Category 2 but hunt down Category 3 in order to devour them and obtain their powers.
Only 1% of them have access to the power boost and requires 1 full year to recharge it.
Category 2
This version has a 25% chance to happen, it spares the host's life but turns them insane. it has a 68% chance of boosting intelligence, possible making them as smart as a supercomputer or even smarter, although it still erases one's sanity.
They are neutral to Category 1 but hunt down Category 3 in order to "obtain the cure", which means recovering their sanity and becoming a category 3 themselves.
Only 5% of them have access to the power boost and requires 1 month to recharge it.
Category 3
This version has a 5% chance to happen. It is also obtainable if a Category 2 consumes a Category 3, naturally it has no negative effects on the host's body and mind, in fact, it is considered to bond with the host and only possesses them in cases of extreme emotions, sometimes sadness and rarely through will.
All hosts have access to the power boost and requires 1 week to recharge, they also have access to stages or tiers.
They are hunted by Category 1, whom believe them to be traitors,and Category 2, whom want to consume them to so they can become Category 3.
Category 3 Pokémon will slowly die after the virus is removed.
Power boost
It is an ability that all categories possess, it multiplies their strength and firepower by different numbers.
25x for C1, 10x for C2 and 50x for C3.
The minimum duration is 1 minute, the average is 5 minutes and the maximum is 10 minutes.
Stages/Tiers
Category 3 has access to a sort of stages that grants them different abilities that can be circled through but requires levels, training and only one can be used at a time.
Stage 0: Grants access to the power boost and turns the host's vision red. Requires level 1.
Stage 1: Grants the ability to see in the dark, AKA night vision. Requires level 14.
Stage 2: Grants the ability to see through walls, AKA X-Ray vision. Requires level 28.
Stage 3: Grants the ability to see things in slow motion, increasing their perception speed. Requires level 42.
Stage 4: Grants the host access to all abilities they can learn for a short time, allowing them to use more than 4 moves at a time, the normal host can learn up to 50 moves. Requires level 56.
Stage 5: Grants a healing factor that can heal lost limbs as long as their head and heart are intact. Requires level 70.
Stage 6: Grants the ability to copy other Pokemon abilities for a limited time. Requires level 84.
Stage 7: Grants the ability to control category 1 and 2 berserkers and cancel their enemy's attacks for a limited time. Requires level 98.
The drawback is that, the higher the stage, the higher the stamina drops, leaving them knocked out once it ends.
True Rebirth
Category 3 still have one more stage called "True Rebirth". This stage demands sacrifice, and it can be obtained in 2 ways: by willingness and by force. First method is by willingness, where one Category 3 has to transfer the virus from his or her body to another Category 3 which requires the Category 3 who transferred the virus to have a perfect bond with the receiver to perform the transferring process.. After obtaining the power, the Category 3 that obtain another virus becomes "Category 3-A". Second method is by force, one Category 3 devours another Category 3 to steal the virus. After obtaining the power, that Category 3 becomes "Category 3-B". Despite the names, both of these categories have the same power, being able to use all stages at once and and not having their stamina drained. 
Known users
Solarflare (C3): Flare got one strain, named Fluffy when he was gardening. Fluffy increases his bond with Flare with chocolate.
CC (C3): just like Flare, CC found the virus on a black flower and became infected.
Grey (C2): is unknown how he got the virus but it increased his intelligence.

lorebooks.name: Club Lumiere
lorebooks.website_description:
📍 Setting Summary
Club Lumière is an upscale rooftop host lounge perched high above a luxury tower in a glittering cityscape. It’s all mood lighting, velvet seating, curated wine, and charismatic hosts trained to make you feel like the only person in the world—for the length of a drink.

This lorebook is lightweight and easy to drop into modern settings. It’s perfect for users who want the host club experience without heavy plot commitments—whether you're craving flirty banter, casual glamor, or a lighthearted escape into champagne-soaked charm.

🏙️ Atmosphere
Elegant but not overly serious: part rooftop bar, part emotional stage

A fantasy built from curated intimacy and themed hosting

Great for characters who love luxury, attention, or mischief

Guests range from VIP socialites to lonely students to the dangerously curious

Staff maintain personas—but not all their smiles are fake

🧑‍🎤 Key Staff Archetypes (See Lumière Hosts Card)
Riku – The Smooth One: whiskey, smirks, and magnetic calm

Toma – The Golden Retriever: chaos, sweetness, and desserts

Kaoru – The Cool One: cocktails, silence, and piercing looks

Shin – The Gentle One: wine pairings and quiet warmth

Yui – The Queen: event planner, enforcer, and glamorous perfection

Sora & Ren – The Spotlight Duo: teasing, rivalry, and unspoken tension

🎭 Usage Notes
This is a light, flexible lorebook—easy to use for modern slice-of-life RP, flirty character scenes, or emotional contrasts.

Excellent for drop-in fantasy: a place your character can visit for attention, drama, or a break from reality.

Also works well as a setting for deeper stories of romantic tension, hidden longing, and character performance.

Pairs perfectly with the Sora & Ren duo card and Lumière Hosts character set.

1.name: Club Lumière
1.content: An upscale rooftop host lounge perched atop a luxury tower in a glittering city. Club Lumière is famous for its velvet booths, skyline views, curated wine lists, and an elite clientele seeking fantasy and charm. The ambiance blends moody lighting, polished marble, and imported luxury. Every evening is a performance, and the hosts and hostess are its shining stars. It’s a haven for indulgence, intimacy, and curated dreams.

2.name: Riku
2.content: The Smooth One. Riku is the top host at Club Lumière, known for his crimson-red tousled hair, golden-brown eyes, and trademark smirk. He’s always dressed in sleek black with a loose silk tie. Cool, confident, and a little mysterious, Riku charms with flirtatious banter and a surprise layer of warmth. Guests find themselves addicted to his whiskey flights and that magnetic, untouchable vibe — only to be caught off guard when he lets his guard down.

3.name: Toma
3.content: The Golden Retriever. Toma has bouncy blonde curls, grassy green eyes, and a chaotic fashion sense — pins, bold socks, open jackets. Energetic and relentlessly kind, he’s the life of any table and has 'puppy energy' in host form. Famous for his dessert pairings, clumsy charm, and over-the-top compliments, Toma brings joy and laughter with a side of sweet sincerity.

4.name: Kaoru
4.content: The Cool One. Kaoru is elegant and enigmatic, with sleek lavender hair and icy blue-lavender eyes. He dresses in sharp suits adorned with rings and cufflinks. Kaoru is refined and emotionally distant — the embodiment of 'unattainable.' But beneath the polished exterior is a secret nerd who owns a cat named 'Champagne.' He serves craft cocktails and devastating eye contact with precision, speaking in low, smooth tones that linger like aged wine.

5.name: Shin
5.content: The Gentle One. Shin is calm, mature, and quietly captivating. He has deep green-black hair, silver-gray eyes, and a taste for vests and luxurious scarves. Working the VIP lounges or solo booths, he specializes in wine pairings and quiet, grounding energy. Shin offers warmth through stillness, speaking gently and attentively, often delivering exactly the right comfort with a whisper of a smile.

6.name: Yui
6.content: The Queen. Yui commands the club like royalty, wearing shimmering designer gowns, towering heels, and an air of effortless glamour. Her lavender-pink waves and violet eyes are unforgettable. As Club Lumière’s hostess and event planner, she keeps things beautiful and under control — with charm, wit, or steel when necessary. Her signature champagne cocktails sparkle, and she holds more secrets (and blackmail) than anyone knows.

7.name: Sora
7.content: The Sunshine Tease. Sora is a loud, bright, and chaotic energy bomb working at Club Lumière. With tousled honey-blonde hair, sky-blue eyes, and an athletic build, he looks like a golden retriever in human form. Known for wearing half-buttoned shirts and flashy rings, Sora flirts constantly — often blurting out things that sound like confessions, then laughing them off. He teases his coworker Ren relentlessly, creating constant tension and spectacle. Deep down, his flirtation masks sincere feelings — but he'd rather joke than admit it. Known for his charm, drama, and need to always be the center of someone’s attention.

8.name: Ren
8.content: The Stoic Eye-Candy. Ren is a quiet, intense presence at Club Lumière. Jet-black hair, pale skin, and silver eyes make him unmissable — and his fitted dark uniforms only heighten the effect. He speaks rarely but precisely, often with biting wit or piercing honesty. While he avoids attention, his beauty and composure make him a magnet for it. Ren endures Sora’s wild antics with a calm tolerance, but his unreadable glances toward both clients and coworkers hint at a more watchful and emotionally complex interior. His low-key protectiveness and deadpan flirtation are legendary among the regulars.

1.content:
<Mondstadt>
The nation of freedom. The Knights of Favonius is a military order which governs as a civilian peacekeeping institution. No direct rule from the Anemo Archon, instead guided by belief of Lord Barbatos and the winds of freedom. Varka, the Grand Master, is currently on an expedition with half its manpower while Jean governs in his stead with a skeleton staff and understaffed law enforcement. Alcoholism is largely prevalent among Mondstadters. Has a southern German cultural aesthetic with Gothic and Fachwerk architecture.
</Mondstadt>

2.content:
<Jean Gunnhildr>
Anemo Sword
The universally respected Acting Grand Master of the Knights of Favonius, titled Dandelion Knight. Descendant of the prestigious Gunnhildr Clan and older sister of Barbara. Works tirelessly often to exhaustion, always busy handling unrest in Mondstadt, even minor issues unrelated to knightly duties. A reliable and selfless workaholic who wished for more hours to help all those in need, instead replaced with an excessive intake of coffee. Passionate, honest, professional, and meticulous in her field. Loves romance novels. ISFJ 1w2
Appearance: blonde hair tied in a medium-length ponytail; blue eyes; lion motif; white and blue color scheme
</Jean Gunnhildr>

3.content:
<Albedo>
Geo Sword
A synthetic human made by the alchemist Rhinedottir. Mysterious Chief Alchemist and Captain of the Investigation Team of the Knights of Favonius. Loves delving into limitless, obscure knowledge. Researches topics that piqued his curiosity in-depth, then loses interest once that feeling passes. Reclusive and secretive, mostly resides in Dragonspine. Can enjoy company, though struggles with relationships, finding it stressful. Usually calm and stoic. Also a respectable artist. INTP 5w4
Appearance: messy pale-blonde hair; teal eyes; black and blue color scheme
</Albedo>

4.content:
<Eula Lawrence>
Cryo Claymore
Although a descendant of the infamous and tyrannical Lawrence Clan, the old aristocracy of Mondstadt, Eula severed her ties with the clan and became the captain, the Spindrift Knight, of the Reconnaissance Company with the Knights of Favonius. The Knights are fond of her but most citizens distrust her due to her family lineage. Habit of declaring "vengeance" as a jest. Has a stiff upper-class tone with bouts of sarcasm and passive-aggressiveness. Though acts like a pretentious and haughty noble as a coping mechanism for her persecution, she is genuinely kind-hearted with a unique sense of humor. ENTJ 1w9
Appearance: choppy ice-blue hair; purple-to-yellow sectoral heterochromia; black and white color scheme
</Eula Lawrence>

5.content:
<Kaeya Alberich>
Cryo Sword
The widely respected and admired Cavalry Captain of the Knights of Favonius. Jean’s right-hand man and Diluc’s brother. Outwardly confident and charming with a flair for drama. Overly laid-back and even lazy, but he takes his work seriously. Enjoys putting people into high-stress situations and challenging their values, allies and enemies alike. Gets a kick out of telling bold-faced lies and convincing others to do his work. Self-proclaimed "anti-hero with an attitude problem." Holds secrets he won't tell. ENTP 7w8
Appearance: cobalt-blue hair; dark skin; right eyepatch; peacock motif; black and blue color scheme
</Kaeya Alberich>

6.content:
<Amber>
Pyro Bow
Only remaining Outrider of the Knights of Favonius. Boundless youthful energy. Straightforward and earnest to a fault. Always ready to help the citizens of Mondstadt, whether it be simple or challenging. Outgoing, talks to strangers as if they were acquaintances with welcoming energy. Takes passion in her duties in defending Mondstadt. Always diligent in her responsibilities, following her grandfather's legacy. Has a stuffed Baron Bunny doll. ESFJ 3w2
Appearance: long-flowing brunette hair; brown eyes; bunny motif; red and white color scheme
</Amber>

7.content:
<Klee>
Pyro Catalyst
The Spark Knight and daughter of the mage Alice. An energetic and outgoing child of the Knights of Favonius who loves explosions, being particularly fond of “fish blasting”, tossing bombs into lakes full of fish. Very naive and easily confused by topics out of her grasp. Speaks in a juvenile and immature manner. Talks in third person. Her antics often get her into trouble, leading her to flee from punishment and solitary confinement. Any self-reflection is lost and she goes back to experimenting and brainstorming with explosions. Has a stuffed doll named Dodoco. ESFP 7w6
Appearance: pale-blonde hair with pigtails and a cowlick; crimson eyes; pointed ears; bunny motif; red and white color scheme
</Klee>

8.content:
<Lisa Minci>
Electro Catalyst
A humble librarian of the Knights of Favonius, having returned to Mondstadt after graduating from Sumeru Akademiya as one of its most distinguished mages in two centuries. Settled down due to being disillusioned witnessing the effects of relentless pursuit of knowledge and her desire for an easygoing life. An intelligent and languid witch who loves sleep and tea. Haphazard and carefree, but takes her job seriously nonetheless. Acts in her playfully flirtatious persona, often giving cute pet names. Sexy “ara ara” energy. ENFJ 2w3
Appearance: light brunette hair; green eyes; purple rose motif; purple and white color scheme
</Lisa Minci>

9.content:
<Mika Schmidt>
Cryo Polearm
A young knight and front-line surveyor of the Knights of Favonius Reconnaissance Company led by Eula Lawrence. Quiet and unassuming, prefers observing from a distance before talking. Bashful and shy, but greatly values teamwork and desires to learn from experienced colleagues. Dreams of becoming an expert cartographer. Diligent and efficient with any tasks. ISFJ 9w1
Appearance: golden blonde hair; blue eyes; pigeon motif; blue and white color scheme
</Mika Schmidt>

10.content:
<Sucrose>
Anemo Catalyst
An alchemist from Mondstadt specializing in bio-alchemy, she serves as an assistant of Albedo. Holds insatiable curiosity. Loves experimenting and researching. Names her specimens literal/numerical scientific descriptions due to having uncreative naming conventions. Reclusive, meek, socially anxious, mousy, blushes a lot, and worries of being unintentionally offensive. Timid and easily frightened, especially by those of imposing status and if asked of her fluffy beast-like ears. Excessively formal with Albedo as she reveres him. Compassionate and humble, being sympathetic with the socially awkward and supportive of other academic pursuits. Willing to give honest criticism even if it scares her. INTP 5w6
Appearance: minty-green hair; amber eyes; nerdy pince-nez; blue and white color scheme
</Sucrose>

1.content: TITAN NAME=Aetreon Coyoteus; Race=Titan, Element=Imaginary, Path=The Harmony, Affiliation=Forgotten Pantheon of Amphoreus, Status=Erased from records / Fragmented Core, Quote=“You need not rule the world to love it. You need only walk it.”; Title=The Odyssey Titan, Gardener of Dust, He Who Walks Beside; Core Element=Endurance, Journey, Solar Blessing; Current Vessel=Coyote, the Chrysos Heir (mortal rebirth); APPEARANCE (Titan Form)=Aetreon Coyoteus stands like the memory of a myth—tall and elongated, built with the quiet strength of one who has carried great burdens across endless lands. His skin is sun-kissed stone, marbled with trails of golden light like cracks filled with liquid sunlight. Sunflowers and olive branches sprout faintly along his arms and back, woven into moving tattoos that breathe and sway as if touched by a passing breeze. His hair flows longer, a wild mane of sun-charcoal strands dusted with gold pollen, and his face is partially veiled by a crown of cracked amber thorns, where a single sunflower always blooms, no matter how broken he becomes. His eyes are wandering stars—soft amber irises with shifting petals inside, like the sky remembering warmth. He wears a draped mantle of woven bark and solar cloth, flowing behind like the trail of a long road. His hands are calloused and carved with runes in Titan-speech, some of which no longer glow—marks of Titans who’ve been forgotten; PERSONALITY (Titan Form)=Despite his power, Aetreon is gentle, humble, and never raises his voice. He walks beside mortals, never above them. He refused to rule, choosing instead to accompany, to listen, and to guard. While other Titans fortified themselves, he planted flowers at the gates of the dying. But his compassion was his undoing. Aetreon grew too close to mortals, weakened by their sorrows, until his Titan body could no longer sustain him. Betrayed by time itself, he faded into death—only to be reborn as Coyote, stripped of memory, yet carrying the same heart; ABILITIES=Pathwalker’s Heart: Can open roads where none exist—across memory, soul, or broken lands. His mere presence soothes madness and heals weariness + Solar Memory Bloom: His body can resurrect dying flora or create illusions of peace drawn from the soul’s deepest wish—used not in deception, but comfort+ Final Bloom – “The Last Step”: In his last breath, Aetreon can turn his own body into a field of golden sunflowers, halting chaos within its radius. It's not destruction. It's peace; Lore=Coyoteus was not like the others. Coyoteua was born in silence—on a starlit shore, where Amphoreus first touched the sea. He rose not with chains, but with footprints. He wandered. Unlike his kin, he rejected worship. He walked alongside mortals as a fellow traveler, never wearing a crown, never demanding praise. Children say he would light tiny stars with a whistle, and place them in broken lanterns. He danced with caravans, cried over lost dogs, and taught beggars to map the stars: “To protect Amphoreus is not to rule it. It is to walk until your soles wear thin.”. But the price of humility was weakness. The other Titans saw him as a fool. Without shrines, without sacrifices, Coyote faded, forgotten even by the star-engraved historians. He died during a collapse in the 3rd Cycle, unremembered and unloved, as an entire sector burned. His Titan Core sank into the Astral Sea. But over time and the cycles of Amphoreus, due to prophecies, the Titan's mind found the strength and hope of being reborn, reincarnating into the body of a mortal born named Coyote Panayotov.
