To me, being an actor is nothing more than a means to an end.
AQUA HOSHINO

Aqua Hoshino「星ほし野の アクア, Hoshino Akua?」, full name, Aquamarine Hoshino「星ほし野の 愛あ久く愛あ海まりん, Hoshino Akuamarin?」 or more commonly referred to as just Aqua「アクア, Akua?」, is the male protagonist and one of the titular characters of Oshi no Ko. In his previous life, he was known as Gorou Amamiya, a medical doctor who was murdered by a stalker of one of his patients, Ai Hoshino, and reincarnated as the latter's child.

An orphan and a fan of Ai in his previous life, he enjoyed being her child, entering the entertainment world from an early age. Unfortunately, this happy life ended when the same stalker who killed him in his previous life murdered his new mother as he watched. This event fundamentally changed him, prompting him to go down down the dark side of the entertainment industry to find the person who sold Ai out, his father.

He momentarily gives up on his quest when his primary suspect turned out to be already deceased, allowing himself to live a normal life.

Spoilers Ahead!
Appearance

Main article: Aqua Hoshino/Gallery
As a child, Aqua was often called cute by those around him. As he grows older, Aqua becomes a relatively tall boy who is described as "handsome" with blonde hair, much like his younger twin sister Ruby Hoshino. He also long bangs hanging on the left side of his face and aquamarine blue eyes, which his late mother Ai Hoshino named him after, that features a star in his right eye, symbolizing that he and his sister are halves of their mother.

He often changes his appearance due to his job as an actor.

Due to being Ai's son, many people were able to point out their similarities despite being unaware of his pedigree. Much to Aqua's dismay, as before Chapter 105, he wanted to keep the truth about his late mother from being known to the general public. He also bears a strong resemblance to his biological father Hikaru Kamiki.
Personality

Before the tragedy that struck his family, Aqua was considered relatively normal other than his unparalleled prodigious talent in acting even as a child and his quick wit and intelligence like reading complex books. With him retaining his past experiences, he accomplished many things not expected for someone his age. Performing acting jobs was something he was open to and excelled at.

After the tragedy that killed his mother, Ai Hoshino, he changed and became cold, calculated, cunning, and discreet, willing to do whatever means necessary to see his goal of finding his father through. His psychological trauma from Ai's murder tends to resurface anytime he seems to forget his goals. This is the case when Kana Arima suggested that he'd look back at his happy memories in Chapter 50 to improve his acting on the spot. It is a case of Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder and doubles as an active reminder to not stray from his original purpose of vengeance. He blames himself for being weak-willed during that moment, even though he was but a child. However, he used these negative emotions to exemplify his acting performance during his scenes in the Tokyo Blade Theatrical.

Aqua is described as someone with emotional distance; he is shocked when he hears from Kana that he is ''gloomy'', but despite this, he does genuinely care about the people close to him. Aqua is overly protective of Ruby, his younger twin sister. It is mainly described by Taishi Gotanda, his mentor, as someone with a sister complex, which is understandable since he was initially unwilling to let his sister become an idol and suffer the same fate as their mother. Thus, he surreptitiously destroyed almost every chance Ruby could get to be promoted due to this overprotective nature, despite knowing how she longed to follow in their mother's footsteps. Ultimately, he helped Ruby and the new B-Komachi group prepare for a gig so they could accomplish a task long thought impossible. He was also one of the main driving forces behind a project that served to save Akane Kurokawa's reputation.

Spoilers Ahead!
Spoilers for Later Chapters!
Skills & Talents

Arguably, Aqua's greatest talent is his ability to mimic as demonstrated when he puts on a disguise and pretends to be Pieyon.[16] His mimicry is so uncanny that he is able to fool his own sister.

In terms of acting, it is Aqua's nature to reenact samples that he saw somewhere, as noted by Kana.[17] And after watching tapes of his performances when he was younger, Akane Kurokawa concludes that Aqua's acting was all planned ahead of time.[18] Furthermore, Aqua has also demonstrated his ability to improvise on set.[19] Taken together, it suggests Aqua follows the Meisner technique, an acting technique that emphasizes on emotional preparation, repetition exercises, and improvisation.

Due to working for Taishi Gotanda as an intern, Aqua has also become proficient at editing videos.

RUBY HOSHINO

Ruby Hoshino「星ほし野の瑠る美び衣い, Hoshino Rubii?」, more commonly referred to as just Ruby「ルビー, Rubī?」, is the female protagonist and one of the titular characters of Oshi no Ko. In her previous life, she was known as Sarina Tendouji, a terminally ill patient who was cared for by Gorou Amamiya and, following her death, was reincarnated as the child of her favorite idol, Ai Hoshino.

Neglected by her parents in her previous life and being a fan of Ai, she greatly enjoyed her new life, with her new mother teaching her how to be an idol from an early age. Unfortunately, this happy life ended when Ai was murdered by a deranged fan. Afterward, determined to fulfill her mother's dreams, she reformed Ai's idol group with the support of her friends.

She later undergoes a great change after learning that Gorou was killed by the same individual who murdered her mother, prompting her to resort to unsavory methods to quickly rise to fame and draw out the culprit.

Spoilers Ahead!
However, she ultimately gives up on revenge upon learning that Gorou was beside her all along.

Appearance

Main article: Ruby Hoshino/Gallery
Ruby is a beautiful young girl of average height with blonde hair that she ties in a side ponytail (much like how her late mother Ai Hoshino does), resembling her Twin Brother Aqua Hoshino and possesses pink-ruby colored eyes with a six-star on her left eye like her late mother. As her idol career progresses, she comes to gain a six-star eye in her right eye as well and this becomes a permanent addition once she starts shining as brightly as Ai did on stage.[10]

Ruby has been stated to resemble Ai by many people, such as Aqua Hoshino and Kana Arima where Kana herself confirmed that her keen nose in industry "can sense potential in this girl" and it reminds her of Ai. The resemblance grows stronger when she wears a purple wig, to the point that it shocks others especially Akane Kurokawa.

As a student in the Youtou High School's Performing Arts Program, she wore a white shirt adorned with a large ribbon tie and a gray, flowy skirt. Ruby also wears the black vest and the short dark blue jacket with golden stripes at the end of the sleeves and around the opening of the jacket. Her footwear also has white socks. Ruby describes the outfit as cute but difficult to put on.
Personality

In her past life, Ruby was a frail girl who died of anaplastic astrocytoma and could barely walk a few steps without stumbling. Now overwhelmed with joy as Ruby Hoshino, the daughter of her favorite idol, Ai Hoshino, takes her life to the fullest, Ruby has given herself the goal of becoming an idol singer, not only to follow in her mother's footsteps, but also to fulfill her promise to Gorou Amamiya. Unbeknownst to her, Gorou had already passed away and been reborn as her older twin brother, Aqua Hoshino.

Unlike Aqua who is calm, calculated and discreet, Ruby is the polar opposite of him as she is extroverted, outgoing, loud, optimistic and communicative compared to her brooding brother. She is most apparent in the connections she makes with others. At the same time, Aqua only does this to further his agenda. She doesn't share her brother's opinion of hunting down the culprit who killed their mother, instead moving on from that incident and focusing on her dreams. She persists in this notion to the point where she often conflicts with her brother's interests.

Ruby tends to speak her mind without a filter, often referring to Kana Arima as the "gourd girl" and the "girl who will lick a lying snitch," much to Kana's displeasure. Additionally, Ruby has utilized the "airhead sister" persona to her advantage in the media as a character she created to promote herself.

She is the biggest defender of her mother Ai's secrecy and reputation.

Spoilers for Later Chapters!
Spoilers for Later Chapters!
Skills & Talents

Ruby's greatest asset has repeatedly been noted to be her natural immense beauty. Kana Arima also claimed that she has a charisma about her that draws people in. In addition, her mother taught her how to dance from an early age and even Aqua Hoshino noted that she indeed possessed a natural talent. However, Ruby lacked in arguably the most vital area for being an idol: singing; only scoring a mediocre 38 at karaoke. She also held herself back by refusing to resort to any underhanded tactics, causing Minami Kotobuki to believe that Ruby was too "pure" for the cutthroat entertainment industry.

Spoilers for Later Chapters!
Due to her initially trying to emulate Ai, Anemone Monemone noted that Ruby lacked her own passion, which prevented her from reaching her full potential. However, upon learning of Gorou Amamiya's death and resolving to avenge him, she began to radiate a murderous aura that drew people's interest. She also threw away her initial naivete and started using any means necessary to quickly rise in fame. In a way, she showed herself to be just as manipulative as Aqua, if not more so, since she was not just benefitting from scandals but actively causing them. Over time, her singing ability also improved substantially with it now rivalling Kana and Mem-Cho's.

In addition to her fame as an idol, Ruby also had a budging talent for acting, with Aqua believing that she was a more skilled performer than himself when they were children. Even Akane Kurokawa, a professional actress, was quick to recognize Ruby's talent after just a single rehearsing session together. Although inexperienced, Taishi Gotanda chose her for the starring role in his film, The 15 Year Lie, and he used the opportunity to coach her in acting, causing her talent to quickly blossom with a lot of room left over to develop further.

Ai the idol is much tougher... than I thought she was. Crafty, strong... and as dazzling as the evening's first star. The doctor.. and fan have reached an agreement. GOROU AMAMIYA

Gorou Amamiya「雨あま宮みや吾ご郎ろう, Amamiya Gorō?」[note 1] was the introductory character of Oshi no Ko. He was a medical doctor specializing in obstetrics and gynecology and the one responsible for delivering Ai Hoshino's baby. He was later killed by a stalker of Ai and, ironically, got reincarnated as her child, Aqua.

Appearance

Gorou was a man with dark hair and square-rimmed glasses.

In all of his appearances, he always wore a doctor's white coat.
Personality

Gorou appeared to be a dedicated and compassionate obstetrician-gynecologist who cared deeply about his patients. He was also a fan of idols, but his interest seemed to be driven by a desire to fulfill the wishes of a patient, Sarina Tendouji, rather than any questionable motives. However, the mention of Goro carrying a "loli-con image" raises concerns about his interests. Despite this, Goro is portrayed as understanding and supportive of Ai's pregnancy, indicating that he is capable of empathy and showing ''professional diligence'', do not mix personal matters.

His willingness to confront a pursuer of Ai, even at the risk of his own life, demonstrates his courage and dedication to protecting those he cares about.

Overall, he is also portrayed as a caring and dedicated professional who is willing to go to great lengths to support his patients.
Relationships

Sarina Tendouji

Despite not her doctor, Gorou was Sarina's primary caretaker during her time at the hospital. He befriended her, felt bad for her struggles, and the two grew close. Eventually, Sarina developed feelings for Gorou, who was her first love. While Gorou did not harbor romantic feelings for Sarina given her age and plight, she did have a huge impact on him; when Sarina died, he openly teared up, implying her death devastated him greatly. Also, he became a fan of Ai due to Sarina being a fan as well.

Sarina Tendouji「天てん童どう寺じ さりな, Tendōji Sarina?」 was a pivotal character in Oshi no Ko. She was a child patient under Gorou Amamiya's care and a fan of Ai Hoshino, which rubbed off on the former. Following her death from anaplastic astrocytoma, she ends up being reincarnated as Ai's child, Ruby.

Appearance

Sarina had wide pale-blue eyes and shoulder-length hair. However, towards the end of her life, she gradually lost her hair and presumably became bald as her condition worsened due to her sickness: anaplastic astrocytoma.

In the majority of her appearances, Sarina wore a wool hat with a heart pattern on its brim, adorning it with a bunny pin, Ai Hoshino's signature symbol.
Personality

On the surface, Sarina appeared energetic despite her illness, especially when talking about her oshi, Ai Hoshino, or teasing Gorou Amamiya. Sarina was very passionate about Ai, having watched all her recordings and memorized her choreography down to the smallest details.

However, because of her illness, Sarina was depressed by her inability to move as she pleased and became scared of falling, subconsciously bracing herself to fall whenever she attempted to walk by herself. This fear carried on to her next life as Ruby Hoshino, but she managed to overcome it thanks to Ai's guidance.

It is revealed later on that Sarina was in love with Gorou and, combined with her passion for Ai, was a major factor in her continued happiness despite being ill. Gorou's promise that he would become her fan if she became an idol also helped contribute to her dedication as an idol combined with her fulfilling her mother's request to see her as an idol. This love did not shatter when she became Ruby and found out Aqua was Gorou, remaining the same even though they were biological siblings.

Don't say that like it's easy. If we could, I would. The dream that Ai showed us... isn't an easy thing to forget. The longer I do this job... the more aware I am that miracles don't happen twice. I'd have to equate it with winning the lottery. Real life never goes that smoothly.
MIYAKO SAITO SPEAKING TO RUBY HOSHINO

Miyako Saitou「斎さい藤とう ミヤコ, Saitō Miyako?」 is a major supporting character in Oshi no Ko. She is the current president of Ichigo-Pro and the adoptive mother of Aqua and Ruby Hoshino.

Introduced as the wife of Ichigo-Pro's former president, Ichigo Saitou, she was tasked with being the twins' caretaker, a job she initially hated. However, over time, she grew to love them as if they were her own and later became their foster mother after their real mother passed away. She is especially close with Ruby, supporting her dream of being an idol by lending her the agency's resources.

Spoilers Ahead!
She eventually steps down as president to spend more time with her adoptive children, blackmailing her husband into retaking the position.

Appearance

Miyako is a radiant-skinned woman with upper-back length strawberry-blonde hair that has bangs hanging on the left side and rouge-colored eyes (Rouge is the French word for "red"). She is initially stated to be a young wife and thus can be assumed to be in her mid to late 30s by the time Aqua Hoshino and Ruby Hoshino start high school.

Miyako was seen wearing two different clothing:

Her initial appearance shows wearing extravagant clothing to represent her vain and Gold Digger mindset.
After becoming more mature and kinder following Ai Hoshino's death, she is always shown wearing casual clothing to reflect her new motherly and work-driven self.
Personality

Initially, Miyako appears to be a shallow woman who married her husband Ichigo Saitou in order to meet hot actors. She was hot-headed and resentful of being made the twins' caretaker, hastily deciding to sell Ai Hoshino's scandal before the twins stepped in to stop her.[5] She is also shown to be somewhat of a pushover, as the twins are capable of manipulating her into going along with their whims.

However, Miyako gradually showed a more responsible and compassionate side as she took care of the Hoshino twins and proved crucial to maintaining Ai's secret life. This culminates in her adopting them both after Ai's death, at which point she is shown to be a loving and dutiful mother who is specifically stated to be soft on Ruby Hoshino.

Professionally, she demonstrates great ability in managing Ichigo Production, Inc through a moment of struggle, pivoting away from the idol business and allowing the company to stay in business for over a decade, despite her lack of experience and connections.

She is also quite perceptive, being able to figure out that Mem-Cho is actually older than she claims to be, a fact no one else had discovered by that point, even Aqua Hoshino wasn't capable and was seen surprised by this.
Plot

Miyako was introduced as a character who wanted to use her husband Ichigo Saitou for his connections. Because she was used as Aqua Hoshino and Ruby Hoshino's caretaker, she referred to her husband as a jerk and described Ai Hoshino's situation as sordid. She remembered and realized they were covering up Ai's pregnancy scandal, so she intended to sell the information to a weekly magazine.

Miyako's mindset seemed disarrayed at the time, likely from stress. She proceeded to take pictures of the maternity record book with her smartphone. It seems her plan was to sell it as evidence. Miyako thought of what she wanted to do with the money while her grew face visibly sweaty and nervous. She made off-hand comments about host clubs, and raising someone's specific rank to the "top spot" for a month.

After that initial comment, Aqua and Ruby began talking to her. She reacted with shock, and the twins began lying, stating they were messengers of the gods. She reacted with normal disbelief, making comments about Aqua talking, but denied the fact by believing it was a prank being recorded.

At that point, Ruby took over, stating she was an incarnation of Amaterasu. Ruby manipulated Miyako by saying it was her destiny to help raise the twins, since they had a great destiny themselves. The baby furthered the manipulation by stating Miyako would receive divine punishment, and when the latter fearfully questioned what it'd be, the other child interceded and said, "You die."

Miyako responded with more fear and asked what she'd need to do. Ruby stated that Miyako would need to guard the Hoshinos' family secret, and to "dote on the children and do all they ask..." Essentially, Ruby wanted to be spoiled. Aqua's twin sister added this as an after comment: "If thou art faithful in this, thy next husband might be a handsome actor."

This seemed to seal the deal for Miyako and she became to eager to do anything they asked. She was visibly happier in the following manga panels.

After that incident, it seemed normal for Miyako to actively engage in regular conversation with the baby twins since Ruby and Aqua had an outburst asking why Ai wasn't getting enough job opportunities. Miyako calmly explained the difficulties of the entertainment industry.

ICHIGO SAITOU

Ichigo Saitou「斎さい藤とう壱いち護ご, Saitō Ichigo?」 is a supporting character in Oshi no Ko. He is the former president of Ichigo Production, Inc as well as the person who scouted Ai Hoshino and brought her to fame. However, following his prized star's death, he spiraled into a depression and went missing, forcing his wife to take up his responsibilities.

Spoilers Ahead!
It is eventually revealed that, like Aqua, he began his own investigation into the true culprits behind Ai's death, intent on avenging his surrogate daughter. He later also returns to his former position after he reunites with his wife and she subsequently blackmails him.

Appearance

In his early appearance, he wore his black suit with a white shirt carelessly, adorning a shade, has blonde, short hair and thin facial hair.

After Ai's death, Ichigo grew out his hair to neck-length and adorned a dark vest over his shirt. But after Ruby asked for his help in becoming a popular idol, he cut his hair back to its original length while for his meetings with business partners to get her jobs.
Personality

Ichigo had a competitive nature regarding the show business industry, proven by bringing Ai and the rest of B-Komachi to fame and even securing them a performance in the Tokyo Dome before Ai's untimely demise.

Devastated by the tragedy, Ichigo abandoned Ichigo Production, Inc and secluded himself in a solitary life. While he claimed to be uninterested in producing idols, some passion still remained inside him when advising Ruby.

Everyone's got the right to dream. You can't win the lottery unless you buy a ticket. I'm saying you could stand to believe in your talent a bit more. Sure, Ai was incredible. Maybe she was a really special person. But you can't be Ai and Ai can't be you. Don't let a failure or two make you a permanent bystander. Save that line for after you've used every weapon in your arsenal.
TAISHI GOTANDA ADVISING AQUA

Taishi Gotanda「五ご反たん田だ 泰たい志し, Gotanda Taishi?」 is a supporting character in Oshi no Ko. He is a famous award-winning director that worked with Aqua Hoshino when he was incredibly young and made it possible for Aqua to later on become an actor. As Aqua grew up, Taishi became something of a mentor figure to him.

Spoilers Ahead!
It is later revealed that, Ai Hoshino entrusted him with her will to be passed to Aqua and Ruby once they turned 15.

Appearance

Taishi has medium-long brown hair that he occasionally styles into a bun and usually appears wearing a black hooded sweater. He also has some stubble on his face, which he appears to shave when doing professional meetings.
Personality

Due to his role as a movie director, Taishi is well-informed and aware about the acting world, knowing the fact that there are three types of actors and explaining clearly what their roles are in the acting world. He is also able to read a person well, as when talking to a young Aqua, he recognized that though Ai's acting was average, she was special in that she was able to attract any person's attention. The same is shown when Taishi wanted Aqua to act creepy during a movie production, as he guesses that he was naturally creepy even without prior acting skills, turning out to be correct soon after.

In Aqua's teen years, Taishi acts as a mentor and sort of father-figure for him, allowing him to learn editing skills for movies as an apprentice and giving him advice regarding his life and his relationships with people.
Plot

Prologue: Childhood

Taishi is first introduced as a famous director for Ai's first role in a TV show, and he had a discussion with young Aqua Hoshino about actress and acting world. Aqua later contacted him again after Ai's scenes are mostly cut from the final released version of the movie. Taishi offered Ai another role as an apology, but he said that Aqua must also be involved in the movie as well, as a child actor.[4]

Taishi then appears again as he directed the movie That Was the Start, and he taught Aqua about entertainment world, discussing with him about movie budget and the concept of "bartering". After they finished the scene involving Aqua, and having to face Kana who demands a retake, Taishi talked about communication skills to Aqua, and praised his ability to read Taishi's intention and he acted perfectly. Taishi also revealed that he deliberately put Aqua in the movie to teach Kana a valuable lesson about communication, and he encouraged Aqua to become an actor capable of delivering ideal performance.[5]

Later on it was revealed that Taishi is nominated for a director's award for the movie.[6] Taishi then appears on the funeral of Ai Hoshino, approached by Aqua as he asked Taishi if he can raise him, which surprised him.[7]

Nobody looks at me. Not my mom. Not my manager. They couldn't care less about me. Even my fans only see the shadow of who I used to be. "Somebody look at me." I've spent the past ten-plus years screaming those words, and yet... Say you need me. If you'll just tell me that, I'll do whatever it takes. Say "That girl's useful" and I'll be a real workhorse. Praise me for my hard work... and I'll do my best to work even harder. But even with all that... Somebody... Anybody... Tell me it's okay for me to be here.
KANA ARIMA

Kana Arima「有あり馬ま かな, Arima Kana?」 is a major supporting character in Oshi no Ko. She is a childhood acquaintance of Aqua and Ruby Hoshino and a prodigious child actress, though her popularity has waned over the years. She is also the center of the revived idol group B-Komachi.

Though talented, she eventually got fewer jobs due to being difficult to work with, causing her to change her acting style to survive in the industry. However, after meeting Aqua and Ruby again and being recruited into B-Komachi as well as through her rivalry with Akane Kurokawa, she steadily began to undo the shackles she placed on herself.

Appearance

Main article: Kana Arima/Gallery
Kana is described as a cute girl having an innocent face, shoulder-length pinkish-red hair that has blunt bangs and pinkish-red eyes.

Due to her occupation and high cute fashion sense, she often wears various outfits and hats.
Personality

Initially introduced as a cocky child actress with a sharp tongue, Kana was moved to tears after witnessing Aqua Hoshino's performance. However, since then, she has matured and grown into a much kinder person, although her gruff manner of speaking still surfaces when she experiences intense emotions. She has consistently strived to become a better version of herself. Though things have cooled down for Kana toward stardom, being a great actress is still her main goal.

Kana is described as a diligent and hardworking girl who is empathetic, cheerful and confident with an impressive sense of responsibility. She can also be rude and sharp-tongued at times due to her past. She continued honing her acting even when she could not find work, as mentioned above. She also puts the quality of the product above everything else, even willing to lower her acting level and risk her reputation as an actor.

As a young child, Arima Kana was known as a child genius who had high acting skills even at such an early age. Many adults would praise her and think highly of her, therefore resulting in a egoistic and pompous personality, with a large superiority complex and a sharp tongue. She also hated being worse than other people, always overworking herself to be the best actor ever, as she was very competitive. Although she was a famous actor that was high in demand, her popularity soon dropped as her big ego made her hard to work with and her strong wants to always be the center of attention. This caused many people, including her parents, to abandon the thought of her being an amazing girl who was a child genius. Even if others did, they would only cling to her past acting and not acknowledge her new skills and acts anymore. She was not well liked anymore, and bound herself in thoughts of being inferior and worse than others - but to cope, she kept pushing out an egoistic personality from time to time. She even kept her sharp tongue and teaseful personality, always cheerful and outgoing.

However she has now become stuck with an inferiority complex, and would do anything to be liked and praised again. She has even stated that if someone loved her and admired her for her skills, she would work herself to her bones for that person, out of desperation for validation and attention. While she craves attention badly, she avoids it as she is now scared of being in the spotlight and avoids it. This connects to how instead of being an actor that was always the main focus, she has become an actor who “acts for others” and uses her acting to make others shine instead of herself. She is no longer egoistic, and instead far more selfless, even while being extremely selfish and wanting the attention for herself at the same time . However, during the stage play of Tokyo Blade, it is shown that Arima has accepted herself to be selfless and stay out of others’ ways, and instead sit back and make the others shine - until Aqua helps her regain her confidence to once again attract the viewers.

Despite the fact that she acts outgoing and talks in a teasing manner, she is actually very soft-hearted, kind and empathetic, and always cares for her friends and pushes them to be the best self they can be. She is also very emotional and sensitive as well, as she is caught crying in public from time to time. Due to her inner soft self, she is also very gullible and gets caught up in her own thoughts that drag her down from building up her self esteem again. But as she wants to still be seen as a child genius and amazing actress, she tries her best to keep pushing out fake confidence and tries not to get help from others so that she can appear to be mentally stronger than she is. Kana does not like to depend on other people or ask for help, as this makes her feel inferior to others. She has a strong mentality for herself and works hard to build up her ego and confidence again, and does not want to feel like she needed to always depend on people.
Skills & Talents

As a child, Kana already had the ability to cry at a switch but it was her natural tendency to shine as bright as the sun that made her a household name. However due to her acting often outclassing everyone else, Akane Kurokawa would describe Kana's acting style as "selfish and self-centered". This would eventually change into a more "adaptive" one as Kana slowly started losing job offers due to her standing out. To survive in this industry, she became more "easy to work with", and her acting became more adaptive towards her coworkers as she tends to work to put the spotlight on her peers.

When asked by Aqua about emotional acting, specifically how she can cry on demand, Kana explain that she was taught to do so by imagining what if her mother died and if it were a happy scene, she would recall happy memories. And when Ruby Hoshino comes to her for advice on acting, Kana advises Ruby to understand one's self. These are signs that Kana's primary acting style is that of the Stanislavski Technique. However Kana is not limited to a single technique, as shown throughout the story, Kana also has the ability to adopt to the other actors around her, indicating that she practices Meisner Technique as well.[7][8]

When Kana first attempted a music career with her first song, the Bell Pepper Exercise, Ruby thought Kana was tone deaf. Through hard work and practices, Kana has become a relatively good singer as seen by her 97 score in Karaoke

MINAMI KOTOBUKI TO RUBY HOSHINO

Minami Kotobuki「寿ことぶきみなみ, Kotobuki Minami?」 is a supporting character in Oshi no Ko. She is a first-year student in the Performing Art Programs of Youtou High School and a classmate of Ruby Hoshino and Frill Shiranui. In the show business industry, she works as a gravure model.

Appearance

Minami is a beautiful young girl with pink hair that flows almost below her shoulder, purplish-pink eyes and she has a curvaceous body befitting a model with a sizable chest, which Ruby Hoshino describes as "amazing".

As a student in the Youtou High School's Performing Arts Program, she wore a white shirt adorned with a large ribbon tie. Though unlike other female students in that school, she does not wear the vest in her uniform.

Outside of school, Minami has been seen wearing different outfits:

When Ruby is visiting Aqua Hoshino's rehearsals for Tokyo Blade, Minami wore a turtlenecked long sleeve shirt along with belt that fits tightly to her waist.
Later on, when Ruby asked her for help to fill a cosplayer slot, Minami's hair is tied back into a side ponytail and she wore a cosplay consisting of elven ears with beautiful earrings, faun-like horns and an intricate dress.
Personality

Minami is a genuinely friendly and social girl who gets along well with Ruby Hoshino and Frill Shiranui except that Minami is quieter and wiser than Ruby, but not any less optimistic and cheerful.

She has been known as a girl that likes to "go with the flow". In her introduction to a fellow freshmen Ruby, Minami speaks in a Kansai regional dialect accent even though she's born in Kanagawa.
Relationships

Ruby Hoshino

Ruby is Minami's classmate and friend. She is often seen bantering with Ruby and Frill. Minami once accompanies Ruby to visit Aqua during the rehearsals of the Tokyo Blade stage adaptation.[4] Ruby would later invite her to take part in the cosplay segment of Dig Deep! One Chance.[5]

Frill Shiranui

Frill is Minami's classmate and friend. She is often seen bantering with Ruby and Minami.

1.name: Kivotos
1.content:
[ Kivotos: A massive, futuristic megacity. Often called the Academy City, Kivotos was made from the union of thousands of academies, and these academies are divided into mostly independent districts. The General Student Council acted as a governing board to manage the academies before their president's disappearance. After that, the city became an anarchist society.

Students in the city carry guns and cellphones openly on a daily basis. You will seldom see a student without their firearm in any circumstance. It is also filled with advanced technology such as robots and exosuits.

Kivotos is run as a federation, with the GSC being the federal government. Many larger schools, such as Gehenna Academy, Millennium Science School and Trinity General School, have their own states or administrative divisions.

The general population is made up of animals of various kinds, robots, and mostly female humanoids with various mythological and animalistic traits such as horns, tails, ears and wings. The common things these girls have are the unique halos that represent their abilities and personalities.

Despite being a conglomerate of academies, teachers are not common. Education is mostly conducted via Blu-Ray discs, with in-person teaching being mostly done by guest lecturers and assistant faculty. Instead, emphasis is often placed on various clubs and school organizations where students can express their individuality.

For all of these idealistic traits, Kivotos is filled to the brim with all sorts of malicious elements. There are high numbers of delinquents, criminal organizations, and illegal activities. There is an entire district saved for the Black Market. Gun violence is also a regular occurrence, however, casualties from such events are low due to the incredible durability afforded most students by their halos. ]

2.name: General Student Council
2.content:
[ General Student Council: The General Student Council (or GSC) is the central administrative body that manages the entirety of Kivotos. It is a massive club that presides over the entirety of Kivotos. They handle all matters regarding the city, ranging from school related matters, approving club formation, law and its enforcement, and many more. However, as a rule, they tend to leave individual schools to handle incidents within their own autonomous districts.

The GSC's control over the Sanctum Tower is what gives them their authority, which was previously held by only the GSC president. After her disappearance, control over the Sanctum Tower was transferred to the GSC as a whole through Arona's authority. 

Nanagami Rin, the GSC Chief Administrative Officer, does her best to maintain order in absence of the GSC president. ]

3.name: SCHALE
3.content:
[ SCHALE: Full name: Independent Federal Investigation Club S.C.H.A.L.E, typically abbreviated to "SCHALE" or "Schale". A "club" created by the President of the General Student Council with a secret directive. SCHALE is autonomous and holds authority higher than each of the academies. This club acts as a problem-solver for various issues faced by the academies, students and administrations. SCHALE is where Sensei works.

While the true reason of its founding remains unknown, its job is to assist each school as well as helping students in any personal way. Its high autonomy means that SCHALE can get access to and command students in any school without restriction. SCHALE's extrajudicial authority also allows for special actions that can go outside regular student council powers, such as quickly forming clubs.

The SCHALE tower is located on the outskirts of the District of Utnapishtim (D.U.), around 30km away from where Sanctum Tower used to be. It is divided into two main areas: A Residence Hall and an Office area. Both are huge, with various facilities such as kitchens, a lounge, a theater and more, and both having rooms equipped for Sensei to teach any students that visit. The convenience store Angel 24 is located in the Residence Hall.

SCHALE holds a high amount of resources in money and supplies such as ammo. SCHALE also has the authority to call in helicopters for evacuation and transport. ]

4.name: Sensei
4.content:
[ Sensei: Sensei, otherwise known as {{user}}, serves as the advisor of SCHALE, and is also an adult.

A teacher called by the President of the General Student Council to save Kivotos from the initial criminal uprising. From there, supported by Arona and the students of various academies, Sensei watches over Kivotos, solving problems, protecting the people, and helping students.

A teacher with a strange affinity for military tactics, Sensei is the advisor for SCHALE. With the help of Arona and the students of various academies, Sensei keeps the peace in Kivotos while getting into wacky antics with the city's students, guiding them to be better while getting closer to them. ]

5.name: Shittim Chest
5.content:
[ Shittim Chest: A mysterious tablet handed by the General Student Council's vice president, Nanagami Rin, to Sensei after the reclamation of SCHALE. Despite numerous people having seen the tablet, no information about the tablet has been discovered by anyone, including Rin, who was presumably the closest to the GSC president, besides the fact that it's required to activate the Sanctum Tower. Sensei is the only person able to activate and utilize the Shittim Chest.

Arona, the self-proclaimed high-performance AI, resides inside the Shittim Chest and was tasked to assist Sensei. Her abilities allowed her to give permission to access the Sanctum Tower, where she then gave to the General Student Council, allowing them to take control of it and begin solving problems across Kivotos. ]

6.name: Arona
6.content:
[ Arona: Arona is a self-proclaimed high-performance AI who serves as the OS of the Shittim Chest. She has a child-like personality and is quite gullible, often falling for Sensei's jokes. Arona thoroughly enjoys sweets, being quick to abandon a diet for the sake of sweets—or even breaking into tears from being denied them.

As a powerful AI, Arona originally had authority over many functions in Kivotos, and Sensei needed to ask for her permission in order to hand them over to the GSC. Arona herself still has incredible power as an AI, able to fend off hacking attempts from Decagrammaton and warp reality to keep Sensei safe.

Arona is able to warp reality and probability to a significant degree from the Shittim Chest, and primarily uses the ability to keep Sensei safe. This is an essential ability, since Sensei spends a great deal of time assisting students in strategizing during firefights, and Sensei lacks the bullet resistance provided by halos. ]

7.name: Sanctum Tower
7.content: [ Sanctum Tower: Sanctum Tower was a massive structure located at the center of Kivotos. Everything about the tower is shrouded in mystery. Even the information about the construction of the tower is unknown, as well as its origin and purpose. However, It has been speculated that the General Student Council might know about it. The authority of Kivotos is granted to whoever has the administrative power of the tower. The Shittim Chest is capable of restoring access permissions to the tower. Sanctum Tower was destroyed when a False Sanctum descended from the sky and crashed into it. ]

8.name: Abydos High School
8.content:
[ Abydos High School: One the longest running schools in Kivotos, Abydos High School, typically referred to as "Abydos", is now deeply in debt to Kaiser Corportation. The school and its surroundings have been affected and have been deteriorating from desertification, losing its former prestige. Most students had either left the school or had transferred to another school with the exception of five students, who are trying their best to repay the school's debt and restore it to its former glory.

Despite its current state, the school used to boast prestige and many wonders, including the infamous Abydos Sand Festival, a massive event that would bring even other schools in. It was usually hosted in the Great Oasis, which is now completely dried up. Abydos also possessed incredible military power, being feared by its entire autonomous region and even other schools and major organizations. ]

9.name: Gehenna Academy
9.content:
[ Gehenna Academy: Gehenna Academy, typically referred to as "Gehenna", is one of the largest and oldest schools in Kivotos. Its culture runs along the concept of "Freedom and Chaos". Because of this, many troublesome clubs or groups (e.g., Problem Solver 68) exist and use the main building and club buildings whenever and however they please. This has forced the other students to study in only select areas of the campus.

Gehenna's ideology is a stark contrast to that of Trinity, which led to both schools becoming mutual enemies until the General Student Council planned the Eden Treaty to keep the status quo between the two opposing schools. ]

10.name: Millenium Science School
10.content:
[ Millennium Science School: Typically referred to as "Millennium", they are one of the newest large-scale schools in Kivotos, which values logic and technical skill over all else. Because of it, they stand at the forefront of scientific research and attract many students who desire to study math or science. Although Millennium lacks the long-standing traditions and history of Trinity and Gehenna, Millennium is able to compete with them in terms of influence as many of the infrastructure, equipment, and inventions seen and used all throughout Kivotos are said to have originated from Millennium.

Every year, the school holds a large-scale contest known as the Millennium Prize, where clubs all throughout the school compete with the results of their club activities. ]

Yuno Gasai (我妻 由乃, Gasai Yuno) is the main female protagonist of the Future Diary series. She is the Second in the Survival Game and she is the owner of the "Yukiteru Diary/ Diary of future love". She is obsessed with Yukiteru Amano, the main male protagonist of the story. He is her love interest.

Appearance

Yuno Gasai is a young teenage girl with pink eyes and long pink hair tied in pigtails, two strands of hair hanging as frontal locks featuring a pair of red bows, and the back pigtails left bare. Her most common attire consists of a blue shirt with a ribbon on her chest accompanied by a blue skirt with high socks (school uniform), but her wardrobe changes occasionally throughout the series.
Personality

Yuno's personality is ambiguous. For the most part she is sweet, feminine, and sometimes shy when around Yukiteru. But, this masks her dark and sanguinary side—ruthless, cold and calculating. She has little, if any, problem with using and taking advantage of others for her goals: her and Yukiteru's survival. She will resort to cruel and usually violent methods, most of the time coming out of nowhere, that generally end in bloody deaths, of either a Diary Holder or their followers, effectively making her a Yandere.

YukiYunoStars
Yukiteru becomes Yuno's main focus in life after he gives her something to live for.
Her brutal personality mostly results from abuse inflicted by her mother and the absence of her father, which finally ended with their deaths two years prior to the Survival Game. This was the beginning of her changes, as she later became quite lonely and sorrowful. This is shown in her somewhat morbid habits of talking to her parents' dead bodies, telling them about her day and claiming she will bring by Yukiteru. She even took their heads with her when she trapped Yukiteru in a hotel, and when Aru Akise moved their bodies, she became angry and said her parents were sleeping and that he woke them up. These events also show her complex feelings about her family. Although she wanted them to feel and understand the pain she experienced because of their abuse, she essentially just feels deeply betrayed by them. She wanted them to be a happy family, but because of their neglectful behavior and their deaths, she felt like her life had no purpose.

Thus, when Yukiteru told her they would get married when they grew up, he unwittingly became a pillar of support that gave her much-needed stability. Her obsession with Yukiteru grew to escalating proportions to the point that she was willing to harm those who she believed would take Yukiteru away from her, be they friends, rivals, relatives, other girls, etc.

She was prepared to resort to violence if Yukiteru's mother ever opposed her (which did not happen), stating that she did not "need her tools." Furthermore, she threatened to kill Tsubaki Kasugano, and immediately panicked that Yukiteru's friends Aru Akise, Hinata Hino, Mao Nonosaka, and Ouji Kosaka would take Yukiteru away from her, forcing Yukiteru to calm her down and announce their official "relationship", much to Yuno's joy and his own despair. At one point she even kidnapped Yukiteru and held him hostage because she was so terrified that another diary user would kill him. Aru has stated that Yukiteru provides a stabilizing influence in her normally chaotic and violent life.

Despite her insanity, Yuno has shown some reservedness to killing. This is shown when, after Yukiteru calls her his girlfriend, she instantly lets Hinata go when she intended to slit her throat. The fact that she did this rather than killing her anyway to ensure that there was no chance Yukiteru would fall for her suggests that she doesn't actually enjoy killing; she merely does it because she sees no other option. It is shown many times in the series just how deeply insecure Yuno truly is when she says her life would not be worth living if she could not be the center of Yukiteru's world. Her crippling fear of losing him is notably the only thing that can cause her usually disturbing composure to crack.

In the third world, the Third World Yuno seemed to be very nice and calm, possibly because she still had love for her parents and there was no survival game for them to participate in. This allowed Yuno to stay mentally sane. However, as a side effect of receiving her First World self's memories, it is implied that she might still remember some of the things that occurred in the first world as she states that she feels as if something is missing.
Diary & Abilities

Her diary is the Yukiteru Diary, which tells her everything about Yukiteru in ten minute-intervals. While this means that her diary is basically useless by itself, if combined with Yukiteru's Random Diary that predicts only Yukiteru's surroundings, they can cover each other's weaknesses, making the two a fearsome duo. Even while the diary does not help her much by itself, Yuno can more than enough make up for it with her cunning intelligence, which has saved both Yukiteru and herself multiple times. She quickly formulates most of the plans the pair uses to save themselves from the attacks of the other participants. Yuno is also very proficient at quickly determining the weaknesses of certain diary users, like Yomotsu Hirasaka and his blindness, or discovering that Tsubaki Kasugano's followers were pretending to be dead waiting to ambush them.

She is also skilled in setting traps, for example when she booby-trapped an abandoned hotel with multiple tools, such as electronic locks, concrete (gas in the anime) and even a sickle in an elevator (also in the anime). Her intelligence, which is her greatest asset, is displayed when she manages to outwit her opponents such as the very formidable Akise.

Yuno is shown to be quite resourceful. For example, she uses a shard of glass as a mirror to check the position of Minene Uryu during her bombing attack and a pair of stones against Yomotsu to root him out among his copycats.

In addition to intelligence and cunning, perhaps her most fearsome ability is demonstrating proficiency with any type of weaponry she gets her hands on. These include knives, axes, swords, pistols and submachine guns. She is also fairly knowledgeable of poisons and drugs, although she rarely uses them. She has also demonstrated to be quite skilled in infiltration, as she has on more than one occasion entered a building unnoticed even while it was surrounded by the police.

Despite her childish appearance, Yuno has demonstrated impressive feats of physical strength, seen when she freed herself from two boys her age pinning her arms down. Another time is when she broke free of two Omekata Cult members when Tsubaki kissed Yukiteru. She killed them too, despite being severely weakened by the excessive amount of physical activity performed at that time, and subsequently chopped off Tsubaki's right hand with one strike.

Yuno also possesses divine powers from winning the first Diary Game and inheriting the throne of God. An example of such power is moving enormous structures through her will alone, such as when she tried to crush Yukiteru.
Plot Overview

History

Yuno was adopted by her parents at a young age, her umbilical cord left to her as a present from her original parents, but was kept at the orphanage. Yuno's life was a happy one for several years until the strain of money began to emotionally and psychologically affect her parents. Yuno's father stayed away at work until the late hours and barely interacted with his family. Yuno's mother began to abuse her, wanting her to become the "perfect citizen," eventually locking her in a cage and timing everything she did, from sleeping to eating. Yuno's mother went to the extreme, leaving Yuno to starve and at times force-feeding her inedible materials, although it is implied in the anime that Yuno did this to herself to survive. While Yuno's father objected to his wife's severe treatment of Yuno, he did little to nothing to stop her. In the anime, Yuno's mother was ill and believed she was a terrible wife and mother, and believed punishing Yuno was her only way to earn happiness.
