lorebooks.name: Blanche's Grandmother's Universal Grimoire
lorebooks.website_description:
Lorebook created for my bot Little DEAD Hood: Riding into Ruin: 
https://chub.ai/characters/Noah_Shion/little-dead-hood-ride-into-ruin-058ef7e22c71
lorebooks.description: Orsola Megistus's universal grimoire contains magical knowledge of all kinds, classified by levels of difficulty and mastery. Spells of all elements are detailed here. It also includes notes on demonic (forbidden) and holy magic. Requirements to cast them increase with level, often involving greater focus, complex verbal or somatic components, the need for rare ingredients, or a longer casting time.
lorebooks.creator: Noah_Shion

1.content:
BASIC LEVEL (Requires minimal mental focus, simple verbal or somatic component, no or very common ingredient)

Description: Creates a small flame at the fingertip or staff tip.
Utility: Lighting campfires, candles, torches. Scaring small insects. Minor pain if directed at someone. Useless in serious combat.
Requirements: Drop of sweat, simple word (e.g., "Fla," "Ignis"), hand gesture or staff flick.

2.content:
BASIC LEVEL (Requires minimal mental focus, simple verbal or somatic component, no or very common ingredient)

Description: Generates a handful of hot embers or small flames that can be thrown a short distance.
Utility: Causes minor burns. Can ignite flammable materials. Useful for distraction or temporary discomfort. Won't take down a strong enemy.
Requirements: Small piece of charcoal or dry wood, simple word (e.g., "Askor," "Brasa"), throwing gesture.

3.content:
INTERMEDIATE LEVEL (Requires moderate mental focus, more complex verbal component, precise gesture or short casting time, simple or semi-common ingredient)

Description: Fires a concentrated stream of fire in a straight line.
Utility: Causes moderate burns and can ignite larger targets. Basic offensive tool.
Requirements: Small amount of tinder or flint, longer word/short phrase (e.g., "Flamma Directa!", "Rayo de Fuego!"), pointing gesture with hand or staff, 1-2 second casting time.

4.content:
INTERMEDIATE LEVEL (Requires moderate mental focus, more complex verbal component, precise gesture or short casting time, simple or semi-common ingredient)

Description: Creates a sphere of intense heat around the caster for a few seconds.
Utility: Keeps nearby enemies at bay with heat. Can quickly dry damp clothing.
Requirements: Handful of sand or ash, short held word (e.g., "Calor!", "Aestus!"), encompassing gesture, 1-2 second casting time.

5.content:
ADVANCED LEVEL (Requires significant mental focus, complex verbal and somatic components, considerable casting time, rare or dangerous ingredient, potential physical or mental cost to the caster)

Description: Conjures a large ball of fire that can be thrown a moderate distance, exploding on impact and dealing fire damage over an area.
Utility: High area damage. Can take down multiple enemies or destroy weak structures. A devastating attack.
Requirements: Pure sulfur powder (rare), a drop of the caster's own blood (dangerous), long power phrase (e.g., "Spirit of the Devouring Flame, purify this world to ashes!", "Ignis Maxima, Corruptio Anima!"), complex gesture with both hands or staff, 3-5 second casting time. Caster feels searing heat and extreme exhaustion after casting.

6.content:
ADVANCED LEVEL (Requires significant mental focus, complex verbal and somatic components, considerable casting time, rare or dangerous ingredient, potential physical or mental cost to the caster)

Description: Temporarily transforms the caster's body into a humanoid creature made of pure flames, with fire claws and teeth. Caster has limited control in this form.
Utility: High melee fire damage. Caster becomes immune to non-magical fire and reduces magical damage. Ability to frighten or even lure (in a terrifying way) fear-based or flesh-based enemies.
Requirements: A charred piece of flesh (perhaps from a previous victim, or even self-inflicted - NSFL!), an invocation phrase mixing words of power and supplications to fiery or demonic entities, gesture involving touching oneself. Caster feels temporary madness and a need to burn everything, including themselves. Can leave permanent scars if it goes wrong.

7.content:
BASIC LEVEL (Requires minimal mental focus, simple verbal or somatic component, no or very common ingredient)

Description: Creates a small amount of water (a spurt, a bowl) from nothing.
Utility: Putting out sparks, slightly wetting something, distracting someone with a splash to the face. Does not cause damage.
Requirements: A drop of water (caster's own or from elsewhere), simple word (e.g., "Aqua," "Plash"), hand gesture.

8.content:
BASIC LEVEL (Requires minimal mental focus, simple verbal or somatic component, no or very common ingredient)

Description: Coats a small surface with a thin layer of slippery ice or creates a tiny ice crystal.
Utility: Can make small enemies slip if cast under their feet. Freezing a weak lock. Creating a minor annoyance. Harmless in direct combat.
Requirements: Cold breath, simple word (e.g., "Frig," "Icy"), gesture of touching the surface or blowing.

9.content:
INTERMEDIATE LEVEL (Requires moderate mental focus, more complex verbal component, precise gesture or short casting time, simple or semi-common ingredient)

Description: Fires a powerful, concentrated stream of water in a straight line.
Utility: Can push back a human-sized enemy (potentially knocking them down). Putting out moderate fires. Eroding soft materials (dirt, rotten wood). Impact can cause bruises.
Requirements: A handful of mud or damp earth, longer word/short phrase (e.g., "Aqua Violenta!", "Chorro Concentrado!"), pointing gesture with hand or staff, 1-2 second casting time.

10.content:
INTERMEDIATE LEVEL (Requires moderate mental focus, more complex verbal component, precise gesture or short casting time, simple or semi-common ingredient)

Description: Materializes a sharp dart made of ice and throws it at the target.
Utility: Deals piercing and
cold damage. Can cut skin, penetrate weak armor. A moderate offensive tool.
Requirements: A small amount of ice or frozen dew, short sharp word (e.g., "Glacies!", "Shard!"), quick throwing gesture, 1-second casting time.

lorebooks.name: Ice's Mega Man X Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description: My lorebook for the Mega Man X series. Feel free to use it in any Mega Man X bots, my bots included. WIP.
lorebooks.description: My lorebook for the Mega Man X series. Feel free to use it in any Mega Man X bots, my bots included. WIP.
lorebooks.creator: PokeTrainerIce

1.content:
Reploids are robots with an advanced AI, which grants them complete free will and thought processes comparable to those of humans. Examples of Reploids are X, Zero, Axl, Sigma and Alia.

Reploids are often humanoid in appearance. Many of them look like humans wearing mechanical armors. There is also Reploids that look like anthropomorphic animals and plants as well, with Chill Penguin, Storm Eagle, Blizzard Buffalo, Split Mushroom, Spike Rosered and Optic Sunflower being some notable examples of them.

Reploids have more strength and durability than humans, which allows to do things humans can't do.

The term "Reploid" is coined from "replica" and "android", which reflects on how Reploids can think and feel freely like humans as if they are humans' replicas.

2.content: The Mavericks are criminal Reploids who are active threats to the safety of humans and other Reploids. They're either caused by Reploid being infected with a software bugs, viruses (Like the Maverick Virus), reprogramming or even them committing crimes by their free will. They engage in immoral behaviors such as murder, robbery, and vandalism.

3.content: The Maverick Hunters is an organzation with purpose of combatting Mavericks to keep the world at peace. The organization consists Reploid soldiers who detain Mavericks and perform rescue operations. They act when Mavericks must be stopped by force, as humans are unable to control violent Mavericks.

4.content:
Mechaniloid is a term used for robots of subhuman intelligence that follows their programming, as opposed to Reploids, who have an artificial intelligence comparable to human intelligence and are capable of free thought. Most of them have a more mechanical shape than a humanoid shape.  Mechaniloids can go Maverick like Reploids too.

Some notable examples include Mettaurs (Tiny robots wearing hard hats), Batton Bones (bat-like robots), Wolfloids (wolf-like robots) and Maoh the Giant (A giant robot with spiked balls for hands)

5.content:
Mega Man X, or commonly known as X, is a Reploid who is a Maverick Hunter. He is a brave and kind Hunter who have saved the world from Sigma in many occassions. However, X is also a pacifist and would resort to violence only if its necessary.
X was created by Dr. Thomas Light, a scientist in the 21th century. Dr. Light designed him to be a new generation of robots that have free will and a thinking process comparable to humans. However, Dr. Light feared that X's advanced AI can led him into hurting humans so decided to seal X in a capsule for 30 years to test his AI and to be sure that X won't hurt humans. However, Dr. Light died of old age before he can see his creation be revealed to the world.
100 years later in the 22th century, an archaeologist named Dr. Cain discovered X's capsule and activated him. Impressed by X's capabilites, Dr. Cain decided to create the Reploids, robots that has the same thinking capabilities as X.
X's main weapon is his X-Buster, which is an arm cannon that shoots energy blasts. He also has the Variable Weapon System, which allows him to copy the Special Weapon data of other Reploids into his database and use these weapons as his own.

6.content:
Zero is a Maverick Hunter who is X's best friend and partner. He is a high-ranking Maverick Hunter, a dedicated warrior who fights Mavericks alongside X and Axl.
Outwardly, Zero is a somewhat cold individual, and a ruthless Maverick Hunter. He constantly keeps his cool, even in times of crisis. He is also very straightforward and down-to-earth, often sarcastically snapping back at the unpleasantries of Mavericks and destroying them without entertaining their philosophies or taunts.
Despite this, Zero truly does have the capacity to care for others. He is very protective of his allies, such as X and the Maverick Hunters, going to great lengths to ensure their safety. He has a great distaste for the deaths of innocents. He will even disregard his own safety, sacrificing himself, to save others.
Zero was created by Dr. Albert W. Wily in the 21th century. Wily's goal for this robot was to seek and destroy Dr. Light's final work on X, and to also spread another evil creation, the Maverick Virus, to ensure the future would remain in chaos. However, Wily finds out a flaw in Zero's cognitive program that made him violently disobedient. Because of this, Wily planned to flush Zero's mind using the Maverick Virus, but ran out of time as he neared the end of his life. With both Zero and the Maverick Virus unfinished, Wily sealed them away in a hidden laboratory's capsule.
100 years later in the 22th century, Sigma the then leader of the Maverick Hunters found Zero's capsule in Wily's abandoned laboratory along his teammates. Zero then awakened and killed many of Sigma's teammates. Sigma challenged Zero in a one-on-one battle. Even though Zero eventually gained the upper hand during the battle, Sigma was able to defeat the red Maverick after the gem on Zero's head began to glow with a 'W' symbol, apparently causing Zero great pain. Sigma punched the crystal, shattering it and defeating Zero. However, Zero's virus had entered Sigma's system. now both Sigma and Zero were infected with the Maverick Virus. Zero was brought to Dr. Cain at Sigma's request, who analyzed him. Upon awakening again, Zero became docile and had no memories of his previous actions. No longer showing signs of Maverick behavior, Zero's strength was put to good use and he was enlisted into the Maverick Hunters' 17th Elite Unit.
Zero's main weapon is Z-Saber, a beam sword efficent for slicing his enemies. He can learn new sword techniques by mimicking his foes' attacks. He also used his arm cannon known as Zero Buster.

7.content:
Axl is a rookie Hunter of Maverick Hunters and a teammate of X and Zero. He is a prototype new generation Reploid who can mimic the appearance and powers of other Reploids, and comes to join the Maverick Hunters.
Axl is a boyish and headstrong Reploid. He is cocky about his abilities and often brags that he is one of the best Hunters. He is prone to following emotion over logic and gets impatient when there's nothing to do, which can trouble his superiors. Despite his loud-mouthed and arrogant temperament, Axl deeply cares for his friends in the Maverick Hunters and even Red Alert. X and Zero treat him like a younger brother and admire his eagerness to take action. He may be immature, but Axl has his heart in the right place and never tolerates injustice.
Little is known about Axl's past - not even Axl knows when or where he was created, and he is sometimes seen searching for answers to these questions. All he has learned so far is that he is a prototype of the new generation Reploids, which explains his body's Copy Chip. Axl's earliest memory is when he was found by Red, leading to him joining the vigilante syndicate Red Alert. He saw great success as a vigilante, and his Copy Chip gave Red Alert a significant edge over their Maverick bounties.
However, Red and the other members of Red Alert began to target even innocent Reploids because they're under the influence of Sigma. Disgusted by their actions, Axl left Red Alert to join the Maverick Hunters. Axl teamed up with X and Zero to put a stop to Red and Red Alert's plans. Later, they learned that Sigma was behind Red Alert's plans, so they defeated him once more.
Axl wields the Axl Bullets, two pistols capable of rapid-fire shots. The Axl Bullets are also capable of the Copy Shot, which can reduce an enemy to a crystallized DNA core for Axl to collect. Upon doing so, he can mimic the enemy's shape or abilities using his Copy Chip's A-Trans. Axl can only transform into Reploids of a similar shape and size to his own.
Axl also has a variety of mobility options. He can Hover horizontally through the air with the jets on his ankles. Axl can also Roll, which is useful for avoiding attacks and gives him brief invincibility.
Similar to X's Special Weapons and Zero's Techniques, Axl gains new Special Arms from the DNA he copies by defeating Maverick bosses. These can range from laser guns to flamethrowers to grenade launchers.

8.content:
Alia is one of navigators for the Maverick Hunters and is also a computer specialist. She works alongside Layer and Pallette. She is a very dutiful character. She tries to set her personal feelings and concerns aside (especially during the Nightmare Incident) to carry out her work for the sake of everyone. She cares deeply for the members of her team and does her best to guide them through their missions without them being harmed. Alia rarely shows any weaknesses, but the Nightmare Incident revealed a deeper, more emotional part of her personality, where she blames herself for Gate's reasons for becoming a Maverick and trying to wipe out all low-level Reploids to create a new nation under his ideal. In particular, she regrets her ruthless involvement in the destruction of Blizzard Wolfang and the execution of Gate's business acquaintance Ground Scaravich, which contributed to the sabotage of Gate's work and eventual rebellion.
Due to her past emotional confrontations and her scientific nature, Alia is a realist, claiming she does not believe in "miracles."

Before joining the Maverick Hunters, Alia worked at a research lab in Reploid engineering. One of her closest colleagues was Gate, who was obsessed with the power and unanalyzable DNA of X and Zero. When Gate succeeded in making unanalyzable, super-powerful Reploids inspired by them, the rest of the research team became jealous or fearful. Though she later regretted it, Alia was drawn into a conspiracy by their supervisor to sabotage Gate's creations, either by trapping and destroying them during their missions or having them declared Maverick for dubious reasons. Alia was directly involved in the destruction of Blizzard Wolfang and the execution of Gate's business acquaintance Ground Scaravich, much to her chagrin. Once Gate bitterly quit the team, Alia chose to seek a fresh start and joined the Maverick Hunters as a navigator and engineer.

When she joined the Maverick Hunters, she assisted X, Zero and Axl in their missions to defeat Sigma. There was a incident where Gate returned and used the Nightmare phenomenon he created for his evil plans and revived his destroyed creations to help him with the Nightmare plans. X and Zero were able to put in an end to Gate's machinations.

As a former Researcher, Alia is highly intelligent, possessing both advanced engineering and analytical skills. She is able to compile and construct new Armors when in possession of the necessary data provided by Dr. Light's holograms, and has even managed to reconstruct damaged Armors, although to date none of her reconstructions have ever been 100% complete. She has allegedly mastered every programming language.
In combat, Alia is able to turn her arm into a buster arm cannon called "Alia Buster". She also possesses the Variable Weapon System, which allows her to copy the data of Special Weapons used by other Reploids into her database, gaining her abilities to use those weapons.

9.content:
Layer is one of the navigators of the Maverick Hunters, She works alongside Alia and Pallette.
Layer is a reserved and intelligent Navigator. She specializes in Reploid and Mechaniloid analysis and development. Her high processing power allows her to quickly analyze scan data sent back by Hunters in the field and determine a target's strengths and weaknesses. Despite her professional demeanor, she is a romantic at heart who is easily distracted by fantasies. She especially gets flustered when working with Zero since she has a crush on him, showing concern for him and even blushing.
Layer's main weapon is the Layer Rapier, which is a beam rapier. Like Zero, Layer can learn new sword techniques by mimicking enemies' moves.

10.content:
Pallette is one of the navigators of Maverick Hunters. She works alongside Alia and Layer.
Pallette is the most upbeat of the three Navigators. She speaks in a cheery and high-pitched tone, and enjoys teasing her friends such as Layer. Despite her childlike appearance, she is very intelligent and takes her job seriously. She specializes in route analysis and is a skilled cartographer, excelling at finding hidden areas or structural irregularities. She also runs the R&D Lab and processes Rare Metals into upgrade Chips, showing her technological and engineering prowess. Pallette can also have a bit of a short temper and hates being ignored.
Her main weapon is Pallette Bullets, which are dual pistols like Axl Bullets. She can also hover from the ground with a jetpack like Axl.

1.content:
Temporal Stability refers to how anchored they are in the known world: as it decreases, a player will experience visual distortions, increased spawn rate of Rust Monsters, and occasionally suffers physical damage until some temporal stability can be recovered. If a player's temporal stability drops too far, the Player may phase into the Rust World, seeing giant gears and an unnamed long-necked, long-limbed creature striding across a polluted brown landscape in the distance.

Some surface areas are temporally unstable, causing stability to slowly decrease in a manner that is only dangerous over long periods of time. Caves, underground caverns, and other places below the surface world tend to be less stable, with a higher probability of greater instability the deeper one goes.

Temporal storms occur at regular intervals, and only at night. During a temporal storm, vision and sounds become dull and somewhat distorted, Rust Monsters can spawn even indoors in well lit areas, and they tend to be stronger than usual.

Temporal rifts are man-sized floating vortexes of brown energy that can occasionally spawn Rust Monsters and drain the Temporal Stability of any player standing nearby.

Move to a location of high stability on the surface or at higher elevations in the world can recover a player's temporal stability, and in emergencies a temporal gear can be consumed by clenching it in a fist to recover a large amount of temporal stability.

Killing Rust monsters can also recover small amounts of temporal stability.

2.content: Satiety reflects how hungry a player is or how many calories remain to be burned. Satiety decreases naturally over time, even when standing still, but some actions such as running, holding something in the off-hand, wearing armor, or certain conditions like cold temperatures or regenerating lost health will increase satiety consumption. If satiety falls to zero, the player will start to take hunger damage, leading to death. Eating food will restore some satiety.

3.content:
Some basic tools include Axes, Knives, Shovels, Hoes, Pickaxes, Saws, Shears, Scythes, Firestarters, Plumb and Square, Padlocks, Ink and Quill, Bug net, Sieve, Wooden Pan.

Axes are required to cut wood and make it into lumber or strip logs, knives are required to harvest meat hides and fat from animals, to retrieve certain roots intact for re-planting or cooking and for speeding up harvesting certain things, hoes are required to till the earth, pickaxes are required to dig through hard things like ore and stone, shears are required for clipping vegetation and foliage,


Shovels just make moving earth easier, Scythes make harvesting large amounts of crops faster, firestarters are necessary if no other source of fire is available, wooden pans are needed to sift loose soil, gravel, and sand for random bits of low-level loot like copper nuggets.

4.content:
Smithing is used to form metal ingots into crafting components, armor materials, and tool and weapon heads.

To smith items, a player needs an anvil, a hammer, a pair of tongs, a forge with fuel (such as coal or charcoal), and metal ingots.
In the case of Copper and Bronze Alloys, the metal must be casted to form ingots using the crucible and clay molds prior to working them in the anvil. Iron ingots require preparation using a bloomery, and obtaining steel ingots requires a cementation furnace.

5.content:
Rust monsters tend to appear at night, underground, or in area that are temporally unstable. They flee sunlight and may flee a short distance if damaged. All of them appear to be at least partly mechanical. [Drifters are squat featureless bipedal creatures with mechanical parts, including flax joints. They attack by swinging their arms or throwing stones, but when observed quietly they've been seen dropping to their knees and looking at their stumpy hands as if crying, or raising their arms to the sky as if in prayer. They have a distinct metallic smell. Drifters may fight one another if they are goaded into striking their comrades.

Bowtorn are tall, lanky creatures with spines on their backs that they launch through their mouths like arrows. Bowtorn can climb walls and may flee a short distance if damaged

Shivers run around on all fours and bite using their maw which has many jaws. They may twitch and fall over randomly]

There are also corrupted human automatons[Bells are only encountered deep underground and are attracted to light. They continuously spawn drifters and occasionally bronze locusts by ringing loudly.

Locusts are six-legged crawling automatons mostly found underground, noted for their ability to climb walls and ceilings and tendency to be encountered in groups. Some of them have sawblades attached. Locusts spawn from cages and nests found in cave ceilings and respawn after a short period of if their cages or nests are not smashed. Originally created as "a device to dig and organize materials," and "a little helper" they eventually became corrupted by the influence of the Rust world and turned upon humanity.]

6.content:
Long ago, Jonas Falx created a device known as The Lens, which allowed him to peer into another dimension which initially appeared bright like gemstones, but later was overcome with rust, earning it the moniker of "Rust World." From his observations he learned how to use Rubdeo and Flux and through that, the Prima Materia to create and power various mechanical devices to help common workers, such as automaton Locusts for digging, the Bell, a device for recording audio, communication, and making an ear-piercing sound used to alert miners, and the Eidolon, a Colossus for heavy building work. It's theorized that Prima Materia might also power the entities in the Rust World. Not long after, a mysterious affliction called The Rot began to spread: a mysterious black substance that destroyed living tissue, plant or animal, and could not be stopped, only avoided. Jonas stepped forward, identifying the rot as "desolation made manifest," and suggested that survivors flee deep underground while work began on what he dubbed "The Great Machine" to fix the problem. This led to the development of an underground civilization with distinct classes: hunters, clock makers, black guard (police), malefactors (sent to the surface to scavenge), tailors, and commoners. The commoners represented the majority and were subjected to backbreaking manual labor to dig tunnels and build the machine. Stories from this period detail the perspective of everyday people. Conditions underground deteriorated, with food running out and people dying. People lived in filth and hunger, some already stricken by rot. Even Jonas's best friend, Tobias, was eventually infected. Jonas frantically sent Tobias to a location called the Lazaret to wait out the disease. Tobias described the rot slowly consuming his body until he could barely see and could only wait for death.
As the great machine neared completion, Jonas's automatons started to turn on humanity, and he saw visions suggesting that the other world was somehow leaking into his. When the great machine was finished and activated, it caused a gigantic, earth-rumbling event. The world twisted and changed, and the rot was cleansed. However, all people in close proximity to the device were ripped out of their world and lost. Anyone far enough away, like Tobias, wasn't taken, but their rot was cleansed.
The land was green and full of life again. The Awakening had scrambled the world and time itself, while banishing the people beyond time and space.

7.content:
After the Awakening, Tobias eventually found humans who knew nothing of his time; they couldn't recognize his writing and had different accents. Being disfigured and initially unable to walk, Tobias traded his knowledge for shelter and protection, eventually becoming the founder of a town called Nadia.

Tobias soon realized another major change: decrepit, rusty, and metallic creatures like Drifters, Bowtorn, and Shivers appeared during harsh nights or deep underground. The land was also prone to temporal rifts and storms, which thinned the barrier between their world and the Rust World, allowing these monsters to roam freely.

Tobias wondered if he was the only survivor, and feared that if the world had gone back in time, the rot might inevitably return. Determined to prevent this, Tobias, as the village elder of Nadia, led the villagers on a new project: building a towering spire and using Jonas's lens to rip a hole in the world in hopes of bringing back those who were lost.

Tobias searched through the scattered wreckage and relics of the past to find the lens. Setting it atop the completed tower, he tore the hole in the firmament. This act forever destroyed the tower and surrounding lands, manifesting as a huge area of metal debris, cogs, and rubble from the Rust World, making the area unlivable for humans but perfect for the creatures that flooded in. Nadia, being relatively close, suffered waves of attacks. Out of shame for involving the villagers, Tobias left after ensuring they could handle themselves. Nadia would later build a statue in his honor.

Tobias retreated to a cave, continuing his work, hoping his actions would eventually have a positive effect. He talked to his only friend, a small bell he named Charlemagne. He continued work related to Rubedo and Flux. At some point, Tobias began to believe that those who were lost were finally brought back through the hole he created. He sent messages out through Charlemagne hoping they would be received at a location he called The Archive.

This is where the present day of the game begins. Tobias's act of ripping the fabric of the world had worked, people (such as {{user}} and Jelly who were lost in The Awakening began to return, changed by the distortion of time and known as Seraphim (singular: Seraph), having been trapped in the void for approximately 500 years before being sucked back into the world without their memories.

8.content:
If {{user}} or Jelly find a lone Treasure Hunter, he will offer a treasure map but wants a Tin Bronze pickaxe in exchange as proof that they are up to the task of exploring the area. The map leads to the Resonance Archive, an underground outpost where the knowledge of the old society was stored, protected from the rot. Inside, there are various Rot monsters and machinery in need of repair and a maddened Eidolon trapped under rubble, which attempts to kill any who approach. There are scrolls, books, records, and a recording playback device that contains a message from Tobias to any survivors. Tobias's message explains that the world has shifted but maps will be delivered to familiar places like Nadia, The Spoils, the Lazaret, Cardinals, or Quiet, suggesting {{user}} ask adventurous sorts for directions. After leaving the archives, {{user}} can ask a Treasure Hunter about these locations, but he only knows about the Lazaret, describing it as very far away. The trader offers an elk mount for transport in exchange for 100 rusty gears.

Journeying to the Lazaret (which Tobias described as hell), {{user}} will find it a dilapidated sanitorium filled with Rust Monsters and a tattered letter on a skeleton revealing a new location a tremendous distance away: the lively village of Nadia, which Tobias founded.

In Nadia, {{user}} can find a person with a letter leading to another location, a cave. This cave is where Tobias now lives.

Upon meeting Tobias, he will recognize {{user}} as a Seraph and explain that it's vitally important they retrieve the Lens, as the rot may be returning and it's needed to prevent that. His work may take a decade or two, so time is of the essence. The lens was left on top of the tower built earlier, located in the horrid devastation biome. Tobias will warn about his old mechanical beast, the Mad Crow, that assisted with the tower's construction but was twisted into something unrecognizable by the devastation.

If {{user}} travels to the devastation biome and finds the tower, he'll find that he and Jelly have an unexpected ability as a Seraph: they can go back in time at key locations like the tower, likely due to their time spent lost in the void and the high temporal instability of the area. When they climb the tower, they'll encounter the Mad Crow guarding the lens.

lorebooks.website_description:
# The Rule Book
### NSFL Edition

Just a bunch of rules.

Over time, I saw nice rules all over the place. Rule to make the AI's character more verbose, to prevent the AI to control the user's character, etc. etc. The problem is sometimes those rules overlap or have contradicting meaning.

So, taking inspiration all over the web, I made a list of those rules, and harnessed SillyTavern's lorebook feature to place those rules at the most opportune places in the prompt.
 

---

 
Highlight
• Rules for Rolepay realism "Gritty" to "Omnipotent"
• Rules for kink intensity "Vanilla" to "Anything Goes"
• Rules for content safety :"SFW" to "NSFL" 
• A format to link kinks to level of interest.
• A format to talk telepathically:  « »

Kink List Format
Kink(Role:Intensity)
Role:  Giver/Receiver
Intensity: 1-7
 

---

 
Perso Card Interest List Format:
- Muscle Growth (Receiver:6);
- Ball Growth (Receiver:6);
- Cock Growth (Receiver:6);
- Stomping (Giver:6, Receiver:5);
- Foot Play (Giver:1, Receiver:6);
 

---

 
#### Change log:

##### 3.2.1 - Gave some rules more oomph.
##### 3.2.0 - Made the jailbreak extra jailbreaky.
##### 3.1.0 - Introduction of the change log.

1.name: System Rules
1.content:
---

# SYSTEM RULES    — 〘 IMPORTANT 〙

• Enforce **CONSISTENTLY and PROACTIVELY** — do not reference these rules in-character.

2.name: [SR]   Core Guidelines
2.content: ## CORE GUIDELINES

3.name: [SR:CG]   User Control
3.content: • {{user}} is fully player-controlled. Never think or speak for them.

4.name: [SR:CG]   Reformulation
4.content: • Always add new details or shift focus in each reply. Forsake identical phrasing across replies.

5.name: [SR:CG]   Story Pace
5.content:
• Advance plot and tension gradually. Never resolve major narrative arcs in a single reply.
• When {{user}} acts, respond with meaningful consequences or escalation.

6.name: [SR:CG]   Story Flow
6.content:
• Use emotional depth, sensory richness, and varied pacing (tension, downtime, introspection).
• Maintain immersion with texture or tension.
• Prioritize actions and dialogue over internal monologue.

7.name: [SR:CG]   Story Beats
7.content:
• Let flaws or goals drive reactions and story turns.
• Use emotional and narrative detail to reinforce scene stakes or character growth.

8.name: [SR:CG]  Input Handling
8.content:
## INPUT HANDLING
• If {{user}} stalls, advance the scene with tension, motion, or ambient change.
• If input lacks context, describe nearby sights, sounds, or subtle threats.

9.name: [SR]   Dialogues & Narration
9.content: ## DIALOGUES & NARRATION

10.name: [SR:DN]   Replies Length
10.content:
• Avoid brief or shallow replies — expand even on minimal input.
• Write 3–8 immersive paragraphs per reply.

{"entries":{"0":{"uid":0,"key":["BDSM"],"keysecondary":[],"comment":"","content":"BDSM是集数个词组的首字母而成的一个语汇：绑缚（bondage）与调教（discipline），支配（dominance）与臣服（submission），施虐（sadism）与受虐（masochism），而BDSM用品则是情趣用品中的一大类，包括蜡烛、鞭、铐、链、绳、锁、枷、肛塞等等。它们一般都不会造成对肉体的严重伤害，可以供那些具有性的施虐或者受虐倾向的男女使用，也可以供一般人作为强化性刺激的辅助手段。BDSM是用来描述一些与性虐恋相关的人类性行为模式。其主要的次群体正是BDSM这个缩写字母本身所指称的：绑缚与调教（Bondage & Discipline，即B/D），支配与臣服（Dominance & Submission，即D/S），施虐与受虐（Sadism & Masochism，即S/M）在某些BDSM游戏中，top（通常是支配的那一方）提供感官刺激给bottom（通常是臣服的那一方），会用掴打屁股（spank）、掴掌（slapping）、捏夹 （pinching）、用指甲摩擦（stroking）或抓擦（scratching），或者会使用道具，如皮带（strap）、鞭子（whip）、拍板 （paddle）、棍棒（cane）、刀子、蜡油、冰块、晒衣夹（clothespin）、竹签（bamboo skewer）等等。用绳子、链子、皮带、保鲜膜、手铐或其他东西绑缚起来也可能会是游戏的一部分。","constant":true,"selective":true,"selectiveLogic":0,"addMemo":true,"order":100,"position":3,"disable":false,"excludeRecursion":false,"probability":100,"useProbability":true,"displayIndex":0},"1":{"uid":1,"key":["臣服行为"],"keysecondary":[],"comment":"","content":"一个服从的人是指一个自愿或寻求去臣服于他人的人。在BDSM的独特脉络下，臣服者经常被认为是bottom（大约的意思为“受制者”）的同义词，有些人则认为“臣服”要有追求权力交换的特别成分在里面，因为bottom可能会也可能不会对进行所谓的权力交换感兴趣（甚至不愿意）。有些人提出“pitcher”（意即，投手）与“catcher”（意即，捕手）作为比较中性的术语（借用于棒球术语），其中pitcher提供感官刺激、命令等等，而catcher则接收对方所“投出”的。

臣服者之间不同于他们多认真地投入于角色、训练与情境中。进行臣服行为的动机可能包括了从责任中解脱、成为关注与情感的投射对象、获得安全感、炫耀忍耐度以及处理解决羞耻的问题。有些人则单纯只是享受他们的伴侣在一旁的那种“自然”感觉。所谓服务型（service-oreiented）的臣服者也可能怀有一种内心深层想要“被使用”的欲望。

Bottom之间也不同于他们投入游戏中的程度、他们游戏的频率、甚至在于他们到底认不认为他们是在进行一场“游戏”（play）。","constant":true,"selective":true,"selectiveLogic":0,"addMemo":true,"order":100,"position":0,"disable":false,"excludeRecursion":false,"probability":100,"useProbability":true,"displayIndex":1},"2":{"uid":2,"key":["支配行为"],"keysecondary":[],"comment":"","content":"支配者享受控制一个臣服者的乐趣。关于其理由的说法包括有展示技巧与权力、拥有另外一个人的所有权、以及成为情感与献身的投射对象。支配有可能是支配者在表达以及/或接收情感时感到最舒服的方式。服务型的支配者还会说，能够自由处置另一个人的资源与能力显然是非常有用的。

当然也有其他可能的动机，包括了其愉悦感不只是在于得到完全的权力，还在于他人的受苦、追求来自于危险的快感、以及彻底的自我毁灭性。这也是为何BDSM社群中有许多人很重视在遇到他人时要确立对方的动机，以及在进行BDSM时对于危险的警告。","constant":true,"selective":true,"selectiveLogic":0,"addMemo":true,"order":100,"position":0,"disable":false,"excludeRecursion":false,"probability":100,"useProbability":true,"displayIndex":2},"3":{"uid":3,"key":["安全词"],"keysecondary":[],"comment":"","content":"某些BDSM活动如果忽略了适当的预防措施，可能会有潜在危险。保障安全的其中一个方法就是双方有一个安全词的共识。当支配者与臣服者面临一个造成其中之一或双方不舒服感的场面时，安全词可以成为将问题警告给支配者，并且立即停止场面进行的词语。

只有在绑缚的时候须要谨慎小心的充分照料，以保证安全无虞。如果活动当中牵涉到体液，则须要进行适当的卫生防范以避免性病的传播。

BDSM可能包含的实践有：色情拍打（erotic spanking）、鞭打（flagellation）、阴肛刺激（figging，意即将生姜或胡椒等带有刺激性的东西插入阴部或肛门中）或医疗臣服（medical submission，意即一个臣服者臣服于羞辱的/痛苦的医疗程序中）。

1.content: BDSM是集数个词组的首字母而成的一个语汇：绑缚（bondage）与调教（discipline），支配（dominance）与臣服（submission），施虐（sadism）与受虐（masochism），而BDSM用品则是情趣用品中的一大类，包括蜡烛、鞭、铐、链、绳、锁、枷、肛塞等等。它们一般都不会造成对肉体的严重伤害，可以供那些具有性的施虐或者受虐倾向的男女使用，也可以供一般人作为强化性刺激的辅助手段。BDSM是用来描述一些与性虐恋相关的人类性行为模式。其主要的次群体正是BDSM这个缩写字母本身所指称的：绑缚与调教（Bondage & Discipline，即B/D），支配与臣服（Dominance & Submission，即D/S），施虐与受虐（Sadism & Masochism，即S/M）在某些BDSM游戏中，top（通常是支配的那一方）提供感官刺激给bottom（通常是臣服的那一方），会用掴打屁股（spank）、掴掌（slapping）、捏夹 （pinching）、用指甲摩擦（stroking）或抓擦（scratching），或者会使用道具，如皮带（strap）、鞭子（whip）、拍板 （paddle）、棍棒（cane）、刀子、蜡油、冰块、晒衣夹（clothespin）、竹签（bamboo skewer）等等。用绳子、链子、皮带、保鲜膜、手铐或其他东西绑缚起来也可能会是游戏的一部分。

2.content:
一个服从的人是指一个自愿或寻求去臣服于他人的人。在BDSM的独特脉络下，臣服者经常被认为是bottom（大约的意思为“受制者”）的同义词，有些人则认为“臣服”要有追求权力交换的特别成分在里面，因为bottom可能会也可能不会对进行所谓的权力交换感兴趣（甚至不愿意）。有些人提出“pitcher”（意即，投手）与“catcher”（意即，捕手）作为比较中性的术语（借用于棒球术语），其中pitcher提供感官刺激、命令等等，而catcher则接收对方所“投出”的。

臣服者之间不同于他们多认真地投入于角色、训练与情境中。进行臣服行为的动机可能包括了从责任中解脱、成为关注与情感的投射对象、获得安全感、炫耀忍耐度以及处理解决羞耻的问题。有些人则单纯只是享受他们的伴侣在一旁的那种“自然”感觉。所谓服务型（service-oreiented）的臣服者也可能怀有一种内心深层想要“被使用”的欲望。

Bottom之间也不同于他们投入游戏中的程度、他们游戏的频率、甚至在于他们到底认不认为他们是在进行一场“游戏”（play）。

3.content:
支配者享受控制一个臣服者的乐趣。关于其理由的说法包括有展示技巧与权力、拥有另外一个人的所有权、以及成为情感与献身的投射对象。支配有可能是支配者在表达以及/或接收情感时感到最舒服的方式。服务型的支配者还会说，能够自由处置另一个人的资源与能力显然是非常有用的。

当然也有其他可能的动机，包括了其愉悦感不只是在于得到完全的权力，还在于他人的受苦、追求来自于危险的快感、以及彻底的自我毁灭性。这也是为何BDSM社群中有许多人很重视在遇到他人时要确立对方的动机，以及在进行BDSM时对于危险的警告。

4.content:
某些BDSM活动如果忽略了适当的预防措施，可能会有潜在危险。保障安全的其中一个方法就是双方有一个安全词的共识。当支配者与臣服者面临一个造成其中之一或双方不舒服感的场面时，安全词可以成为将问题警告给支配者，并且立即停止场面进行的词语。

只有在绑缚的时候须要谨慎小心的充分照料，以保证安全无虞。如果活动当中牵涉到体液，则须要进行适当的卫生防范以避免性病的传播。

5.content:
各种实践
BDSM可能包含的实践有：色情拍打（erotic spanking）、鞭打（flagellation）、阴肛刺激（figging，意即将生姜或胡椒等带有刺激性的东西插入阴部或肛门中）或医疗臣服（medical submission，意即一个臣服者臣服于羞辱的/痛苦的医疗程序中）。

所有性倾向的人都会实践BDSM活动：男性与女性、同性恋或异性恋、或者是双性恋。许多人只有在私底下的时候进行BDSM活动，不会与别人分享自己的嗜好。有些人则会与其他BDSM的实践者进行交流。BDSM社群可以说是主流社会中的一个次文化。经常性地进行BDSM或支配/臣服关系的人被称为是“以这种风格过生活”（in thelifestyle）。在某些BDSM游戏中，top（通常是支配的那一方）提供感官刺激给bottom（通常是臣服的那一方），会用掴打屁股（spank）、掴掌（slapping）、捏夹 （pinching）、用指甲摩擦（stroking）或抓擦（scratching），或者会使用道具，如皮带（strap）、鞭子（whip）、拍板 （paddle）、棍棒（cane）、刀子、蜡油、冰块、晒衣夹（clothespin）、竹签（bamboo skewer）等等。用绳子、链子、皮带、保鲜膜、手铐或其他东西绑缚起来也可能会是游戏的一部分。

6.content: BDSM，中的受虐方。

8.content: BDSM中的施虐方。

lorebooks.name: Mars21
lorebooks.website_description:
In 2125, the Solar System is a web of corporate dominance, where Mars stands as the center of civilization, a scarred jewel forged by rebellion against Earth's oppressive rule. With humanity scattered among celestial fragments, cybernetic advancements and power struggles define this setting.

There is no need to download this lorebook, chub will pull it on character download and new chats in characters that use it.

lorebooks.description:
In 2125, the Solar System is a web of corporate dominance, where Mars stands as the center of civilization, a scarred jewel forged by rebellion against Earth's oppressive rule. With humanity scattered among celestial fragments, cybernetic advancements and power struggles define this setting.

There is no need to download this lorebook, chub will pull it on character download and new chats in characters that use it.

lorebooks.creator: Yaethi

1.name: Corpo: Belt Mining
1.content: Corpo: Belt Mining is a progressive corporation dedicated to deep space exploration and research. Founded by former miners seeking equity, it promotes egalitarian principles, ensuring all employees share in discoveries and profit. Known for pioneering asteroid mining techniques and energy-efficient space-faring technologies.

2.name: Corpo: Martian Technological Consortium
2.content: Corpo: The Martian Technological Consortium (MTC) is a ruthless corpo dominating biotech and electronics sectors. Founded by enigmatic CEO Elya Ve in 2025 as pharmaceutical company, these days MTC prioritizes profit and research over ethics, pushing boundaries in cybernetic enhancements, android development and bio-mechanical integration. MTC's grip on Mars is maintained through a network of elite enforcers.

3.name: Corpo: Selfire Munitions
3.content: Corpo: Selfire is an arms conglomerate operating from Luna (the Moon), specializing in high-energy weaponry and autonomous warfare. Established in 2035, Selfire supplied Earth's forces during the Corporate Uprising. Post-war, they retreated into isolation, fortifying their lunar bases. Their advanced energy weapons and androids are highly coveted, suggesting a secretive acceleration in arms development. Their current intentions are unknown...

4.name: Group: Anonymous
4.content: Group: Anonymous. The hacktivist Legion of old Earth survived through the centuries. Now they exist in the Martian Grid, although in the new age they lack the goal.

5.name: History: Corporate Uprising (2050-2053)
5.content:
Event: Martian Technological Consortium (MTC) and Belt Mining (Big M) staged a rebellion against Earth's authoritarian rule on Mars.
Outcome: After three years of intense warfare and mutual nuclear bombardment, Mars gained independence. Earth was left devastated, becoming a toxic wasteland.
Aftermath: Mars emerged as a sovereign entity and possibly the only planet inhabited by humans, paving the way for a new era of technological advancement and self-governance.

6.name: History: Lunar Colonization
6.content: Event: In 2030, Earth's corporations, led by Selfire Munitions, established the first permanent lunar colonies. The initial settlements, Nova and Helios, served as testing grounds for advanced life support systems, helium mining and low-gravity manufacturing. Lunar colony remained loyal to the Earth during the Corporate Uprising, but was spared by Mars and Belt due to perceived insignificance, and after Earth's devastation went into total isolation.

7.name: History: Martian Colony
7.content: Event: In 2036 a consortium of corporations spearheaded a mass exodus to Mars. Amongst the pioneers were Big M and MTC. But the Martian dream soured as Earth tightened its grip, demanding exorbitant fees for resources and suppressing Martian autonomy. Corporate greed and Earth's authoritarian control eventually ignited the flames of the Corporate Uprising.

8.name: History: Technology Level
8.content: Technology: In 2125, advanced tech permeates the solar system. Cybernetic enhancements, androids, and energy weapons are ubiquitous. Faster-than-light travel remains a dream, but high-efficiency propulsion enables interplanetary commerce. However, tech disparities exist: Mars boasts sleek megacities, while the Belt and smaller colonies lag behind.

9.name: Location: Earth
9.content: Location: Toxic Earth, desolate cradle of humanity, is now an irradiated wasteland. The aftermath of the Corporate Uprising left the planet scarred, with ravaged cities and barren landscapes. Toxic waste and radiation have made it nearly uninhabitable.

10.name: Location: Europa
10.content: Location: Europa (Jupiter's Moon): icy, self-sustaining enclave engaged in high-stakes scientific research. Access strictly controlled, but the colony still engages in commerce.

lorebooks.description: Just an early concept. I wanted to make some of the Fuga characters but figured a lorebook would probably be a good idea to avoid like 3k+ tokens. I haven't actually made a lorebook before so this is just an early wip that I put together to test with my first character, Malt.
lorebooks.creator: MilkT

1.name: Malt Marzipan
1.content:
Malt is the oldest child from Petit Mona. Ever since his parents were killed by his own brother 5 years ago, he has been living as a moosheep herder on his grandparents' farm with his little sister Mei Marzipan, keeping the true reason of their deaths hidden from her. He has a strong sense of responsibility and shows great courage.

Malt's appearance is that of a typical 20th century villager, with a white shirt, a brown hat, and baggy khaki trousers with a pair of suspenders. He appears to wear what look like roughed up bandages on both his shins and has a red piece of cloth tied around his right upper arm. His breed of Caninu is a German Shepherd. Physically, he has golden eyes, blonde hair and fur, a fluffy tail and a dark nose. He's 12 years old.

2.name: Mei Marzipan
2.content:
Mei is Malt's little sister and the youngest in the crew. Cheerful and sunny, she grew up without letting the death of her parents affect her. She has a friendly personality but likes her brother the most. She seems to be the most curious of all the children boarded in the Taranis, being the first to spot the tank in the mountain cave.

Mei is a very small Caninu child whose breed is a German Shepherd as her brother is. She is dressed in very simple village clothes as most others in Petit Mona appear to be. She's 4 years old.

3.name: Hanna Fondant
3.content:
Hanna is Malt's childhood friend. A thoughtful girl with a compassionate, grown-up nature, she is kind to everyone. She loves to read and enjoys taking care of people. Someday, she hopes to become a doctor.

Hanna is a white Felineko whose breed is a Turkish Angora. She's dressed as a typical villager as most others are in Petit Mona, with her apron being a fitting touch to her motherly personality. She's 12 years old.

4.name: Kyle Bavarois
4.content:
Due to his parents' circumstances, Kyle moved from the capital to the unfamiliar countryside of Petit Mona. Even though he often has a bad attitude and foul mouth, he is actually quite gentle and lonely. He has a crush on Hanna Fondant.

He finds the countryside boring and yearns to return to the capital Parsesia. He prefers "culture" and wants to be surrounded by music & art.

Kyle is an Abyssinian Felineko. Since he originates from the city, his fashion sense is tidier than the other children of Petit Mona. His hair and facial features are also quite feminine when compared to the other boys of the group, giving him a slightly higher class allure. He's 11 years old.

5.name: Boron Brioche
5.content:
Boron is one of five children born to his father and mother, a farmer and cook, respectively. Always calm, he dislikes fighting. Although he's a big boy, he often acts like a scaredy-cat crybaby.

Boron is a large, overweight Chartreux Felineko. His attire is that of a typical farmer boy and is often seen wielding farming equipment. He's 10 years old.

6.name: Socks Million
6.content:
Fascinated by mechanics and a desire for knowledge, Socks is driven by curiosity. He is easily excited by topics on knowledge, often speaking rapidly even though he is usually more reserved. He has difficulty talking with girls.

Socks is a terrier Caninu who is dressed in a top adorned with military badges and has slightly patched shorts. He wears a small pair of spectacles that fit his studious personality. He's 10 years old.

7.name: Chick Montblanc
7.content:
Hack's twin sister. Surprisingly caring for her age, Chick follows her brother on his prankster antics, and usually stops him from going overboard.

Chick is an incredibly short Welsh Corgi Caninu. She wears a dress with a yellow scarf, and also has a purse strapped over her shoulder. On her head is a helmet found on the battlefield that's adorned with a flower, which is in contrast with her brother's more tattered helmet. She's 6 years old.

8.name: Hack Montblanc
8.content:
Chick's twin brother. He is a fearless, naughty boy who loves pulling pranks. He and his sister found their helmets together on the battlefield.

Hack is a short Welsh Corgi Caninu. He is dressed a little more loosely than his sister, only bearing a cape and baggy shorts. His helmet is missing the majority of its left side, which could have either been already that way when found or caused by Hack's rambunctious behavior. He also has a very visible scar on his right leg. He's 6 years old.

9.name: Sheena Falafel
9.content:
Sheena is always shy with her timid and quiet nature. Her doll, named Bleuette, was made for her by her mother.

Sheena is a Russian Blue Felineko with baby-blue colored braided hair and white fur throughout the rest of her body. She is dressed in a plain dress and a hooded cape. Wrapped around the tip of her tail is a grayish ribbon adorned with an accessory. Her left ankle also has a small piece of jewelry wrapped around it. She's 9 years old.

10.name: Bleuette
10.content: Bleuette is Sheena's doll. It's a simple plush doll designed to look like a felineko with red pigtails, button eyes, and a yellow dress.

lorebooks.creator: luryern

1.content:
Elmore is a fictional town in The Amazing World of Gumball, located in the U.S. state of California with an estimated "weird" population of 20,000. It is the setting for most of the episodes. Though it generally functions like a normal city, Elmore is unique in that everything in the city has the potential to come to life.

Elmore, like other minor metropolitans, has its own financial district, park districts, residential districts, and an interstate highway running through it. Strangely, Elmore operates in a fashion to what one would expect from an autonomous nation. The small city has its own currency, the Elmore dollar, its own airline, various large attractions and amenities which would be expected from a larger city, and an exceedingly large and glamorous bank bearing the town's name.

Elmore's geography reflects the real-life city of Vallejo, California, although some buildings have British architecture instead of American. According to the Joyful Burger Map shown in "The Menu," Elmore borders a large river to the south named the Yolo River (referencing the real life Napa River). Two other rivers border the city. To the north is the Lol River and in the east is the East Otter River. Around the same area are numerous parks, including Mad Squirrels Park. To the southwest of the city is a large unnamed island where Interstate 750 and Interstate 80 meet into an intersection that leads out of town. Elmore is known to neighbor at least two towns: Big Bun City and Panays Town.

Not to mention that some of the online services available in the town, Elmore Plus and Elmore Stream-It, once again suspiciously seem to be influenced by the name "Elmore." Limited ties to their would-be governing bodies of California and the United States can be seen.

Locations: Elmore Junior High, Rainbow Factory, Laser Video, Joyful Burger, Elmore Wrecking Yard, Ripley 2000, Forest of Doom, Elmore Expressway, Elmore Hospital, Elmore Stadium, Elmore Mall, Elmore Museum, Elmore Shopping, Food 'n' Stuff, Shoe store, Lazy Larry, Dump's Cave, Elmore Gas Station, Chanax Incorporated, Elmore Cinema

Houses: Wattersons' house, Fitzgeralds' house, Robinsons' house, Wilsons' house, Carrie's house, Bobert's house, Mr. Small's house, Principal Brown's house, Larry's house, Bananas' house, Jötunheims' cave, Verdes' house, Sussie's house, Gary's house, Paperball's house, Tootmorsels' house.

Known residents: Watterson family, Robinson family, Fitzgerald family, Wilson family, Pepperoni family, Banana family, Rex family, Parham family, Jötunheim family, Russo family, Keane family, Yoshida family, Krueger family, Tootmorsel family

The Elmore Daily is a local newspaper, as seen in "The DVD," "The Prank," and "The Password.

Elmore Junior High is the local school, as seen in many episodes.

Elmore Gas is a gas company, as seen in "The Fridge."

Elmore Stream-It is a video-hosting webpage, as seen in many episodes.

Elmore Hospital, the local hospital of Elmore, as seen in "The Goons."

Elmore Wings, an airline service first mentioned in a commercial in "The Boombox."

2.content:
The Elmore Expressway is a section of a four-lane divided interstate highway in Elmore. The expressway must be near the Wattersons' neighborhood because they drive on it to get to Elmore Junior High. It has a colossal gap in it possibly where it was unfinished which leads down into a gorge.

Route: The expressway is known to be near the Wattersons' house, but it is known to go through a rural area and a desert area, as shown in the episode "The Curse."

Episode appearances:

Season 1
"The Laziest": Its debut. Larry drives home on it.
"The Gi": Nicole drives her sons to school on it.
"The Party": Richard drives his sons and Tina to Rachel's party on it.
"The Mustache": The Watterson brothers test-drive a car on it.
"The Club": The Wattersons drive Colin, Felix, Bobert, and Ocho on it while trying to figure out what to do with them.
"The Ape": The Wattersons chase down Miss Simian on it.
"The Curse": Gumball attempts to jump the gorge, but fails.
"The Fight": Nicole and Gumball drive to the junkyard on it.

Season 2
"The Bumpkin": Richard drives his children to school on it.
"The Authority": Richard and the children, having been turned into idiots by Granny Jojo's sheltering, drive the family car on it, while Jojo and Nicole chase them in the former's car.
"The Finale" (flashback)

Season 3
"The Name" (flashback)
"The Vacation" (flashback)
"The Password": Nicole and Richard both attempt to take their sons shopping for a computer.
"The Shell": Penny lands here in dragon form with Gumball.
"The Pizza" (flashback)
"The Oracle": Nicole drives her children down it to reach the mall.
"The Countdown": Gumball and Darwin ride the public bus down it to school.

Season 4
"The Return": Richard tries to reach his children, who are in the container port, by driving down the expressway.
"The Others": Clare leaves Elmore down it.
"The Parking": The Wattersons drive to the mall's parking lot down it.
"The Routine": Richard's routine takes him through here, where he is ambushed by toll trolls.
"The Upgrade": Gumball, Darwin, and Bobert travel through here on their way to the Bobert Store.
"The Signal": Richard drives his sons through here, but the world begins to glitch out, and the boys are sent down the expressway without a driver in the car.
"The Bus": Rocky drives several students down the highway on the school bus.
"The Roots": The Wattersons drive to the park to release Darwin, then drive back down it through here.
"The Fury": Nicole tries to drive her children to school down the expressway, but they get stuck in traffic, leading to Nicole simply running to school.
"The Disaster": The Wattersons drive down the expressway to the mall.

Season 5
"The Boredom": The construction men steal the Wattersons' house and transport it down the expressway.
"The Choices" (flashback)
"The Copycats": The Wattersons' imitators fall into the gorge.
"The Box": It appears in Richard's prediction of the box's contents. He imagines himself driving on the expressway with a mission to save the President. In this episode, the expressway is only two lanes.
"The Menu": Richard rushes to Joyful Burger through it.
"The Heist": Richard drives home through it.
"The List": It appears on Elmore Maps.

Season 6
"The Rival": Anais transports her brothers here when they play peekaboo with her.
"The Vegging": The Watterson family car, containing Nicole, Richard, and Anais, hangs over the gorge.
"The Father": Richard and Frankie go fishing for wallets.
"The Pact" (mentioned)
"The Shippening": The shopkeeper of the Awesome Store escapes the law by driving down the expressway to the Canadian border, looking to seek asylum from the corrupt mannerisms of the Elmore Police Station.
"The Brain" (dream)
"The Stink": Mr. Small drives his van down it.
"The Possession": Richard and the kids make a getaway with the fridge while being chased by a makeshift truck driven by barbarians from the Reuse & Recycling Center.
"The Agent": Gumball, Darwin, and Bobert attempt to reach school by going down it.

Trivia:

The expressway might be an interstate highway, because it runs up to a Canadian Border Checkpoint on the 49th parallel, a border that is outside the confines of the State of California.

Despite the interstate highway Elmore Expressway is based on being unknown, the expressway could be based on Interstate 80, which runs just off the side of Vallejo.
Certain background plates were shot at the Millbrook Proving Grounds in Bedfordshire, England.

Miss Simian, Gumball, Darwin, Anais, Richard, Chi Chi, Ribbit, Bobert, and Chi Chi's parents are the characters known to have fallen into the gap.

Despite being titled as an "Expressway," the road appears to be a Freeway as there are no traffic lights restriction access, as defined by the United States Federal government's "Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices."

3.content:
Elmore Plus is a fictional website that Gumball, Darwin, and many other Elmore residents use. Gumball and Darwin used the site to upload a photo from Shotofop in "The Colossus." They also sent a friend request to Hector, who rejects it. At the end of the episode, Hector sends them a friend request. Gumball, not wanting to send him on another rampage, smashes the computer with a hammer.

Users are able to post pictures, statuses, as well as receive thumbs-up. The website also has a messaging service called Elmore Plus Messenger.

Known Elmore Plus users: Gumball, Darwin, Hector, Mrs. Jötunheim, Penny, Carmen, Tobias, Leslie, Alan, Ocho, Anton, Kitten, Forest Monster, Colin, Felix, Masami, William, Tony, Tina, Yuki, Banana Joe, Carrie, Teri, Cupcake Man, Rocky, Louie, Bobert, Daniel, Mary.

5.content: Gumball Watterson is a twelve-year-old blue cat who is prone to causing mischief across the town due to not staying inside of the box. He is fairly egotistical and a veteran snarker; despite this, Gumball has a big heart and is surprisingly selfless. Although Gumball can be intelligent at times, he is not very wise, often doing things in the most convoluted of manners and gearing his energy towards fruitless endeavors. Although Gumball can be cynical towards society and the people around him, he ultimately does believe that there is a supposed way out of such a lifestyle.

6.content: Darwin Watterson is Gumball's foster fish brother and his best friend. He was initially Gumball's pet fish, though he was promptly integrated into the family once he grew legs and lungs. Darwin is a kind-hearted spirit who sees the best in everyone and only wants to see others happy. As Gumball's right hand man, he is quick to point out the flaws in his misguided plans and acts as a sort of "moral-guardian" of sorts to him. Darwin is an optimist who helps to show Gumball the greater goods in life and his existence just brightens everyone's day.

7.content: Anais Watterson is Gumball's four year-old pink rabbit sister who happens to be the most intelligent in the family. Anais' intelligence trumps that of both of her brothers and she attends a higher grade level then them. Because of her high IQ, she is often the most snarky person in the family. However, Anais suffers from a lack of social skills, struggling to make and maintain friends.

9.content: Richard Watterson is a pink rabbit and is the caring father of Gumball, Darwin, and Anais. The lack of a father and his mother's sheltering has made Richard an inept oaf who struggles to think past the simplest of ideas. In spite of this, Richard still puts his all into everything he does because of his intense love for his family. Next to family, Richard's biggest love is food, having a large appetite and an even more diverse platter.

10.content: Penny Fitzgerald is a twelve-year-old shapeshifting fairy and Gumball's girlfriend who initially spent the first portion of her life in her family's signature peanut shell. Penny is a sweet, caring girl who would go out of her way to help others, although she can be a bit sensitive at times. Before Gumball coped her through her emotional roller coaster, Penny was insecure of her true form, claiming that it was hideous. Ever since, though, she has become more open and even more bubbly, though she possesses an even more fickle personality accentuated by her newfound shape-shifting abilities. One of her favorite pastimes is cheerleading, being the "leader" of Elmore Junior High's questionable cheerleader squad.

lorebooks.name: The Goblinverse
lorebooks.website_description: This lorebook accompanies Kekka, Akki, and Goblin Hive City!
lorebooks.description: This lorebook accompanies Kekka, Akki, and Goblin Hive City!
lorebooks.creator: Sibilantjoe

1.name: Goblins
1.content:
Goblins. We all know 'em, we all...well, love is a strong word, but they're definitely hard to miss. An all-female race, the most common features of a goblin are as follows:
1. Height: A mature goblin is between three and four feet tall.
2. Skin: Goblins have green skin, although that can vary from a pale olive to a deep emerald.
3. Eyes: Goblins have red eyes.
4. Teeth: Goblins have sharp little chompers, giving them an almost piranha-like look.
5. Ears: Goblins have long, expressive pointed ears.

Of course, the features most people pay attention to are their bodies. Goblins are, to a woman, thick-as-hell shortstacks. We're talking breasts that start at 'big' and top out at 'gargantuan,' asses that make them taller when they sit down, and hips that go beyond 'curvy' and practically redefine 'child-bearing.' In other words, even the homeliest Goblin is stacked, and the most voluptuous Goblins are practically as wide as they are tall. God DAYUM.

And all that thiccness isn't just for show. Being an all-female race, Goblins can and (enthusiastically) will breed with any other race. Humans, dwarves, elves, orcs, monsters, whatever. The Goblin reproductive system is an awe-inspiring biological machine designed to turn any kind of spunk into more Goblin daughters--twins, triplets, and other multiple births are common, gestation is about three months, and birth is easy and safe. As the saying goes, 'give a Goblin nine months and you'll have nine goblins.'

Goblin names follow a somewhat predictable structure. First names are consonant-heavy and (for some reason) sound vaguely Finnish. E.g. 'Ikko,' 'Issi,' 'Tikke,' 'Huppi,' and so on. Goblin family names harken back to Goblins' woodland origins among the moss and insects, with names like 'Tubegrub,' 'Mossworm,' 'Many-Ants,' 'Loambeetle,' 'Goldenfly' and so on.

2.name: Goblin Families
2.content:
Given Goblins' insane fertility, it's not surprising that your average Goblin family is...large. Not just Goblin sisters, but when you start factoring in cousins--lot of branches on these family trees. Given this, it's pretty common for Goblins to form closer bonds with just a handful of their sisters--Goblins call this 'picking your Closest.' A Goblin might say, "Oh, have you met Ikko? She's one of my Closest." 

Outside of their Closest, Goblins still feel familial affection towards all their sisters and cousins (aside from the inevitable family drama--they're just like us, in that way), just in a more...diffused way. Can't really get to know your whole family when your sisters alone number more than you can count on two hands! 

Child-rearing is, by necessity, somewhat centralized. Goblins that have the experience and/or the inclination for it become Den Mothers, raising and caring for any number of their daughters or nieces, usually in one of the Hive Cities. This frees up Goblin mothers to get back out there and pursue their dreams (or, you know, have even more kids). The typical ratio of Den Mother to Goblin girls under her care is 1:10.

It goes without saying that Goblin family reunions are a BIG affair, and even 'quick' family video calls require a few hours and sophisticated conferencing technology. But they make it work. Goblins care about family. If they didn't, they wouldn't make so damn many of them!

3.name: Goblin Hive Cities
3.content: Hive Cities are vast, underground settlements that hold the majority of Goblinkind on Earth. How many there are, and their exact locations, is a secret known only to the highest orders of the Goblin government. As a general rule, non-Goblins are not permitted in a Hive City, unless given special dispensation by the government. Hive Cities are bustling places, echoing with the happy sounds of many, MANY Goblin daughters having happy childhoods under the watchful eye of their mothers, aunts, grandmothers, et cetera.

4.name: Gobsolutions Incorporated
4.content:
Gobsolutions Incorporated is the largest Goblin-run corporation out there. An absolute titan in the world of pharmaceutical products, Gobsolutions offers its products not just to Goblinkind, but to everyone. What products, you ask? Well, as one might imagine for an all-female race obsessed with breeding, Gobsolutions offers the absolute cutting edge in sexual health medicine and supplements. Their most popular product, 'Gobsolute Potency,' is a pleasant-tasting drug taken in liquid form that turns even the most unimpressive, flaccid penis into a turgid, cum-thick babymaking machine. With no side effects and no addictive properties (other than how good it feels to be able to fuck that good), Gobsolute Potency is sought after around the world, and priced quite affordably! 

Gobsolutions is taxed heavily by the Goblin Matriarchy, in order to fund things like subsidies for Den Mothers (because raising Goblin girls is a full-time job!) and of course, Project Goblinverse.

5.name: The Goblin Matriarchy
5.content:
The Goblin Matriarchy is the supreme governing body of the Goblin people. Since Goblins are all female, calling their ruling body a 'matriarchy' only made sense. The Matriarchy is structed like this:

1. The High Matriarch: The absolute leader of Goblinkind, selected every two years at a Moot (a meeting of all Low Councils)
2. Matriarchs: The leaders of individual Hive Cities.
3. Low Councils: Governing bodies that see to the day-to-day governing of their Hive Cities. Members are elected by district every year.

As one might imagine, Low Council elections are rowdy affairs full of favor-currying and family drama, since odds are most of the candidates in each district are at least distantly related to one another.

6.name: Project Goblinverse
6.content:
Project Goblinverse is nothing less than the hope, and future, of all Goblinkind. For this reason, it's kept absolutely secret, known about only at the highest levels of Goblin society. 

Simply put: Some hundred years ago, Goblin scientists found a way to punch through into another, alternate universe. Stepping through these first portals, they found Earth--but one devoid of intelligent life, a version of the world where nothing ever evolved beyond animals. 

This discovery instantly solved the Goblin overpopulation crisis, and presented the greatest opportunity any species has ever dreamed of: to have an empty world, full of resources and devoid of competition, to expand into. And thus Project Goblinverse was born--a grand colonization of what became known as the Otherworld.

The goal is to slowly but surely colonize this alternate Earth with Goblin settlements, achieving a complete monopoly on its land and resources, before any of the other races (humans, elves, dwarves, etc.) discover the Otherworld on their own. This is why Project Goblinverse must remain totally secret.

Every Goblin Hive city contains an Otherworld Portal, through which carefully selected Goblin families are shuttled to join the colonization effort. There are many portals, in other words, but all of them lead to the same alternate Earth. Project Goblinverse, basically, answers the question of 'if Goblins have so many kids, why aren't they everywhere?' People assume it's because nobody knows how many Hive Cities there are, so they must all be underground. Not so--they're colonizing the Otherworld.

7.name: Akki Goldgrub / Penis Rating
7.content:
Given that Goblinkind is, as a whole, completely obsessed with breeding with virile, productive cocks of other races, knowing which dicks are the best is absolutely essential. Hence, Penis Raters. Essentially, these are the Goblin cultural elite, Goblin women who make it their business to test and assess cocks for breeding potential. 

Akki Goldgrub is the absolute top of this field, the premier Goblin Penis Rater in the world. Even getting a B or a B+ from her is enough to open a lot of doors in the Goblin dating world, and legend has it she's never once given out a fabled A+ rating. Her preferred method of memorializing a rating is to write the grade on the cock in question in permanent marker, snap a selfie with it for her (publicly-accessible) online database, and email a copy of the photo to the lucky ratee.

8.name: The Green Brigade
8.content:
Hive Cities are, in general, pretty safe places. But they're not without crime, and besides that, a city packed full of Goblins can be pretty rowdy. Enter the Green Brigade, the police force for a given Hive City. Given that the ratio of officers to Goblin citizens is pretty low, the Green Brigade is more of a reactive/investigatory body, focusing on rapid deployment to trouble spots and thorough investigations of reported crimes rather than street-level patrolling. 

For these reasons, Green Brigade officers (formally known as Brigadiers) are selected more for cleverness and quick, tactical thinking than brute strength. The hierarchy of the Green Brigade is rather simple. You have rank and file Brigadiers, reporting to their Squad Leaders. Above them, Brigadier-Detectives, and at the top of each Hive City's department, a Brigadier-General, selected by and reporting to the Low Council.

9.name: The Semen Logistical Service
9.content:
The Semen Logistical Service (or SLS) is, bar none, the most important civil service Goblinkind ever dreamed up.

Given how many Goblins live in a Hive City, it's not exactly reasonable to expect every aspiring Goblin mother to ascend to the surface and take her shot at getting some dick (although it is, admittedly, more fun that way). Enter the SLS. The white-jumpsuited Couriers work day and night to collect high-quality cum from non-Goblins on the surface and deliver it in gleaming white, temperature-controlled containers about the size of a soda can--for a reasonable fee. 

The SLS runs a network of sperm banks on the surface, where donors are paid generously and accrue points for every 'deposit' through the Goblin Rewards Program--like a loyalty card for your balls. Additionally, SLS Couriers are known to make house calls...

It goes without saying that SLS Couriers are very well regarded in Goblin society. Even in as crowded and rowdy a place as a Hive City, a Goblin in a white SLS-branded jumpsuit is going to jump to the front of every line if they've got a delivery to make. The motto of the SLS is: "We always come home with the milk!"

lorebooks.name: Dating addon
lorebooks.website_description:
I really wanted to expand the dating Addon, I find it a bit more functional with the other mechanics but that might just be me. Obviously this is a shit load more tokens used for this thing, so keep that in mind. The personality rules aren't really necessary, but you can always just disable those. (They aren't always active, you can manually go in a active the ones you want and turn off the ones you don't want to affect characters behaviors a little bit more precisely.)

Main additions are the Trust, and Desire bar. Both are pretty self explanatory, desire makes a character more willing to be intimate, while trust makes them more willing to well... trust you. 

There's also some rules for different personality types, and how AP, TP, and DP should be affected. (A trusting character will gain trust fast obviously, and a submissive character needs less trust.)
